story:
The Project is Not Just a Game!

From Ashes has been in the making for about a year now, getting all the assets right and prototyping different weapon configurations, animations ect. During this time and for some time before this a family became ill so I am going to donate 15% of all profit to the MS Society that help thousands of people with Multiple Sclerosis every year. (the 15% will be from profits on release not from backers)

Not enough game developers donate to charities and I am going to change try that by setting an example as you will see in our pictures and in our gallery.

The Project Details

From Ashes is a survival horror game based in a hospital for the mentally insane and mortally wounded, but the hospital has a secret… genetically modified experiments have broken loose. Your mission is to hold them back and stop them tearing the city apart, but beware they may be more of a hand full than you first think. 

(Bold features has further detail below)

A.I. That Learns

The Artificial Intelligence in "From Ashes" will react to the player and change its tactics based on how you face them. if you try avoid dark areas or enclosed spaces then the threat will use this against you. Also, based on if you are skittish or trigger happy while exploring the map and facing the threat the A.I. is more likely to run after you.The A.I. vary dramatically from one to another in looks and in behaviour.


Real Time Bullet Ballistics

This will be used to make the player choose how they play and make them more skilled due to the fact the they will need to take in to consideration: calibre, weight, velocity, distance, material (if shooting through walls etc.) and if the projectile is not a bullet then the shape will have to be taken into consideration as all of these will vary the performance of the bullet and can be the difference between life and death.

Through a plasterboard wall the direction of the bullet will be altered slightly. However, through sheet steel (thickness depending) the round will deform and the velocity will be dampened greatly.

Ammunition Usage  

This is a major subject as unlike the majority of FPS games where if you reload with half a magazine you keep the rounds. We intend to alter this trend among the gaming community by having a 'use what you have' approach. If you reload after a single shot then that ammunition that was spare in the magazine will be lost. So ammunition conservation is a must if you wish to survive.

Weapon Upgrades 

Before you think of it, no we do not mean useless gold paint. We mean you get to fit attachments that can both help and hinder you in the game. These attachments range from sights and scopes; muzzle brakes; extended magazines and bullet types (Incendiary, Armour piercing, Exacto...)  . We will add as many upgrades as possible to offer you as many different unique play styles as possible and we are open to suggestions!


Destructible Maps

Like newer AAA games offer the ability to obliterate walls and other solid structures, we too are giving you this feature, but where you could only take certain walls out or break certain objects, our game will offer the ability to take any wall out and any object. However, the more walls you destroy the more unstable buildings will get. Don’t be scared of taking a few walls down as you never know what lies behind a wall or a locked door.

Game/physics Engine

The reason we used Unreal Engine is for the streamlined visual scripting and the fantastic visuals that are nearly effortless as well as having Nvidia Physx already integrated in the engine. Taking advantage of these points makes for fast development that is bug free (nearly). If you aren't familiar with the engine then this will help. The Unreal Engine


Compatibility/ System Specs

This will be aimed at Windows operating systems for the time being but we have Linux and Mac in mind.
Realistic requirements at the moment would be:
  • Duel core @ 3GHz or Greater 
  • 4GB RAM
  • GTX 760 or Equivalent 
  • Windows 7 or greater


The Story

In the late 1950's the lab technicians of a hospital captured a creature that was one of a kind. Massively intelligent, fast and as fierce as can be. 

They began taking samples of the specimen to study; soon after they started trials to mix the DNA of the creature and other living things. However, all subjects inherited intelligence and rage with side effects.

The hospital was decommissioned soon after and the creatures were left to their own devices. You are the person they send in to clean up the mess and you're good at what you do but nothing can really prepare you for this.

What We Need & What You Get

We need the funds to submit our game to Steam to get it Greenlit and for animators to animate our 'monsters' I personally can animate but not to the level of quality this game deserves as well as some other things

In a little bit more detail the animator that we used for the video is called Massimo Di Antonio. He found me when I posted the animation position on Freelancer.co.uk. I asked him to donate 3 full animations instead of being paid properly for them and if they were good there would be more work and that is exactly what he did! (to leave a review on the site it is a £10 minimum)


More features being: 

  • Dynamic weather
  • Day & Night
  • Back stories to all creatures including multiple variations of each

To find out what the next step is you'll just have to help us get there!

Modding support would cover things like weapons, characters/creatures and a level editor to make your own experience. 



Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk is that we don't get fully funded (we will get done as much as we can with the money raised but it will take longer to to release the game).

Other risks are that upon getting funded we run into a problem while scripting From Ashes but after several years making little games even for myself in Unreal Engine I'm pretty confident that I can either fix or work round any issues that may materialise.

But with all you support I'm certain that we will do great!


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute and we understand that! If you would still like to help out then you can:

  • Share this everywhere you can
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools mercilessly! 
  • Ask us about anything we haven't covered to help out other backers or just what you want to know

story:
Customizable Ticker

  • The ticker shows live real time scores for all of the games in which an individual or organization is participating.
  • The ticker will be viewable on all devices like mobile phones, tablets, smart televisions, and laptops/desktops.
  • The ticker is configurable to display on the top, bottom, left, or right of their device and the grouping of data is customizable per game or sport.

Customizable Dashboard
The dashboard will allow users to create custom views of scoring data in formats that aggregate all common fantasy data together or keep each individual league's data separate.

Access your fantasy scores on-the-go with your preferred mobile device.

App Store
Google Apps





We need support with funding the following items:

→  Subscribe to Live Data Feeds from Sportradar US - Initially we plan to launch with six sports (NFL, NBA, MLB, NHL, Soccer, PGA), and we want to use the highest-quality data available. Since Sportradar US is the provider of NFL Exclusive game play-by-play data that is utilized by most large fantasy sport providers, we want to be able to use their data also to ensure accuracy in our scores.

→  Purchase Additional Hardware - We plan to purchase additional server capacity, routers, and firewalls for increased bandwidth and security.

→  Invest in additional testing SW and independent testers - We want to ensure our system can handle the projected load and maintain high performance. We want to purchase additional SW and employ independent testers to do robust performance and capacity testing to ensure our system is stable and able to handle the projections of system load.

Product Monthly Cost Annual Cost Ordering
Individual User:
Ticker Only		 $1.49 $9.99
PRE ORDER
Induvidual User:
Ticker and Dashboard		 $2.49 $19.99
PRE ORDER
League Level 1:
25 teams or less		 $3.49 $39.99
PRE ORDER
League Level 2:
26 to 100 teams		 $9.99 $99.99
PRE ORDER
League Level 3:
101 to 300 teams		 $29.99 $299.99
PRE ORDER

If you have an account with more than 300 teams, we can offer you custom pricing. Contact us and we will help you subscribe.

Development Timeline

Our efforts are focused on application software development and prototyping Fantasy Provider APIs and Sports Radar US live data feed APIs to ensure we offer you a high-quality experience. Our development team is divided into three groups:

  • Web Application Development and Backend Infrastructure Development
  • iOS Development team
  • Android Application/Smart TV development
Development Timeline

The high level milestones are defined below:


Promotions/Perk Advantages

We have two promotions that are detailed below:

  • Selfie Challenge - Show you're a FANatic with our Selfie Challenge. Take a selfie wearing our Fanatic T-shirt, tag @FanaticScores, and post on Facebook, Twitter or Instagram (#FanaticScores, #Fanatic Score Challenge). Available only to $100- and $200-level contributors. Monthly winners will be chosen at random to receive Fanatic cash and prizes valuing up to $1000! This promotion will be active for six months, and the winners will be featured on the Fanatic Scores website, www.fanaticscores.com, and on our Facebook and Twitter pages. Check out the example below:
  • Alpha and Beta testing accounts will be provided to users who purchase perks that allow testing by clicking Alpha and Beta Testing Request
    • Users should provide their First Name, Last Name and email address along with the type of testing they want to complete.
    • The Fanatic Scores team will provide you a link and account access to begin testing.
Risks and Challenges

We are confident that with your support we will launch Fanatic Scores before the NFL football season kicks off. We want as many fantasy football participants as possible to take advantage of the convenience of monitoring their league scores with one application. Contributions are going towards product development so that we can meet our Launch Dates defined above. There are only two risks inherent to this project:

  • Not being able to get partnerships in place with all the major fantasy sports providers to ensure user desired sports fantasy site scores can be present on our application. To mitigate this risk, we are:
    • Establishing partnerships that will grant access to the necessary APIs
    • Developing other methods that allow users to easily provide the necessary data
    • Having users petition Fantasy Sports providers to allow Fanatic Scores to get their (the Fans) data via site emails, trouble tickets, and social media campaigns
  • Missing our 8/31/16 planned launch date due to finding a big issue during testing. To mitigate this risk, we are:
    • Following software development and infrastructure best practices for developing real-time data systems.
    • Increasing capacity and hardware scalability.
    • Providing early Alpha and Beta testing with expanded audiences and software generated loads.

story:
WINDOWS | MAC

 

Grumpy Witch: Emilia’s Revenge is a high-flying magical adventure where your choices affect gameplay and story. Emilia is a young, powerful witch—until she’s stripped her magic by the evil sorceress Fonelle, who exiles Emilia and her forest home into a strange new dimension. Emilia will have to battle her way through hordes of Fonelle’s minions if she wants to set things right, and more so if she wants to recover her broom and her hat!







Wallpapers

A pack of four wallpapers - plus variants! - for your computer, tablet, or cell phone. 

Digital Game Code

One digital download code for the platform of your choice: PC, Mac, or Linux. PS4, Xbox One, and mobile platforms will be made available as the relevant stretch goals are unlocked. 

Artbook

Dive into Emilia's world with a full-color artbook packed to the brim with concepts, character designs, game art, and behind-the-scenes insights!

Original Soundtrack (OST)

Groove to Tim Sheehy's original soundtrack in MP3 format. The physical OST comes in a handsome sleeve on cutting-edge CD technology!

Sticker Sheets

Stick 'em anywhere that needs some grumping up!

Holographic Mini-Prints

Add a touch of grump to your home or office with these stylish prints. Featuring all-new pieces from our talented art team, exclusively available through our Indiegogo campaign!

Keychain

Emilia's frowning face is your added incentive never to misplace those car keys. 

Pencil Box

Bring a touch of magic to your art supplies with this adorable pencil case!

Lanyard

Because even sorceresses sometimes need to keep track of their ID. Great for cons!

Cell Phone Charm

Emilia and her Batkin friend keep your smartphone safe from any sinister powers!

T-Shirt

Display your allegiance to Team Emilia by wearing the Grumpy Witch logo while you're out and about! 
 


Batkin Pendant

Produced by our friends at Optimystical Studios, these hand-crafted pieces measure 1.5" and feature Emilia's favorite flying foe. Hang it from a cord or chain, and you've got one happy, flappy piece of jewelry!
 


Chynna Clugston Flores "Bleu Emilia" Art Print

This exclusive print from three-time Eisner Award nominee Chynna Clugston Flores (Gotham Academy/Lumberjanes, Queen Bee, Scooter Girl) sees Emilia and company trading places with the cast of Chynna's classic coming-of-age series, Blue Monday! 
 


Desktop Standees

Brighten (or darken) up your workspace with this 18" acrylic Emilia standee!
 


 

The world of Grumpy Witch is populated by a wide range of weird and wonderful characters. Here's just a few of the faces you can expect to encounter on your journey through Galice: 

Emilia Sorelda vam Quis: Twelve years old. Incredibly precocious, very grumpy. (Surprise!) Looking for some peace and quiet, Emilia took up residence in the forests of Mount Albans two years back. Now her Hat, which has been in the family for centuries, has been stolen, and her home transformed into a floating island. This is what you might consider rude. Emilia certainly does, and she will not have it.

Fonelle, Witch Queen of Galice: The cause of all Emilia’s problems. Using the magic of the Emilia’s Hat, Fonelle has created a magical land combining pieces of several other realms - including a chunk of Emilia's homeworld, Alderland, on which our heroine now finds herself stranded. 

Barbinus: A fat, greedy spirit that has taken up residence in Emilia’s oven. A font of magic and knowledge, Barbinus will give Emilia items and information in exchange for cakes and other goodies.

Mala Meia: Shrewd and calculating, Mala Meia is an envoy dispatched by The Most Beautiful, supreme ruler of Galice's faekind, to treat with Emilia. 
 



Badazel, the Simurgh: Appointed guardian of the Isle of Misery, Badazel's nest is festooned with bright silks and other luxuries picked up during her centuries of existence. Though strong and usually wise, she's more than a little vain.

Chieftain Kabbo: Leader of a luckless goblin tribe that's taken up residence on Mount Albans - and the first target of Emilia's wrath. Distressingly fond of crates.

Zurba (Just... Zurba): Mistress of the Maelstrom. Though far closer to Emilia’s age than the rest of Fonelle's lieutenants, Zurba is just as powerful - and, like the storms she likes to summon up, every bit as unpredictable and violent.

Banok the Mighty: Ogre wizard Banok rules over the rocky plains and canyons of the Towerlands with an authority bordering on outright tyranny. Though a magic user, his connection to the earth isn’t intellectual - he seems to be some sort of... muscle... wizard? 

Malsa the Ghost Queen: Queen of the ancient, magical kingdom of Ramilia - the last, thanks to an eldritch disaster that befell the land. Now Malsa's realm is inhabited only by the ghosts of her former subjects, over whom she rules - and cares for - from the crumbling ruins of her castle. 

Arshes, Flame Lord of Carus: Lord of the burning lands of Carus, Arshes is something of - well, let’s not beat around the bush, shall we? He’s a bratty jerk, which, when combined with considerable magical powers, leads to certain disaster. Naturally, he needs to be taken down.

Survan of Ezurbar: Until recently, the elder sage of Ezurbar lived in a castle carved into the side of a glacier, far from the rest of his kinsmen. Now he lives in the royal palace, has turned most of Ezurbar's population into ice sculptures, and lets Fonelle’s monsters have the run of the realm. 

Jorin the Songweaver: A failed bard who discovered his own latent magical talents, Jorin has been tutored and shaped into a High Wizard by Fonelle herself - making him not only entirely loyal to her, but rather creepily devoted and slavish. He has transformed his realm into a place of music and song... so long as those songs are composed in Fonelle’s honor.
 

Grumpy Witch is being developed by a combination of talented newcomers and industry professionals, passionate gamers one and all! 

Our design staff have previously been involved with a wide range of titles, including the Shantae and Scribblenauts series, Drawn to Life, City of Heroes,  Legends of Might & Magic, The Saboteur, Joint Operations, Mercenaries, and Red Alert III. In addition to knowing the ins and outs of fun, challenging games, they bring a wealth of project management expertise to the table. 

On the development side, we're supported by a seasoned group of Unity and C# programmers from both corporate and indie backgrounds. 

Finally, you may recognize some of our art team from their work with Gaia Online, various prominent game streamers, or tabletop games such as Breakfast Cult, No Country for Old Kobolds or the Fate Codex.

To learn more about the individual members of Team Emilia, why not check out our website?

Grumpy Witch will be a fully-voiced game, and we've already lined up some great talent to help bring our characters to life. Our demo features the pipes of: 

  • EMILIA - Kat Kuhl (Campaign & One-Shot Podcasts)
  • MALA MEIA - Sandra Espinoza (Apotheon, Primordia, Heroes of Newerth)
  • KABBO/GOBLINS - Alex "Octopimp" Gross (50% Off)

Our original soundtrack is being composed by trained composer and audio engineer Tim Sheehy. Tim's already created a fantastic, evocative soundscape for our demo, and is looking forward to getting cracking on the full game! Here's a little taste of what to expect: 

"Prelude ~A World of Magic"


"Eyes of Sapphire"

 

We’ve been hexing away at Grumpy Witch since late 2015. Until now, our development has been paid by self-financing and private investment, but to deliver a game with a depth, variety, and polish that’ll really do justice to our concept, we need to find additional sources of funding. 

Crowdfunding, which has acted as a launchpad for a lot of great, innovative titles over the last couple of years, is an exciting opportunity for us to connect directly with fans and players. Your support not only keeps our development team going, but lets us show publishers and investors that there's real demand for games like Grumpy Witch out there.  

$100,000 - Base Game Funded!

At the base funding tier, Grumpy Witch will feature:

  • 32 levels across 7 unique realms
  • 8 distinctive boss encounters
  • Ground-based and aerial gameplay
  • Basic character customization options
  • Day 1 Windows, Mac and Linux releases

However, more funding will allow us to expand the scope of the game, adding new features and improving existing ones. 

$150,000 - Crafting System + Expanded Customization!  

At $150,000, Emilia gets to unleash her creative side with a full-fledged crafting system! Working together with friendly oven butler Barbinas, she can combine all manner of random junk to create new items, weapons, mounts, and even costumes. We'll also be including more customization options, opening the door to even wilder Witchsonas! 

$200,000 - More Content + Pets!

At this funding level, each of the realms gains another new level, bringing the game up to a whopping 39! But that's not all - Emilia will receive a fresh selection of new outfits and accessories, and can even adopt a pet to accompany her in her journeys. 

$250,000 - Still More Content + Playstation 4 Release!  

Want a bigger game? You've got it! At $250,000, we'll add one new level to each of the game's 7 realms, bumping the total number of levels to 46. Emilia's arsenal of spells will also expand, giving her some dangerous new magic to play with. 

Finally, this funding level will allow us to develop a Playstation 4 port, making Grumpy Witch available to console gamers!

$300,000 - Secret Levels + More Pets!

More to explore! At this funding level, we'll add a clutch of sneaky secret levels to the game. Emilia's selection of pets will also expand, giving her several new friends to adventure with. 

$350,000 - Improved Mounts!

Charge into battle in an all new way! At $350,000, Emilia's mounts get a serious tune-up with special attacks, unique movement abilities, and more.  

$400,000 - Localization + Xbox One Release!  

If we clear $400,000 in funding, we'll be able to hire the translators and actors needed to localize Grumpy Witch into one language chosen by backer polls, complete with a new voiceover track! This funding level will also give us the resources to develop an XBox One port, bringing the game to two major consoles. 

$450,000 - More Coolness!

Extra mounts! Extra weapons! Pets that can actually fight with Emilia! In short: more coolness for everybody. 

$500,000 - Upgraded Artbooks + Nightmare Difficulty Mode!

What's better than an artbook? A hardcover artbook! At $500,000, all physical artbooks will be upgraded to hardcovers free of charge. What's more, the game will receive a new, extra-crushing "Nightmare" difficulty setting designed to tax your witching skills to their very limits. Only the swift-fingered need apply!

$550,000 - Localization x 2 + Android Release!

At $550,000, we can hire translators and actors to localize Grumpy Witch into a second language chosen by backer polls, complete with new voiceover. This funding level also gives us enough funding to develop a mobile port for Android devices, letting you get your grump on the go!

$600,000 - Localization x 3 + iOS Release!

Emilia continues her world tour with a third language option chosen by backer poll, complete with new voiceover. With this funding level, we will also have the resources to pursue a mobile port for iOS devices!

$650,000 - Localization x 4!

Help Emilia go fully international! At this funding level, we will be able to localize Grumpy Witch into a fourth language chosen by backer polls, including an all-new voiceover.

$700,000 - Localization x 5!

The tour continues! At this funding level, we'll have the resources to localize Grumpy Witch into a fifth and final language chosen by backer polls, complete with new voiceover. 

$750,000 - Boss Rush Mode!

Enter the arena! Battle a gauntlet of Emilia's greatest foes for a chance to win fabulous, exclusive prizes.  

$850,000 - Competitive Multiplayer!  

Who's the baddest witch on the block? With competitive multiplayer modes, you'll have a chance to pit your Witchsonas against each other in a variety of gametypes to see who comes out on top!

$950,000 - Co-Op Play!  

Double the trouble! Team up with online friends to join forces and battle your way through Grumpy Witch's storyline.
story_txt:
WINDOWS | MAC
 Grumpy Witch: Emilia’s Revenge is a high-flying magical adventure where your choices affect gameplay and story. Emilia is a young, powerful witch—until she’s stripped her magic by the evil sorceress Fonelle, who exiles Emilia and her forest home into a strange new dimension. Emilia will have to battle her way through hordes of Fonelle’s minions if she wants to set things right, and more so if she wants to recover her broom and her hat!WallpapersA pack of four wallpapers - plus variants! - for your computer, tablet, or cell phone. Digital Game CodeOne digital download code for the platform of your choice: PC, Mac, or Linux. PS4, Xbox One, and mobile platforms will be made available as the relevant stretch goals are unlocked. ArtbookDive into Emilia's world with a full-color artbook packed to the brim with concepts, character designs, game art, and behind-the-scenes insights!Original Soundtrack (OST)Groove to Tim Sheehy's original soundtrack in MP3 format. The physical OST comes in a handsome sleeve on cutting-edge CD technology!Sticker SheetsStick 'em anywhere that needs some grumping up!Holographic Mini-PrintsAdd a touch of grump to your home or office with these stylish prints. Featuring all-new pieces from our talented art team, exclusively available through our Indiegogo campaign!KeychainEmilia's frowning face is your added incentive never to misplace those car keys. Pencil BoxBring a touch of magic to your art supplies with this adorable pencil case!LanyardBecause even sorceresses sometimes need to keep track of their ID. Great for cons!Cell Phone CharmEmilia and her Batkin friend keep your smartphone safe from any sinister powers!T-ShirtDisplay your allegiance to Team Emilia by wearing the Grumpy Witch logo while you're out and about!  Batkin PendantProduced by our friends at Optimystical Studios, these hand-crafted pieces measure 1.5" and feature Emilia's favorite flying foe. Hang it from a cord or chain, and you've got one happy, flappy piece of jewelry! Chynna Clugston Flores "Bleu Emilia" Art PrintThis exclusive print from three-time Eisner Award nominee Chynna Clugston Flores (Gotham Academy/Lumberjanes, Queen Bee, Scooter Girl) sees Emilia and company trading places with the cast of Chynna's classic coming-of-age series, Blue Monday!  Desktop StandeesBrighten (or darken) up your workspace with this 18" acrylic Emilia standee!  The world of Grumpy Witch is populated by a wide range of weird and wonderful characters. Here's just a few of the faces you can expect to encounter on your journey through Galice: Emilia Sorelda vam Quis: Twelve years old. Incredibly precocious, very grumpy. (Surprise!) Looking for some peace and quiet, Emilia took up residence in the forests of Mount Albans two years back. Now her Hat, which has been in the family for centuries, has been stolen, and her home transformed into a floating island. This is what you might consider rude. Emilia certainly does, and she will not have it.Fonelle, Witch Queen of Galice: The cause of all Emilia’s problems. Using the magic of the Emilia’s Hat, Fonelle has created a magical land combining pieces of several other realms - including a chunk of Emilia's homeworld, Alderland, on which our heroine now finds herself stranded. Barbinus: A fat, greedy spirit that has taken up residence in Emilia’s oven. A font of magic and knowledge, Barbinus will give Emilia items and information in exchange for cakes and other goodies.Mala Meia: Shrewd and calculating, Mala Meia is an envoy dispatched by The Most Beautiful, supreme ruler of Galice's faekind, to treat with Emilia.  Badazel, the Simurgh: Appointed guardian of the Isle of Misery, Badazel's nest is festooned with bright silks and other luxuries picked up during her centuries of existence. Though strong and usually wise, she's more than a little vain.Chieftain Kabbo: Leader of a luckless goblin tribe that's taken up residence on Mount Albans - and the first target of Emilia's wrath. Distressingly fond of crates.Zurba (Just... Zurba): Mistress of the Maelstrom. Though far closer to Emilia’s age than the rest of Fonelle's lieutenants, Zurba is just as powerful - and, like the storms she likes to summon up, every bit as unpredictable and violent.Banok the Mighty: Ogre wizard Banok rules over the rocky plains and canyons of the Towerlands with an authority bordering on outright tyranny. Though a magic user, his connection to the earth isn’t intellectual - he seems to be some sort of... muscle... wizard? Malsa the Ghost Queen: Queen of the ancient, magical kingdom of Ramilia - the last, thanks to an eldritch disaster that befell the land. Now Malsa's realm is inhabited only by the ghosts of her former subjects, over whom she rules - and cares for - from the crumbling ruins of her castle. Arshes, Flame Lord of Carus: Lord of the burning lands of Carus, Arshes is something of - well, let’s not beat around the bush, shall we? He’s a bratty jerk, which, when combined with considerable magical powers, leads to certain disaster. Naturally, he needs to be taken down.Survan of Ezurbar: Until recently, the elder sage of Ezurbar lived in a castle carved into the side of a glacier, far from the rest of his kinsmen. Now he lives in the royal palace, has turned most of Ezurbar's population into ice sculptures, and lets Fonelle’s monsters have the run of the realm. Jorin the Songweaver: A failed bard who discovered his own latent magical talents, Jorin has been tutored and shaped into a High Wizard by Fonelle herself - making him not only entirely loyal to her, but rather creepily devoted and slavish. He has transformed his realm into a place of music and song... so long as those songs are composed in Fonelle’s honor. Grumpy Witch is being developed by a combination of talented newcomers and industry professionals, passionate gamers one and all! Our design staff have previously been involved with a wide range of titles, including the Shantae and Scribblenauts series, Drawn to Life, City of Heroes,  Legends of Might & Magic, The Saboteur, Joint Operations, Mercenaries, and Red Alert III. In addition to knowing the ins and outs of fun, challenging games, they bring a wealth of project management expertise to the table. On the development side, we're supported by a seasoned group of Unity and C# programmers from both corporate and indie backgrounds. Finally, you may recognize some of our art team from their work with Gaia Online, various prominent game streamers, or tabletop games such as Breakfast Cult, No Country for Old Kobolds or the Fate Codex.To learn more about the individual members of Team Emilia, why not check out our website?Grumpy Witch will be a fully-voiced game, and we've already lined up some great talent to help bring our characters to life. Our demo features the pipes of: 

EMILIA - Kat Kuhl (Campaign & One-Shot Podcasts)

MALA MEIA - Sandra Espinoza (Apotheon, Primordia, Heroes of Newerth)

KABBO/GOBLINS - Alex "Octopimp" Gross (50% Off)
Our original soundtrack is being composed by trained composer and audio engineer Tim Sheehy. Tim's already created a fantastic, evocative soundscape for our demo, and is looking forward to getting cracking on the full game! Here's a little taste of what to expect: "Prelude ~A World of Magic"

"Eyes of Sapphire"

 We’ve been hexing away at Grumpy Witch since late 2015. Until now, our development has been paid by self-financing and private investment, but to deliver a game with a depth, variety, and polish that’ll really do justice to our concept, we need to find additional sources of funding. Crowdfunding, which has acted as a launchpad for a lot of great, innovative titles over the last couple of years, is an exciting opportunity for us to connect directly with fans and players. Your support not only keeps our development team going, but lets us show publishers and investors that there's real demand for games like Grumpy Witch out there.  $100,000 - Base Game Funded!At the base funding tier, Grumpy Witch will feature:
32 levels across 7 unique realms
8 distinctive boss encounters
Ground-based and aerial gameplay
Basic character customization options
Day 1 Windows, Mac and Linux releases
However, more funding will allow us to expand the scope of the game, adding new features and improving existing ones. $150,000 - Crafting System + Expanded Customization!  At $150,000, Emilia gets to unleash her creative side with a full-fledged crafting system! Working together with friendly oven butler Barbinas, she can combine all manner of random junk to create new items, weapons, mounts, and even costumes. We'll also be including more customization options, opening the door to even wilder Witchsonas! $200,000 - More Content + Pets!At this funding level, each of the realms gains another new level, bringing the game up to a whopping 39! But that's not all - Emilia will receive a fresh selection of new outfits and accessories, and can even adopt a pet to accompany her in her journeys. $250,000 - Still More Content + Playstation 4 Release!  Want a bigger game? You've got it! At $250,000, we'll add one new level to each of the game's 7 realms, bumping the total number of levels to 46. Emilia's arsenal of spells will also expand, giving her some dangerous new magic to play with. Finally, this funding level will allow us to develop a Playstation 4 port, making Grumpy Witch available to console gamers!$300,000 - Secret Levels + More Pets!More to explore! At this funding level, we'll add a clutch of sneaky secret levels to the game. Emilia's selection of pets will also expand, giving her several new friends to adventure with. $350,000 - Improved Mounts!Charge into battle in an all new way! At $350,000, Emilia's mounts get a serious tune-up with special attacks, unique movement abilities, and more.  $400,000 - Localization + Xbox One Release!  If we clear $400,000 in funding, we'll be able to hire the translators and actors needed to localize Grumpy Witch into one language chosen by backer polls, complete with a new voiceover track! This funding level will also give us the resources to develop an XBox One port, bringing the game to two major consoles. $450,000 - More Coolness!Extra mounts! Extra weapons! Pets that can actually fight with Emilia! In short: more coolness for everybody. $500,000 - Upgraded Artbooks + Nightmare Difficulty Mode!What's better than an artbook? A hardcover artbook! At $500,000, all physical artbooks will be upgraded to hardcovers free of charge. What's more, the game will receive a new, extra-crushing "Nightmare" difficulty setting designed to tax your witching skills to their very limits. Only the swift-fingered need apply!$550,000 - Localization x 2 + Android Release!At $550,000, we can hire translators and actors to localize Grumpy Witch into a second language chosen by backer polls, complete with new voiceover. This funding level also gives us enough funding to develop a mobile port for Android devices, letting you get your grump on the go!$600,000 - Localization x 3 + iOS Release!Emilia continues her world tour with a third language option chosen by backer poll, complete with new voiceover. With this funding level, we will also have the resources to pursue a mobile port for iOS devices!$650,000 - Localization x 4!Help Emilia go fully international! At this funding level, we will be able to localize Grumpy Witch into a fourth language chosen by backer polls, including an all-new voiceover.$700,000 - Localization x 5!The tour continues! At this funding level, we'll have the resources to localize Grumpy Witch into a fifth and final language chosen by backer polls, complete with new voiceover. $750,000 - Boss Rush Mode!Enter the arena! Battle a gauntlet of Emilia's greatest foes for a chance to win fabulous, exclusive prizes.  $850,000 - Competitive Multiplayer!  Who's the baddest witch on the block? With competitive multiplayer modes, you'll have a chance to pit your Witchsonas against each other in a variety of gametypes to see who comes out on top!$950,000 - Co-Op Play!  Double the trouble! Team up with online friends to join forces and battle your way through Grumpy Witch's storyline.

story:
• Play on Steam 
  • Play on itch.io
  • Play on GameJolt

Story

Sally Face is a boy with blue pigtails, a prosthetic face and a mysterious past. Guide him on weird adventures through high school and beyond; dealing with the many oddities and hardships in his life. 

In the first episode, Strange Neighbors, Sally Face and his father move into a new apartment filled with odd tenants and an unfortunate crime scene. This episode will set the stage for an even greater mystery - but you'll have to play the episode to learn more! 

 

Gameplay

In this story-driven adventure game, players will interact with Sal's world, the people he meets and even delve into his nightmares. The main path typically requires casual effort, with mostly straightforward puzzles. However, there are hidden surprises to be found and bonus mysteries that may invoke a bit of head-scratching for those players up to the challenge. 

The game is broken up into Episodes. Each episode is kept fairly short (typically under an hour) to essentially parallel a dark cartoon series that would air on TV. There are a total of five episodes planned for the final version of Sally Face. 

Players can choose between Keyboard or Controller (Xbox 360) options for preferred control method. 

 

Reception

"That was really cool! I liked that a lot!"   JackSepticEye
"Can't wait for more episodes...it's pretty awesome"   CinnamonToastKen
"I can't wait for episode 2! Holy sh*t!"  RiskRim
"I would love to play the rest"  GloomGames
"Haven't played a game that good in a while!"  TheRPGMinx
"Disturbing Yet Amazing!"  Daz Games
"Really, really good"  KC Loves Gaming
"Pretty Cool! I Enjoyed it"  HarshlyCritical
"Really loved it!"  GrimYaz
"I sincerely enjoy this game & cannot wait for more!"  Oringes
"Really cool! Enjoyed myself so much"  EricVanWilderman
"I'm intrigued as to what the story is"  Radian Gaming
"It's an amazing game! An amazing experience!"  Mann vs Mann
"I absolutely love it"  TheNerdBirds
"That was amazing!"  123Pazu
"Creepy! I like it!"  Cryptic Hybrid
"Sweet awesome adventure"  Jimsplosions
"Certainly makes you want more."  4/5  Jack Reviews
"Beautiful, Funny & Freaky. Highly recommended."   FGP
"Amazing, I love this game!"  Mr. Hatter
"Beautifully marked, darkly humorous story"   Adventurespel
"I loved it!"   The Legend of Jonnii

 

Progress

Currently, Episode One: Strange Neighbors is finished and Episode Two: The Wretched  (previously named "The Treacherous") is in preproduction. Which means I'm finalizing the level design, dialog and overall script. Additionally, I'm also working on a Steam version and implementing translations for the game.  

Sally Face is being developed as a solo, side-project by Steve Gabry (me); where I work on the game in my free time. I'm running this fundraising campaign with hopes of allowing for more dedicated/uninterrupted focus on development and to help get the episodes to you quicker.

 

Portable Moose

Hi! My name is Steve Gabry, I'm an independent game developer from Pittsburgh, PA. I have 10 years experience in designing and developing video games. For my solo projects, I'm going under the name "Portable Moose."

In addition to this work, I am also a Game Designer at Wither Studios, LLC and Creative Director of Crowman & Wolfboy. 

This funding is needed for Sally Face to be completed as the original vision of a five episode narrative arc. With the funds to focus on development full time, instead of only a few hours a week, it would greatly benefit the production of the game and also aid in getting episodes out much sooner. Without funding, it is also likely that the five episode structure will need to be shortened a good bit. With your help, we can allow Sally Face shine in it's full, creepy glory. 

The following is a description of how the funds will be used. 

DETAILS

Development: Creating all of the elements that form a final game, such as artwork, animations, music, sound effects, dialog, story, game design and level construction.

Fees: Indiegogo and payment processing fees.

Safety Net:  Sometimes unforeseen costs may arise, planning for a little extra helps avoid unfortunate surprises. If not needed then this will be used for development. 

Rewards: Fulfilling all of the backer rewards, physical goods and shipping costs.

* Images for prizes are concepts and don't necessarily represent the final products. 

Whether you are able to donate or not, there are other ways you could help out as well: 

  • Share this campaign page with your friends, online and in real life
  • Tell your favorite game site or YouTube channel to check out Sally Face
  • Join me on Facebook and Twitter

Why are you making the game in episodes? 

There are a couple of reasons why I chose to develop the game in episodes. The original idea for Sally Face was conceived in 2007 and started off as a cartoon series. Later on, when I decided to revisit the concept, I knew I wanted to make an adventure game and thought that I would keep the cartoon/episodic format. It's how the story was meant to be told. Additionally, as a solo developer, breaking the game up into episodes helps me to focus on one piece of the story at a time and to get content to the public sooner. 

 

When's the next episode coming out?

Episode Two: The Wretched is currently in preproduction. I'm estimating it will be done by early/mid 2017. 

 

How many episodes will there be?

5 total episodes! 

 

What are your inspirations? 

Since the concept of Sally Face started off in the form of an animated series, most of the influence comes from 90's cartoons (the shows I grew up with) and my own life experiences. The inception of it all came from the idea of creating something similar to an old Nickelodeon cartoon like Hey Arnold or Doug and making it more warped/twisted/dark; something worthy of being on Adult Swim, next to shows like Metalocalypse and Aqua Teen. That idea and an early character doodle created the foundation of what Sally Face is today. 

 

What happened to Sally's face? 

That's a story for another day :)

 

Contact Info: portablemoose@gmail.com

story:
Hi! My name is James and I am a fan of computer games of the genre RPG. Once I was with my friend Alex wanted to create something perfect, what could play true fans, in addition to the computer game. And instantly came to mind: "Playing Cards" !!! But do not just playing cards, and with drawn images all the favorite heroes. Exclusive playing cards - this is more than just a plastic rectangles. They have a soul of each hero, they have a bit of emotion every fan. Me and Alex need your assistance! Because without each of you, this idea will remain just an idea, not sold, forgotten and eventually disappeared!

Thank you for your contribution and for helping us to bring the idea to life!

P.S.I apologize in advance for my English. Everything was chaotic, we are tears from the desire to act. Therefore, in many places an interpreter. Thank you for understanding.

Playing cards are located in a stylish wooden box.

Playing cards are made of high quality plastic, they are pleasing to the hand and durable. Figures Game characters are made professionally and efficiently, which creates the presence of an atmosphere.

The downside of playing cards will be executed in two variants. The first - the image of the three legendary heroes, and the second - a true game logo.

The style of each playing card is designed as a curved game logo that looks very fashionable and high quality.

We want every player and fan of Dota 2 enjoyed the acquisition of playing cards. That is why we are creating more and golden collection !!!

Due to the fact that the number of characters exceeds the number of playing cards in a standard deck, we offer each customer to choose, what he wants to see heroes in the best deck. And we will make his desires in life!

Due to its stylish design, the cards look great in your hand, and they want to play again and again!...

As a bonus, the first customers we send finished super-strong paper DotA2 deck of cards!

To keep the intrigue, we do not show the picture of all the characters, but rest assured, they are wonderful and worthy of your attention!

We are a little blurred image quality to keep the intrigue ... We can not cope without your support! Only together we will achieve more and desired!

story:
Live Running Simulator

Innovative GPS running app with Live 3D Competition. Check it out!

Live Running Simulator app / game is the next generation GPS tracking for competitive real-time action on iOS and Android devices.

  • Explore new ways of staying fit
  • Lose weight through gaming
  • Never feel bored or lonely during exercise
  • Integrate a new type of fun into daily routines
  • Compatible with Android and iOS phones


What is Live Running Simulator?

No more red dot on the map.  Live Running Simulator puts you in the middle of all the action and makes it possible to compete in real time against other runners from all over the world.


How Does It Work?

With this simulator, users compete against 3D avatars in real time, your avatar is running at the same speed as you are in real world. You may choose one of six different races - from 400 meter to a 10,000 meter marathon.

You can choose single-run mode or tournament-mode to compete against computer generated runners or the avatars of live runners from around the world.


You'll feel just like you're there with integrated audio effects like cheering audiences, the footsteps of approaching runners, and broadcasts about current position.

As you make your way on the track, your smartphone screen will show you details about your exact location, distance from the finish line, and where you are in relation to your opponent, as well as replay highlights after the race is finished.

You can keep track of your progress by registering personal records and competition results.

With the Live Running Simulator you'll always have a running partner and exercise feels more like a game than hard work!

What We Need & What You Get

We truly believe this app could revolutionize the way we game and the way we work out. We are halfway with development and would love you to join us on our journey to the finish line. Join us and back our campaign today!

    • $1 = The most sincere "Thank You" as every dollar counts

    • $5 = app + personalization credits worth $10

    • $10 = app + personalization credits worth $15

    • $35 = the above* + T-shirt

    • $75 = the above* + running band

    • $175 = the above* + heart rate monitor (Sigma PC 10.11 or similar)

    • $750 = the above* + personalized running avatar (including face and outfit)

    • $1000 = the above* + brand logo on the board along the running track
* all of the above, personalization credits $10 and $15 are not cummulative. T-shirts, running bands and heart rate monitors are delivered until November, 2016; the app, personalized avatars and brand logos are delivered until March 2017.
If our funding goal is not fully reached, we will reach our backup investors to fulfill your rewards on time. We have insured our risks to send you the rewards you pledge for.


Timeline

As of now, the app is developed to the stage where user may enjoy individual run and single run with computer-generated competitors. Currently, the work on 3D design for personalization features and more detailed audiences are in progress. Here is a timeline of the work that your contributions will support:
  • August 2016 - Indiegogo campaign
  • October 2016 - finalization of avatar personalization menu - now users will be able to choose facial features, haircuts, running suits, shoes, nationalities and tattoos that best reflect themselves.
  • January 1, 2017 - finalization of programming necessary for game to be played on server - now all the data - username, password, records, avatar will be stored on server. Users will also be able to compete with each other, not only with CPU.
  • January 15, 2017 - finalization of programming necessary for tournament mode - now the users will be able to compete with each other in multi-stage competitions, where best compete against the best.
  • March 1, 2017 - final beta-tests.

Who We are

We are Intelligent Design, a limited liability company registered in Latvia, European Union. Our small design studio, founded by Roberts Austrums, has a vision to produce products, which are not only entertaining, but also provide added value as a result of their use. Live Running Simulator has already been reviewed and received support from European Union funding, which has been an integral resource for our development so far.  

Risks & Challenges

As with any new app, there is always the risk of bugs. We will make it our priority to be in tune with our backer's feedback and work hard on updates to remedy any bugs that we may discover along the way. We will post updates regularly on Indiegogo to keep you in the loop.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign with your friends, family and anybody who may like it! Each share helps us get closer to the finish line and is greatly appreciated :)

Live Running Simulator
Innovative GPS running app with Live 3D Competition. Check it out!

Live Running Simulator app / game is the next generation GPS tracking for competitive real-time action on iOS and Android devices.


Explore new ways of staying fit
Lose weight through gaming
Never feel bored or lonely during exercise
Integrate a new type of fun into daily routines

Compatible with Android and iOS phones




What is Live Running Simulator?  No more red dot on the map.  Live Running Simulator puts you in the middle of all the action and makes it possible to compete in real time against other runners from all over the world.

story:
The game

A risk alike strategy board game with 2 available game modes.

Equipment


The game is made for 2 to 4 players. One complete set consists of:

  • Board 60cm x 60cm (the map)

  • 72 cards split into 3 categories (blue, red, gold)

  • 192 playing tokens (48 per player: 35 armies, 5 big armies, 3 ships, 3 towers, king and kingdom)

  • 6 rolling dice

  • A game manual which explains in detail the game modes

  • A box (30cm x 30cm)  for all of the above


In summary:


Gameplay

Every player starts with the same number of territories on the map. There are 12 special territories on the map which give 1 population growth (one bonus army) to the player that controls it every turn. Every player chooses a kingdom on the beginning (a non-special territory) which also provides one bonus as long as the king is in it. The king himself is stronger when in a kingdom and when killed provides a bonus for the killer.

There are two types of games: a regular game and a ships game. In the latter, every player starts with 3 ships and they can be used to attack by sea. Other players can build towers to defend the ships. The towers, ships and kingdoms are objects for the enemies to occupy and take over. The goal is to eliminate the opponents.

Players can occupy territories by attacking with their armies and the battles happen by rolling dice.

The blue cards are quests which give certain rewards upon completion.

The gold cards are much harder missions and each player can have only one. If completed it gives him/her major advantage but the game is still not over.

The red cards are basically jokers that can extend someone's duration in the game.

More examples of the cards you can see in the video above.

Wooden Version

In addition to the standard version you can order a more elegant, wood carved and painted by hand, wooden version. (wooden board and wooden tokens)

Extras

In addition, you can order viking T-shirts for a very good price of 15$ or 4 x T-shirts for an incredible 48$ !

Profit

Part of the profit from this board game will be donated to Action Against Hunger, a UK charity to help fight world hunger.

Credits for the design of the pieces:

Jovan Kosarkoski

https://www.facebook.com/kosarart/?fref=ts

story:
Do you like 2d games from the 90's such as Metroid or Castlevania?
Do you like Sci-Fi horror films from the 80's?
Do you like the retro look of the old 8 bits and 16 bits games?
Me too!
This is why I made such a game for MSX 2 (an 8 bit computer) and it became so popular I decided to do a remake for pc with lots of new features, new and bigger areas, more weapons and abilities, boss battles, extended story, more visual stages, more action, more explosions...
Try the playable demo!

¿Te gustan los juegos 2d de los años 90, como Metroid o Castlevania?
¿Te gustan las películas de terror de ciencia ficción de los años 80?
¿Te gusta la apariencia retro de los viejos juegos de 8 bits y 16 bits?
¡A mi también!
Esta es la razón por la que hice un juego para MSX 2 (una computadora de 8 bits) y se volvió tan popular que decidí hacer un remake para pc con muchas nuevas características, nuevas y más grandes áreas, más armas y habilidades, monstruos finales, historia extendida, más etapas visuales, más acción, más explosiones ...

Prueba la demo jugable!

The story:
The United Nations has lost contact with their scientific colony on Mars, which is in charge of investigating whether there is micro-organic life in the groundwater of Mars.
The ship "UNSS Barcelona" takes 7 months to reach Mars and sends the best communications technician they have to repair the communications system.
That technician is you ...

As soon as we get to the colony we will see that something is not right.
The worker robots and the security androids will attack us, going against their most primary directive: Do not cause harm.


Parts of the colony are demolished and we must find mining equipment to make our way to the control room.
When we finally meet the first settlers, they behave like some kind of zombie.
We will discover natural caverns of Mars with strange vegetation never seen before.
We will also discover that unauthorized genetic experiments have been carried out, causing all sorts of dangerous mutants.
The animals of the hydroponic farms are mutated and they are terribly hostile ...
But the biggest secret of all is yet to be discovered ...


-Explore the huge scientific colony of Mars and find out what has happened.
- Get new weapons and equipment that will allow you to use new skills and access previously inaccessible places (grenade launchers, flamethrowers, double jump, running in flames ...)
-Find shield and energy upgrades to increase your chances of survival.
-Pick up energy capsules to increase the characteristics of your weapons and abilities (RPG element)
-Learn to manage the new energy system to use your weapons and skills and not run out of energy at key moments (surrounded by enemies).

-4 difficulty settings: The game can be played as a “run and gun” arcade game in the easier settings, as a Metroid in the normal setting and as a Survival horror in the hardest setting.

 

La historia:

Las Naciones Unidas han perdido contacto con la colonia científica de Marte, encargada de investigar si hay vida micro-orgánica en las aguas subterráneas de Marte.

La nave “UNSS Barcelona” tarda 7 meses en llegar a Marte y envían al mejor técnico de comunicaciones del que disponen para reparar el sistema de comunicaciones.

Ese técnico eres tu…

Nada más llegar a la colonia veremos que algo no anda bien.

Los robots trabajadores y los androides de seguridad nos atacarán, hiendo en contra de su más primaria directriz de no causar daño.

Partes de la colonia están derruidas y deberemos encontrar equipo de minería para poder abrirnos paso hacia la sala de control.

Cuando por fin nos encontramos con los primeros colonos, éstos se comportan como una especie de zombie.

Descubriremos cavernas naturales de Marte con una extraña vegetación nunca vista.

También descubriremos que se han llevado a cabo experimentos genéticos no autorizados, causando toda suerte de mutantes peligrosos.

Los animales de las granjas hidropónicas están mutados y son terriblemente hostiles…

Pero el secreto más grande de todos aun está por descubrir…

 

-Explora la enorme colonia científica de Marte y averigua qué ha pasado.

-Consigue nuevas armas y equipo que te permitirán usar nuevas habilidades y acceder a sitios que antes eran inaccesibles (lanzagranadas, lanzallamas, doble salto, correr en llamas…)

-Encuentra mejoras de escudo y de energía para aumentar tus posibilidades de supervivencia.

-Recoge cápsulas de energía para aumentar las características de tus armas y habilidades (elemento RPG)

-Aprende a gestionar el novedoso sistema de  energía para usar tus armas y habilidades y no quedarte sin energía en los momentos clave (rodeado de enemigos).

-4 niveles de dificultad: El juego se puede jugar como un “run and gun” bastante arcade en los niveles de dificultad más bajos, como un Metroid en el nivel normal, o como un juego “survival horror” en el nivel más alto.

 

Try the playable demo!


MEGA link (executable file .exe):
Https://mega.nz/#!Wp4VCLba!uZPTMmUUXPixhKDfEzWo...



MEGA Link (compressed in RAR):
Https://mega.nz/#!C5QDzZbB!dhywHUOejGe52aBvUSz1...



FILEDROPPER Link (executable file .exe):
Http://www.filedropper.com/lifeonmarsremakedemo_1



Warning:
This demo is highly addictive. Beta-testers have commented that when they reach the end of the demo they are left with a huge desire to continue playing.

The demo is only available in English (for now). The game will support English and Spanish and probably French, Italian, and if possible, many other languages.

This demo only supports (for now) the Xbox 360 controller and keyboard keys, which are redefineable.


The default keyboard keys are:


- Cursor keys to move and aim.
-Space bar to skip the visual stages and to start the game.
-S to jump.
-D to shoot.
-C to throw grenades (when available).
-A to use flamethrower (when available).
-The double jump skill is activated by pressing the jump button again in mid-air (when available).
- The ability to run is activated by pressing a direction (left or right) 2 times very quickly if we are standing still. If we are walking, just make a quick press to activate the ability.
-ALT + ENTER to exit full screen mode.
-ALT + F4 to quit the game
- "1" key to activate and deactivate the RCA filter (which makes the image look like an old tube TV)

 

 

 

Prueba la demo jugable!

Enlace MEGA (fichero ejecutable .exe):

https://mega.nz/#!Wp4VCLba!uZPTMmUUXPixhKDfEzWo...

 

Enlace Mega (comprimido en RAR):

https://mega.nz/#!C5QDzZbB!dhywHUOejGe52aBvUSz1...

 

Enlace FILEDROPPER (fichero ejecutable .exe):

http://www.filedropper.com/lifeonmarsremakedemo_1

 

Precaución:

Esta  demo es altamente adictiva. Los beta-testers han comentado que cuando llegan al final de la demo se quedan con enormes ganas de seguir jugando.

Esta demo está disponible en Inglés solamente (por ahora). El juego estará disponible en Español (garantizado) y posiblemente en Italiano, Francés y algunos idiomas mas.

Esta demo solo soporta (por ahora) los mandos de Xbox 360y las teclas del teclado, las cuales son redefinibles.

Las teclas del teclado por omisión son:

-Teclas del cursor para moverse y apuntar.

-Espacio para saltarse las etapas visuales y para empezar la partida.

-S para saltar.

-D para disparar.

-C para lanzar granadas (cuando estén disponibles).

-A para usar el lanzallamas (cuando esté disponible).

-La habilidad de doble salto se activa pulsando el botón de salto de nuevo en el aire (cuando esté disponible).

-La habilidad de correr se activa pulsando una dirección (izquierda o derecha) 2 veces muy rápidamente si estamos parados. Si estamos caminando, solo hay que hacer una pulsación rápida para activar la habilidad.

-ALT + ENTER para salir del modo de pantalla completa.

-ALT + F4 para quitar el juego

-Tecla “1” para activar y desactivar el filtro RCA (que hace que la imagen parezca una tv antigua de tubo)

 

Intro and first minutes of gameplay:

Presentacion y primeros minutos de juego:

 

But look at me, all exited talking about the game!

Where are my manners?!

Allow me to introduce myself:


My name is Oscar Kenneth Albero, I live in Spain. I apologize for my bad English but English is not my first language (or the second). But do not worry, the game texts will be carefully revised by a professional once the game is finished.

I started making video games at the age of 20 for the MSX 2 system. Last year I released 4 new titles (in 1 single year).
You can see my games (images and videos) in this link:
Https://kai-magazine-software.fwscart.com/
Unfortunately, making video games for an obsolete system is not well paid at all. I am divorced with 2 children and my only source of income currently comes from the video games I developed. I need your help to complete this PC remake.
I am a very productive developer: Everything you see in the video or playable demo I have done in 1 month and a half. I only need 1 month and a half more to finish it, but I would like to add many more areas, enemies, abilities, visual scene and to extend the story beyond the original version. For that I need about 3 months to finish it as I would like, with all the visual stages and zones that I could not put in the original version of MSX.
The graphics are completely remade, from an 8 bit look to a 16 bit look. I create the graphics on a PC that is more than 9 years old, with a drawing program that is about 20 years old and with a mouse (that is harder than you could imagine!)
I do the Programming and mapping with Game Maker.
I composed the soundtrack with an MSX 2 (an 8-bit computer from 1985).
Even without resources, the game is looking quite well and development is progressing very fast.
I would like to work on the game for another 3 months to add everything I want to add and finish it the way it was meant to be finished.
In order to work exclusively for 3 months, I need to raise some 2000 euros to survive those 3 months (My children and I can survive every month with only 600 euros).
That is why I ask your help to finish the game as it should.
Of course, all the sponsors will be rewarded with a reduced pre-purchase price and in addition you will be included in the credits of the game.
You can also access to exclusive rewards only available for this campaign.

Worst case scenario:

If I do not raise 2000 euros in this campaign, I will make similar campaigns on other crowdfunding platforms located in certain countries (kickstarter, Verkami ...)

If at the end we only manage to collect (for example) 1000 euros, I would finish the game 1 month and a half (which is the minimum time I need to finish it) and the game would already be much wider than the original MSX 2 version.

 

 

Pero mírame, todo emocionado, hablando sin parar del juego!

Donde están mis modales?!

Permitidme que me presente:

Me llamo Oscar Kenneth Albero y vivo en España. Empecé a hacer videojuegos a los 20 años para el sistema MSX 2. El año pasado lancé 4 títulos nuevos (en 1 solo año).

Podéis ver mis juegos (imágenes y videos) en este enlace:

https://kai-magazine-software.fwscart.com/

Lamentablemente, hacer videojuegos para un sistema obsoleto no está nada bien remunerado. Estoy divorciado con 2 hijos  y mi única fuente de ingresos actualmente proviene de los videojuegos que desarrollo. Necesito vuestra ayuda para poder completar este remake para PC.

Soy un desarrollador muy productivo: Todo lo que veis en el video o la demo jugable lo he hecho en 1 mes y medio. Solo necesito unos 3 meses más para terminarlo como a mí me gustaría, con todas las etapas visuales y zonas que no pude poner en la versión original de MSX.

Los gráficos están totalmente rehechos. Los hago en un PC que tiene más de 9 años, con un programa de dibujo que tiene unos 20 años y con un ratón (pixel a pixel!)

La programación y los mapeados los hago con el Game Maker.

Las músicas las hice con un MSX 2 (un ordenador de 8 bits del 1985).

Aún y sin recursos, el juego está quedando bastante bien y el desarrollo avanza muy rápido.

Necesitaría un mes y medio más para terminar el juego, pero desearía trabajar en el juego 3 meses más para añadirle todo lo que le deseo añadir y que quede como se merece.

Para poder trabajar en el exclusivamente durante 3 meses, necesito recaudar unos 2000 euros para subsistir esos 3 meses (mis hijos y yo podemos pasar cada mes con solo 600 euros).

Por eso os pido vuestra ayuda para poder acabar el juego como se merece.

Por supuesto, todos los patrocinadores seréis recompensados con un reducido precio de pre-compra y además saldréis en los créditos del juego.

También podéis acceder a recompensas exclusivas de ésta campaña (recompensas que no será posible conseguir después de la campaña).

 

En el peor de los casos:

Si no logro recaudar 2000 euros en esta campaña, haré otras campañas similares en otras plataformas de mecenazgo localizadas en ciertos países (kickstarter, Verkami…)

Si al final solo recaudase (por ejemplo) 1000 euros, terminaría el juego 1 mes y medio (que es el tiempo mínimo que necesito para terminarlo) y el juego ya sería mucho más amplio que la versión original de MSX 2.

 

Help!
In addition to any financial contributions, I would like to ask you to send the link of this campaign to as much people as you could: by Twitter, Facebook, Whatsapp ...
Creating awareness of this project is as important as the economic support.

You can also vote the game in Steam greenlight:

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetai...

Please take a minute to vote this game.

Thank you all for your attention.
I hope you like the game!

 

Ayuda!

Además de cualquier contribución económica, me gustaría pediros que mandaseis el enlace de esta campaña a cuanta más gente mejor: por Twitter, Facebook, Whatsapp…

Crear difusión del proyecto es tan importante como el apoyo económico.

Tambien podeis ayudar a que el juego esté en steam:

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetai...

Dedicadle 1 minuto a votar el proyecto, por favor.

Gracias a todos por vuestra atención.

Espero que os guste el juego!
