encontramos con los primeros colonos, éstos se comportan como una especie de zombie.Descubriremos cavernas naturales de Marte con una extraña vegetación nunca vista.También descubriremos que se han llevado a cabo experimentos genéticos no autorizados, causando toda suerte de mutantes peligrosos.Los animales de las granjas hidropónicas están mutados y son terriblemente hostiles…Pero el secreto más grande de todos aun está por descubrir… -Explora la enorme colonia científica de Marte y averigua qué ha pasado.-Consigue nuevas armas y equipo que te permitirán usar nuevas habilidades y acceder a sitios que antes eran inaccesibles (lanzagranadas, lanzallamas, doble salto, correr en llamas…)-Encuentra mejoras de escudo y de energía para aumentar tus posibilidades de supervivencia.-Recoge cápsulas de energía para aumentar las características de tus armas y habilidades (elemento RPG)-Aprende a gestionar el novedoso sistema de  energía para usar tus armas y habilidades y no quedarte sin energía en los momentos clave (rodeado de enemigos).-4 niveles de dificultad: El juego se puede jugar como un “run and gun” bastante arcade en los niveles de dificultad más bajos, como un Metroid en el nivel normal, o como un juego “survival horror” en el nivel más alto. Try the playable demo!MEGA link (executable file .exe):Https://mega.nz/#!Wp4VCLba!uZPTMmUUXPixhKDfEzWo...MEGA Link (compressed in RAR):Https://mega.nz/#!C5QDzZbB!dhywHUOejGe52aBvUSz1...FILEDROPPER Link (executable file .exe):Http://www.filedropper.com/lifeonmarsremakedemo_1Warning:This demo is highly addictive. Beta-testers have commented that when they reach the end of the demo they are left with a huge desire to continue playing.The demo is only available in English (for now). The game will support English and Spanish and probably French, Italian, and if possible, many other languages.This demo only supports (for now) the Xbox 360 controller and keyboard keys, which are redefineable.The default keyboard keys are:- Cursor keys to move and aim.-Space bar to skip the visual stages and to start the game.-S to jump.-D to shoot.-C to throw grenades (when available).-A to use flamethrower (when available).-The double jump skill is activated by pressing the jump button again in mid-air (when available).- The ability to run is activated by pressing a direction (left or right) 2 times very quickly if we are standing still. If we are walking, just make a quick press to activate the ability.-ALT + ENTER to exit full screen mode.-ALT + F4 to quit the game- "1" key to activate and deactivate the RCA filter (which makes the image look like an old tube TV)   Prueba la demo jugable!Enlace MEGA (fichero ejecutable .exe):https://mega.nz/#!Wp4VCLba!uZPTMmUUXPixhKDfEzWo... Enlace Mega (comprimido en RAR):https://mega.nz/#!C5QDzZbB!dhywHUOejGe52aBvUSz1... Enlace FILEDROPPER (fichero ejecutable .exe):http://www.filedropper.com/lifeonmarsremakedemo_1 Precaución:Esta  demo es altamente adictiva. Los beta-testers han comentado que cuando llegan al final de la demo se quedan con enormes ganas de seguir jugando.Esta demo está disponible en Inglés solamente (por ahora). El juego estará disponible en Español (garantizado) y posiblemente en Italiano, Francés y algunos idiomas mas.Esta demo solo soporta (por ahora) los mandos de Xbox 360y las teclas del teclado, las cuales son redefinibles.Las teclas del teclado por omisión son:-Teclas del cursor para moverse y apuntar.-Espacio para saltarse las etapas visuales y para empezar la partida.-S para saltar.-D para disparar.-C para lanzar granadas (cuando estén disponibles).-A para usar el lanzallamas (cuando esté disponible).-La habilidad de doble salto se activa pulsando el botón de salto de nuevo en el aire (cuando esté disponible).-La habilidad de correr se activa pulsando una dirección (izquierda o derecha) 2 veces muy rápidamente si estamos parados. Si estamos caminando, solo hay que hacer una pulsación rápida para activar la habilidad.-ALT + ENTER para salir del modo de pantalla completa.-ALT + F4 para quitar el juego-Tecla “1” para activar y desactivar el filtro RCA (que hace que la imagen parezca una tv antigua de tubo) Intro and first minutes of gameplay:Presentacion y primeros minutos de juego: But look at me, all exited talking about the game!Where are my manners?!Allow me to introduce myself:My name is Oscar Kenneth Albero, I live in Spain. I apologize for my bad English but English is not my first language (or the second). But do not worry, the game texts will be carefully revised by a professional once the game is finished.I started making video games at the age of 20 for the MSX 2 system. Last year I released 4 new titles (in 1 single year).You can see my games (images and videos) in this link:Https://kai-magazine-software.fwscart.com/Unfortunately, making video games for an obsolete system is not well paid at all. I am divorced with 2 children and my only source of income currently comes from the video games I developed. I need your help to complete this PC remake.I am a very productive developer: Everything you see in the video or playable demo I have done in 1 month and a half. I only need 1 month and a half more to finish it, but I would like to add many more areas, enemies, abilities, visual scene and to extend the story beyond the original version. For that I need about 3 months to finish it as I would like, with all the visual stages and zones that I could not put in the original version of MSX.The graphics are completely remade, from an 8 bit look to a 16 bit look. I create the graphics on a PC that is more than 9 years old, with a drawing program that is about 20 years old and with a mouse (that is harder than you could imagine!)I do the Programming and mapping with Game Maker.I composed the soundtrack with an MSX 2 (an 8-bit computer from 1985).Even without resources, the game is looking quite well and development is progressing very fast.I would like to work on the game for another 3 months to add everything I want to add and finish it the way it was meant to be finished.In order to work exclusively for 3 months, I need to raise some 2000 euros to survive those 3 months (My children and I can survive every month with only 600 euros).That is why I ask your help to finish the game as it should.Of course, all the sponsors will be rewarded with a reduced pre-purchase price and in addition you will be included in the credits of the game.You can also access to exclusive rewards only available for this campaign.Worst case scenario:If I do not raise 2000 euros in this campaign, I will make similar campaigns on other crowdfunding platforms located in certain countries (kickstarter, Verkami ...)If at the end we only manage to collect (for example) 1000 euros, I would finish the game 1 month and a half (which is the minimum time I need to finish it) and the game would already be much wider than the original MSX 2 version.  Pero mírame, todo emocionado, hablando sin parar del juego!Donde están mis modales?!Permitidme que me presente:Me llamo Oscar Kenneth Albero y vivo en España. Empecé a hacer videojuegos a los 20 años para el sistema MSX 2. El año pasado lancé 4 títulos nuevos (en 1 solo año).Podéis ver mis juegos (imágenes y videos) en este enlace:https://kai-magazine-software.fwscart.com/Lamentablemente, hacer videojuegos para un sistema obsoleto no está nada bien remunerado. Estoy divorciado con 2 hijos  y mi única fuente de ingresos actualmente proviene de los videojuegos que desarrollo. Necesito vuestra ayuda para poder completar este remake para PC.Soy un desarrollador muy productivo: Todo lo que veis en el video o la demo jugable lo he hecho en 1 mes y medio. Solo necesito unos 3 meses más para terminarlo como a mí me gustaría, con todas las etapas visuales y zonas que no pude poner en la versión original de MSX.Los gráficos están totalmente rehechos. Los hago en un PC que tiene más de 9 años, con un programa de dibujo que tiene unos 20 años y con un ratón (pixel a pixel!)La programación y los mapeados los hago con el Game Maker.Las músicas las hice con un MSX 2 (un ordenador de 8 bits del 1985).Aún y sin recursos, el juego está quedando bastante bien y el desarrollo avanza muy rápido.Necesitaría un mes y medio más para terminar el juego, pero desearía trabajar en el juego 3 meses más para añadirle todo lo que le deseo añadir y que quede como se merece.Para poder trabajar en el exclusivamente durante 3 meses, necesito recaudar unos 2000 euros para subsistir esos 3 meses (mis hijos y yo podemos pasar cada mes con solo 600 euros).Por eso os pido vuestra ayuda para poder acabar el juego como se merece.Por supuesto, todos los patrocinadores seréis recompensados con un reducido precio de pre-compra y además saldréis en los créditos del juego.También podéis acceder a recompensas exclusivas de ésta campaña (recompensas que no será posible conseguir después de la campaña). En el peor de los casos:Si no logro recaudar 2000 euros en esta campaña, haré otras campañas similares en otras plataformas de mecenazgo localizadas en ciertos países (kickstarter, Verkami…)Si al final solo recaudase (por ejemplo) 1000 euros, terminaría el juego 1 mes y medio (que es el tiempo mínimo que necesito para terminarlo) y el juego ya sería mucho más amplio que la versión original de MSX 2. Help!In addition to any financial contributions, I would like to ask you to send the link of this campaign to as much people as you could: by Twitter, Facebook, Whatsapp ...Creating awareness of this project is as important as the economic support.You can also vote the game in Steam greenlight:http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetai...Please take a minute to vote this game.Thank you all for your attention.I hope you like the game! Ayuda!Además de cualquier contribución económica, me gustaría pediros que mandaseis el enlace de esta campaña a cuanta más gente mejor: por Twitter, Facebook, Whatsapp…Crear difusión del proyecto es tan importante como el apoyo económico.Tambien podeis ayudar a que el juego esté en steam:http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetai...Dedicadle 1 minuto a votar el proyecto, por favor.Gracias a todos por vuestra atención.Espero que os guste el juego!

story:
My Journey

My name is Andrey Balandin, I am a graduate of the New Jersey Institute of Technology with a Bachelors in Digital Design. I currently work for the Financial Times as a Customer Engagement Manager. My passion is video games. 

At first I started selling these consoles on eBay and everything was going great. But, unfortunately all great things come to an end. A third party in the US has trademarked the term RetroPie which is the UK software company who made the RetroPie. This person is going on eBay (and maybe other sites) and taking reporting anyone who is selling consoles with the RetroPie system on it with the argument that his name has been stolen. Selling something that explains it has the RetroPie system is fair use by US law but eBay does not have a vetting system where they check these reports. Two times eBay has suspended my account and then apologized for doing so because they understood that I was not infringing on any copyright. Until today, eBay has indefinitely suspended my account and I want to completely get away from them. This goes into my proposal.

Here are some articles below about the ordeal.

https://techraptor.net/content/retropie-victim-...

https://retropie.org.uk/2017/02/legal-help-needed/

What I would like

I would like to raise enough money to register my business in the state of New Jersey, get my website up and running and be completely autonomous from eBay or any other selling platform. I would like to get my name out there and get these consoles into as many households as I can.

I would like to raise $4,000

$500 - will go to state filing fees and fees to pay a lawyer to do all the paperwork to register my Video Game Business

$500 - will go to get my site up and running. Cost of webspace, designer work, registering a domain, and opening an online store

$3000 - will go into parts for all of the consoles that I will be building as perks for this campaign

The Perks

$1 - I will be forever thankful and you will have my gratitude. I will also send you a high resolution wallpaper of the consoles that I have built.

$5 - You will have my gratitude and your name will be put as a backer that made my project and dream come to life on my website. I will also send you high resolution wallpaper of the consoles I have built.

$15 - I will mail you an 8 GB SD card formatted with the RetroPie system and instructions on how you could add games to it. Your name will also be put as a backer that made my project and dream come to life on my website.

$25 -  I will mail you an 16 GB SD card formatted with the RetroPie system and instructions on how you could add games to it. Your name will also be put as a backer that made my project and dream come to life on my website.

$140 - (Special Pricing) I will mail you a full console with your choice of a NES or SNES case with 2 NES or 2 SNES wired controllers and RetroPie on a 16GB micro SD card. Your name will also be put as a backer that made my project and dream come to life on my website.

$195 - (Special Pricing) I will mail you a full console with your choice of NES or SNES case with 2 NES or 2 SNES wireless controllers and RetroPie on a 16GB micro SD card. Your name will also be put as a backer that made my project and dream come to life on my website.

The Impact

You will help me complete my dream by creating a website, registering my business, and getting my name out there. With your help I can get you closer to playing all your gaming classics. I had a 100% positive feedback on eBay and many happy customers. If you need any more information about what I am doing you can always email me at retrorefurbvideogames@outlook.com

Risks & Challenges

I understand Emulation is a touchy subject and not everyone might be happy about this campaign (especially the person that registered RetroPie as a trademark in the US). I am willing to take the risk because it's something I love to do. When I have people contacting me back saying they love playing all of their classics on their tv screen, it really makes me happy. I also understand that this campaign might not even work out. But, I hope theres people that are interested in this product and looking to help someone like me out.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate right now its okay. Just get my name out there. I am on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter. Please spread the word.

story:
Path to Abyss is a turn-based roguelike RPG made with RPG Maker MV that has the players explore the seemingly endless dungeon.

The demo is now ready here!

Link to our itch.io page.

Upcoming features when the game is complete:

- The main quest and side quests

- Multiple interactive options with NPCs and certain objects

- More paths and skills to learn and combo

- More unique areas themes and the gameplay mechanic will be completed

- Original Sound Track

- The Chinese version will be available (To the Chinese readers: 完整版会有中文版)

 

Pilgrim

The pilgrim focuses more on a defensive playstyle with a sword and a shield equipped. Sing your praises to the Lord as you grind your way through the hostile creatures in this dungeon.

Vagrant

The vagrant focuses more on a quick and evasive playstyle with the lack of sturdy armor. Blind your enemies and strike a decisive strike to survive the dangers of this dungeon.

Cultist

The cultist focuses on a very offensive playstyle with dark magic at your disposal. Blast your way out of perils but be careful not to get hit too hard.

 

You can increase your character status and learn new skills with the Path system. You can also try different combinations of skills from different paths and find your own playstyle you like.

There are currently 9 paths available in the demo and more are expected to be included in the final version.

Pledge Rewards

Thank you for supporting us! With this tier, you'll get your name in the credits and you’ll receive a code for this game when the game releases.

The first 100 pledgers can also get this tier at a premium price.

 

In addition to a copy of the game, you’ll also get a set of digital wallpapers drawn by our artist!

 

Gain access to the Beta version when the time comes! Play before the full version is released and help us discover bugs and balance the game.

 

Work with the team to bring your very own desired monster to life in the game

 

Work with the team to bring out your very own desired item to life in the game!

 

Want to place your very own character as an eccentric guide? Or as a wandering bard? Or maybe you lost something important and you need someone to help retrieve it? Work with the team to create an in-game NPC with your very own custom questline!

 

Want to challenge the players with your very own creation? Come and work with the team to create your very own Miniboss in the game!

 

You can follow the game’s development on Facebook and Twitter too! (For any feedback regarding the game, please send an email to studiopentori@gmail.com or contact us through any of the social media above.)

 

We do have some realistic stretch goals we hope to achieve with this campaign as well.

$2000 – We can add even more content updates in the future.

$3000 – We can most likely shorten the estimated time of completion from Winter to Autumn 2019.

$5000 – We’ll be able to create a digital artbook and add even more OSTs. (The digital artbook will be sent as a thank you gift to the $30 tier backers and above)

 

To everyone willing to support our campaign, we thank you all from the bottom of our hearts. We hope you all will be looking forward to the completion of Path to Abyss. Regardless of what happens, we all just want to thank you for your support!

Special thanks to Yanfly, DoubleX, MogHunter, SumRndmDde, Galv for their plugins.
Fonts by Pix3M.

story:
Work for Escape From Utopia began all the way back in 2017 when I first discovered the Mouse Utopia experiments by John Calhoun in the 60's. What began as a 2D platformer has evolved into a roguelike first person shooter that strives to combine narrative elements with  randomization and perma-death to create a unique experience that remains engaging for fans of both genres. 

As I have worked on the game and gathered team members, it has been entirely self-funded. To realize the vision of the project, I need your help to make this game a reality. Features like local and online co-op, multiplayer, and ports to consoles are beyond the scope of self-funding. 

$10,000 allows for the development of the following features:

  1. An advanced level generation engine that can create diverse levels filled with enemies and unique enemy formations and combinations depending on the amount of floors cleared, scaleable loot and weapon placements, and NPC and Quest Giver placement. 
  2. Local and Online co-op for up to 4 players with scaleable difficulty and loot depending on number of players.
  3. A persistent base that the player builds over the course of their runs to give slight advantages, enhancements, and modifiers before their next run. 
  4. Fluid hand-drawn animations for each character.
  5. Varied soundtrack inspired by music from Deus Ex, Doom, and 80s synth music.

 

Players will experience the fast and frantic gameplay of old-school shooters like Doom and Quake, while having opportunities to build their characters and interact with the world in narrative-based games like Deus Ex and Borderlands. Players start with an inventory of 2, and must balance that with the weapons, items, and equipment that they find throughout the game. Every level's exit must be unlocked with a keycard found in a random location in each level, which takes up an inventory slot. Inventory can be expanded by finding bags in-game or by buying upgrades at the shop, located in each level. Every 3 to 5 levels, the player will face off against a boss, which gives powerful loot and 1 ability power, which ranges from sprinting or dashing to stopping bullets and slowing down time. 

Interaction with NPCs extends far beyond dialogue. Each friendly NPC found in the game can be rescued and returned to the player's base, their own Utopia. Here, the player can decide between buying upgrades during gameplay or saving the money they collect and buying upgrades for their Utopia at the shop. Every NPC rescued has certain attributes and a chance to grant a buff, modifier, weapon, upgrade, or item to the player before their next run.

You have narrowly escaped the collapse of your last Utopia and have been reassigned to a new Utopia that is on the brink of destruction. Using your wits, your skills, and a little bit of luck, you must escape your new Utopia at any cost. 

Players will talk to NPCs, find text and audio logs, and unravel the conspiracy of the artificially engineered Mouse Utopias based on real research and experimentation. 

Players will encounter crazed mice, hostile robots, violent rats, and other, larger animals that are being experimented on by the mysterious Overseers. Although the Utopia is collapsing, not every character will be aggressive towards the players. Mice that are simply trying to survive the chaos will offer their thoughts to the player, and some can even be conversed with to understand their motives and the world. Those with something more to offer will offer players rewards for completing their quests. 

The mice are not the only faction that can be friendly to the player. There is a collection of robots that have overridden their programming, and with this newfound freedom have developed morality. They oppose the oppression of their programmed robotic brothers, and offer their services or guidance to the player when they can. 

 

The unique Indiegogo rewards for Escape From Utopia allow you to not only help get the game funded, but to also be in the game! Every donor will be featured in the credits in tiers based on their donation, as well as having access to wallpapers for the game. The $10 level gets you access to the game upon release on Steam, including an Early Access launch, via a code sent to your email. The $25 level gets you into the game by being a named enemy! When the player is killed in-game, the game over screen will show what enemy killed the player (similar to Binding of Isaac or Nuclear Throne) and your name (or the name you choose) has a chance to appear! The $50 level gets you into the game as a named NPC with a dialogue box. I will work with you on developing your dialogue. The $75 level gets you as an NPC, but the player can converse with you in a limited dialogue option tree. The $100 level gets you a cool Indiegogo exclusive T-Shirt. $150 gets you a more advanced conversing NPC with more branching dialogue options, and the $250 level gets you as a named boss and the ability for design input for the boss (dialogue, encounter scenarios, etc.). The $500 level requires that we speak one-on-one to come to an agreement of what kind of reward is suitable for this level of generosity.  

Head over to Escape From Utopia's website for video and blog updates in addition to the updates made available here on Indiegogo.
story_txt:
Work for Escape From Utopia began all the way back in 2017 when I first discovered the Mouse Utopia experiments by John Calhoun in the 60's. What began as a 2D platformer has evolved into a roguelike first person shooter that strives to combine narrative elements with  randomization and perma-death to create a unique experience that remains engaging for fans of both genres. 
As I have worked on the game and gathered team members, it has been entirely self-funded. To realize the vision of the project, I need your help to make this game a reality. Features like local and online co-op, multiplayer, and ports to consoles are beyond the scope of self-funding. 


$10,000 allows for the development of the following features:

An advanced level generation engine that can create diverse levels filled with enemies and unique enemy formations and combinations depending on the amount of floors cleared, scaleable loot and weapon placements, and NPC and Quest Giver placement. 
Local and Online co-op for up to 4 players with scaleable difficulty and loot depending on number of players.
A persistent base that the player builds over the course of their runs to give slight advantages, enhancements, and modifiers before their next run. 
Fluid hand-drawn animations for each character.
Varied soundtrack inspired by music from Deus Ex, Doom, and 80s synth music.

 

Players will experience the fast and frantic gameplay of old-school shooters like Doom and Quake, while having opportunities to build their characters and interact with the world in narrative-based games like Deus Ex and Borderlands. Players start with an inventory of 2, and must balance that with the weapons, items, and equipment that they find throughout the game. Every level's exit must be unlocked with a keycard found in a random location in each level, which takes up an inventory slot. Inventory can be expanded by finding bags in-game or by buying upgrades at the shop, located in each level. Every 3 to 5 levels, the player will face off against a boss, which gives powerful loot and 1 ability power, which ranges from sprinting or dashing to stopping bullets and slowing down time. 
Interaction with NPCs extends far beyond dialogue. Each friendly NPC found in the game can be rescued and returned to the player's base, their own Utopia. Here, the player can decide between buying upgrades during gameplay or saving the money they collect and buying upgrades for their Utopia at the shop. Every NPC rescued has certain attributes and a chance to grant a buff, modifier, weapon, upgrade, or item to the player before their next run.

You have narrowly escaped the collapse of your last Utopia and have been reassigned to a new Utopia that is on the brink of destruction. Using your wits, your skills, and a little bit of luck, you must escape your new Utopia at any cost. Players will talk to NPCs, find text and audio logs, and unravel the conspiracy of the artificially engineered Mouse Utopias based on real research and experimentation. Players will encounter crazed mice, hostile robots, violent rats, and other, larger animals that are being experimented on by the mysterious Overseers. Although the Utopia is collapsing, not every character will be aggressive towards the players. Mice that are simply trying to survive the chaos will offer their thoughts to the player, and some can even be conversed with to understand their motives and the world. Those with something more to offer will offer players rewards for completing their quests. The mice are not the only faction that can be friendly to the player. There is a collection of robots that have overridden their programming, and with this newfound freedom have developed morality. They oppose the oppression of their programmed robotic brothers, and offer their services or guidance to the player when they can.  The unique Indiegogo rewards for Escape From Utopia allow you to not only help get the game funded, but to also be in the game! Every donor will be featured in the credits in tiers based on their donation, as well as having access to wallpapers for the game. The $10 level gets you access to the game upon release on Steam, including an Early Access launch, via a code sent to your email. The $25 level gets you into the game by being a named enemy! When the player is killed in-game, the game over screen will show what enemy killed the player (similar to Binding of Isaac or Nuclear Throne) and your name (or the name you choose) has a chance to appear! The $50 level gets you into the game as a named NPC with a dialogue box. I will work with you on developing your dialogue. The $75 level gets you as an NPC, but the player can converse with you in a limited dialogue option tree. The $100 level gets you a cool Indiegogo exclusive T-Shirt. $150 gets you a more advanced conversing NPC with more branching dialogue options, and the $250 level gets you as a named boss and the ability for design input for the boss (dialogue, encounter scenarios, etc.). The $500 level requires that we speak one-on-one to come to an agreement of what kind of reward is suitable for this level of generosity.  Head over to Escape From Utopia's website for video and blog updates in addition to the updates made available here on Indiegogo.

story:
Hello, my name is Earl I have been Tabletop gaming since 1999. My vision is to create the best tabletop gaming experience in the river region. My plan is to start small and grow as the community needs.

A new tabletop gaming experience for people of all ages to come and play tabletop games of all kinds. I want to make it a fun experience for everyone who walks through my doors. We will have all kinds of tabletop games & board games. D&D, Pathfinder, Warhammer, Board games like Risk, Monopoly, Chess, & Gloom, just to mention a few. Everyone is welcome.

 RRTG will be an place where you can come & just hang out & learn about games you never knew existed. That are played with awesome miniatures. 

From someone who had never even heard of tabletop gaming in her entire life."If you have never seen a game played with miniatures its an awesome sight. All these little painted men & creatures battling it out"

 If you don't know what tabletop gaming is here is a brief explanation & some pictures to help you understand. You actually buy miniatures & paint them yourself or pay someone else to paint them for you & then play games with them. You can paint them anyway you want to, any color you want to paint them. There are books to help you with the rules. You don't lose your men in the battles they just die & are put to the side for you to play with later. 

I am aiming for Friendly atmosphere with great customer service, Sporting nicely done tables and terrain, and holding regular events. Paint on miniatures is not important except at tournaments where it is a big part of the scoring process.

Gifts for new comers and perks for volunteer event managers. A company that genuinely appreciates your patronage and shows it to you.

I am trying to acquire the funding for the start up  location, some of the inventory, shelving, & the point of sales machine. If you would like to have a new gaming experience, in a fun, supportive atmosphere & see this idea become a reality please donate what you can or feel you can afford thank you for your time.

story:
"A game machine with an innovative design that will shine in any home, compatible with MAME on MAC and PC, and you can also connect MOST current video games systems."

----------------------------------------------------

Stylish design and more solid

Built with parts of the authentics retro arcade cabinets, to perform movements with their joysticks and buttons indestructible.

Design by gamers, for gamers

Every detail has been designed by players who have lived the time of the  arcades in the 80's and 90's. The control panel is identical to the arcades old machines, and we wanted them to have the same resistance as the old machines, but with better games in them, and with an modern design and appropriate style for all homes.


Materials and finishes

  • Two shiny cases: Black or white.
  • Front panel and joystick panel are made of methacrylate of 3mm thick polished, and with a black background mirror.
  • The bottoms and joystick on the control panel have been manufactured with very strong and resistance materials.

What's included in the Arcade R1?

  • Cabin with shiny finish in two colours, black or white.
  • Control for two players.
  • Screen LCD 26” 1080p with HDMI y RCA.
  • 2.1 sound with powerful bass and clarity in midrange and trebles.
  • Port for PC o Mac by USB.
  • Inside space to introdice a Mac Mini, PC,  a PlayStation™ 1, 2, 3 or 4, a Xbox™ or Xbox 360™, a Wii™, a Gamecube™ or a Dreamcast™.

Compatibility with computers and consoles

Due to its multiples conexions and ports that it offers, you can play with most of the existing systems in the market.

  • Mac Mini (OS X 10.5 and beyond)
  • PC (Windows XP and beyond)
  • PlayStation™, PlayStation™ 2, PlayStation™ 3 y PlayStation™ 4
  • Xbox™, xBox 360™ y Xbox One™
  • Nintendo Wii™
  • Nintendo GameCube™
  • Sega Dreamcast™
  • MAME (installed in Mac o PC)

*(Computers and consoles not included, sold separately)

Dimensions and weight

  • Hight, 180cms.
  • Width, 70cms.
  • Background, 60cms
  • Weight, 44kg.

Conexions 

  • Video: 1 jack VGA, 1 toma DVI, 2 jacks HDMI, 1 component input and a RCA jack.
  • Command: Conexions USB for 2 players for PC or Mac, (PlayStation™ 1, 2 o 3, Xbox™ o Xbox 360™, Wii™, Gamecube™ y Dreamcast™).


Going back to the 80's and 90's

With the Recrelux you will feel as if you went back in time when playing to those games, know retro games, just connecting to a MAC or PC configured with MAME and enjoying.


The company

The idea came when in 2010 Omar López (founder), drived by his chilhood memories where he played with the arcade machines, and his experience as designer, he came with the idea of creating a single machine with all the 80's and 90's video games, street fighter II, super pang, out-run, final fight, etc., and actual games.

He designed a gaming machine with all the necessary components, with the challenge of not breaking the aesthetic or design of any home. After months of planning and studying it, he has build the first prototype of the Arcade R1, fully operational and functional.

Currently the project is more advanced, and it has the support of a profesional team with the same goal, take those experiences of the arcades room in the 80's and 90's to your home, in an easy and compatible way with the current and retro games.



Video games, such as Pac-Man™, Space Invaders™, Robotron™, Galaga™, Donkey Kong™ and Street Fighter™, were played during decades in the arcades, with machines we all wished to have some day. 

Recrelux has designed an Arcade machine concept, which resembles to the old ones, but with a much more mother esthetic, with the idea of entering to the real gamers homes, being compatible with most consoles and PC's in the market.


Our goal

The team has taken over 2 years testing, developing the manufacturing process, designing the components, developing a marketing campaign, the marketing approach, and all the details to launch the product all around the world.
At this point we need funds to continue with the project of at least $2.5 million. We are prepared and dispose of the necessary to convert Recrelux in a worldwide known brand of entertainment, and with your support this will be possible.
We believe due to the large number of worldwide video games lovers, this can be the product that will fit in millions of homes, so we want to create a quality product, with impecable finishes and with extreme durability. 


Distribution

We estimate after having received the necessary funds, it will take over 4 months to distribute the first model (Arcade R1) to every country, starting at United States, Canada, Spain and Japan. 

Choose between different configurations

We are developing different configurations with different prices: you will be able to choose between an American  or Japanese joystick, different types of buttons, 1080p or 4K displays, a plug-and-play Micro PCs already configured, and choose  the connectors depending the console you own.


Final sale price in stores and On-line

Once the Recrelux is in the stores, the model Arcade R1 will cost US$ 1.499.


What we need
We have already finished the prototype of the  Arcade R1  100% functional, and now, our goal with the funds we raise will be:
  1. Produce enough units to supply the establishments in United States, Canada, Spain and Japan.
  2. Create a marketing campaign in different languages focuses on the american, canadian, latin and japanese market.
  3. Invest in media communication such as magazines specialised in video games, internet, television and social media to advertise the product.


What you get in return by investing in Recrelux

You may support the project according to your economic possibilities, we have thought in all types investors:

  1. Donating US$ 5 to support the project. 
  2. Investing from US$ 25 to US$ 80 for receiving a discount bonus in the purchase of the Recrelux Arcade R1.
  3. Investing US$ 900 you will receive one of the first units of the Arcade R1 in any of the colours available, saving US$ 599 within the final price!
  4. If you like exclusivity, you may invest $1,900 and receive in your home one of the 1,000 limited units in black, with 2 special seats for players, 4K display, an emblem with your name in the cabin with the serial number, and a complete kit of connections valued on US$ 300 for  (PlayStation™ 1, 2 o 3, Xbox™ o Xbox 360™, Wii™, Gamecube™ y Dreamcast™).


The impact

Every time someone sees the prototype of the Arcade R1 already built and functional, both, children and adults want to play with it. Fun is guarantee, and you may be part of a big project, that will change the way you play video games at home. 


Challenges

Recrelux is a firm commitment from professionals, that since the idea started, they have supported it, worked on the developing until the point we needed funds. This moment has arrived, and now is when we need your collaboration to carry on until the end.

Soon you will see advertising in social media networks, TV and magazines, and you will be proud of being part of the project since it started.


Ways you may help

If you can't collaborate in a economic way in the project, you may invest time in sharing information in social media networks, we will be very grateful.

story:
Dancing Panda Studios, LLC.  

Presents:

Radar Command! 


Radar Command is a RTS (Real Time Strategy) game, where the player deploys scouts or drones to determine and reveal unknown threats, and respond to those threats with appropriate force, and within a budget.

You will, through a simplified interface, be challenged by restraint and the ability to conserve resources.


 

Game Play:

  • With budget provided, you will prepare for the first wave by purchasing the weapons of war.  (Drones, scouts, or whatever your budget allows you to complete your mission)

  • Enemies appear on the radar as red dots, representing a radar signature. Their actual designation can be revealed by deploying drones or scouts where you can engage them or retreat for reinforcements (if you have them.)

  • As more units arrive, you must defend your base.

  • At the conclusion of each match, the budget for the next match will be determined by the outcome and the resources you have left at the end of that round.

  • Your errors, mistakes, and sacrifices will be cumulative. So, the outcome of later encounters will cost you in the end.


Mission:

Dancing Panda Studios, LLC will continue to upgrade and develop the game through its final release.

We will be seeking a place on Valve Software’s Steam platform, through the Steam Greenlight launch platform, and will be available for prerelease through crowd funding sites such as IndieGoGo and Kickstarter.

We will be seeking additional funds throughout the development process to get us to our release goals.

With your help we can make a game that’s challenging and fun to play!


The Shirt!

 

Coasters!

Funding Goals:

1.  500: Greenlight fee and Vegas pro art software

2.  2500: Purchase Unity 5 pro

3.  5000: Adobe Pro subscription

Below is a bit of progression from design to some working assets, you can see more in the Gallery

Initial Game Design:

Maps!

Units!

Pulling it all together.

     


For the Love of the Game,

Michael (Twichy) Thompson

Marketing Manager

Dancing Panda Studio, LLC.

www.dancingpandastudios.com

https://www.facebook.com/DancingPandaStudios

https://twitter.com/dpandastudio

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCYiyLDXHy3CB45qanw9RPpg

http://wiki.dancingpandastudios.com/

http://www.reddit.com/user/DancingPandaStudios

story:
Solaria Moon

Solaria Moon is a single-player space adventure game, with an exciting story full of suspense and challenges that will catch you from the start. Entertaining puzzles, great gameplay, and an awesome story that will give hours of fun. 

A cargo ship receives a mysterious message. All the crew is killed by the computer except our protagonist who must find out who sent the message, why all his friends are died and what is awaiting in the new destination, Solaria Moon 

It is also a personal project, no big companies or professional teams dedicated to the game. I'm just in charge of development and I do in my free time. After more than 20 years professionally dedicated to developing applications I decided to start this adventure alone and use all the knowledge and experience in a game I love like a son. 

Now It is time to introduce the concept of the game and the first fully playable level, which will give you a clear idea of how the game will be, so please, download the game, test and criticize everything that you can. 
Download: Concept Level 1 (Windows 64bits)
Download: Concept Level 1 (Mac)
Download: Concept Level 1 (Linux)
Vote for Solaria Moon in the Greenlight page
Visit the Game Web and the Game Forum


Rewards

Beyond the traditional colaboration rewards, I have think a nice system which make you participate actively in the development process and stay up to date to any news and updates.

  • Your name: Limited number of rewards where your name will appear somewhere within the game.
  • Your photo: Limited number of rewards where your photo will be displayed within the game (in a canvas, picture or screen).
  • Puzzle designer: Limited number of rewards where you help to desing some puzzle within the game.
  • Level designer: Limited number of rewards where you help to desing a full level within the game.
  • Scriptwriter: Limited number of rewards where you help to write some part of the story.
  • Easter egg: Only one reward where you help to design an easter egg inside the game... may be activated by a keystroke cobination, or may be by clicking some objects... up to you!!
And, of course, there will be the traditional rewards: Early access to the game, digital art book, soundtrack, to be listed in the credits, etc... See the complete list of rewadrs and choose what you wish!

Why do I need help?

Altough most of the development is made just by me there are lot of things I need to buy or hire, this is list of the most important ones:

  • Licenses: Unity 3D, Mixamo Fuse, Dazz3D content, Assets licences, Photoshop, and a long etc...
  • Languages: I'm Spanish from Madrid and I speak average English but for sure I will need a native English translator and also translations to other languages.
  • Voices: If you download the concept and play a bit you will notice the lack of voices... Yes, this game need voices to create the apopriate atmosphere. I need to pay a professional studio to record voices, at least, in English and Spanish.
  • Marketing: Once the game will be finished I will need to launch some Marketing campaings. This is probably the most big budget item.
  • Services: Once the Marketing campaigns starts, I need to improve the Web and also to hire a community manager.
  • Ilustrations: Most of the 3D art is bought from Unity Store but I will need personalized illustrations of the game. I will need to pay a professional illustrator.
By the moment I've invested more than 4000$ from my pocket and I'm happy with this, but if we wish the game to get a good quality level it's needed to invest more.
The complete budget will be published in the forum page.

When will the game be finished?

I have been developing the concept for two months. Now I have a solid game engine and logic. I spect to develop a new level every two or three weeks, so, for a game with 10 or 15 hours of gameplay, probably I will need between 8 and 12 months. 

Anyway I will launch updates periodically and all collaborators will stay up to date to the development process. 

How can you help?

The most obvious way to help is making a donation on indiegogo but for sure, there are more ways you can help:

  • Enter Greenlight web and vote for us.
  • Send comments and ideas to the Greenlight web.
  • Talk to your friends about the game.
  • Send any idea or improvement to us.
story_txt:
Solaria Moon Solaria Moon is a single-player space adventure game, with an exciting story full of suspense and challenges that will catch you from the start. Entertaining puzzles, great gameplay, and an awesome story that will give hours of fun. 




A cargo ship receives a mysterious message. All the crew is killed by the computer except our protagonist who must find out who sent the message, why all his friends are died and what is awaiting in the new destination, Solaria Moon 
It is also a personal project, no big companies or professional teams dedicated to the game. I'm just in charge of development and I do in my free time. After more than 20 years professionally dedicated to developing applications I decided to start this adventure alone and use all the knowledge and experience in a game I love like a son. Now It is time to introduce the concept of the game and the first fully playable level, which will give you a clear idea of how the game will be, so please, download the game, test and criticize everything that you can. 
Download: Concept Level 1 (Windows 64bits)Download: Concept Level 1 (Mac)Download: Concept Level 1 (Linux)
Vote for Solaria Moon in the Greenlight pageVisit the Game Web and the Game Forum


Rewards
Beyond the traditional colaboration rewards, I have think a nice system which make you participate actively in the development process and stay up to date to any news and updates.


Your name: Limited number of rewards where your name will appear somewhere within the game.

Your photo: Limited number of rewards where your photo will be displayed within the game (in a canvas, picture or screen).


Puzzle designer: Limited number of rewards where you help to desing some puzzle within the game.

Level designer: Limited number of rewards where you help to desing a full level within the game.

Scriptwriter: Limited number of rewards where you help to write some part of the story.

Easter egg: Only one reward where you help to design an easter egg inside the game... may be activated by a keystroke cobination, or may be by clicking some objects... up to you!!


And, of course, there will be the traditional rewards: Early access to the game, digital art book, soundtrack, to be listed in the credits, etc... See the complete list of rewadrs and choose what you wish!


Why do I need help? Altough most of the development is made just by me there are lot of things I need to buy or hire, this is list of the most important ones:  
Licenses: Unity 3D, Mixamo Fuse, Dazz3D content, Assets licences, Photoshop, and a long etc... 
Languages: I'm Spanish from Madrid and I speak average English but for sure I will need a native English translator and also translations to other languages.

Voices: If you download the concept and play a bit you will notice the lack of voices... Yes, this game need voices to create the apopriate atmosphere. I need to pay a professional studio to record voices, at least, in English and Spanish.

Marketing: Once the game will be finished I will need to launch some Marketing campaings. This is probably the most big budget item.

Services: Once the Marketing campaigns starts, I need to improve the Web and also to hire a community manager.

Ilustrations: Most of the 3D art is bought from Unity Store but I will need personalized illustrations of the game. I will need to pay a professional illustrator. 
By the moment I've invested more than 4000$ from my pocket and I'm happy with this, but if we wish the game to get a good quality level it's needed to invest more.
The complete budget will be published in the forum page.




    When will the game be finished?
 I have been developing the concept for two months. Now I have a solid game engine and logic. I spect to develop a new level every two or three weeks, so, for a game with 10 or 15 hours of gameplay, probably I will need between 8 and 12 months. 
Anyway I will launch updates periodically and all collaborators will stay up to date to the development process.    How can you help? The most obvious way to help is making a donation on indiegogo but for sure, there are more ways you can help:   Enter Greenlight web and vote for us.
Send comments and ideas to the Greenlight web. Talk to your friends about the game.
Send any idea or improvement to us.

story:
Hello

Hi, thanks for being here. I'm a Graphic Designer and Illustrator from Northern California. I designed this delectable set of playing cards based on one of my favorite hobbies: cooking! The Chef Deck is a full set of 54 standard playing cards. I designed and illustrated the entire deck. The illustrations are inspired by minimal Mid-Century Modern geometric design. They have a retro vibe and a fun, bright color palette. 

The deck is a set of functional playing cards. The standard suits have been replaced by cooking utensils for a fun spin on the traditional deck design. The face cards feature all female chefs.


What I Need

I had several sample decks printed and have found a quality manufacturer. What I need now is money to produce a larger batch of decks to share and sell. $2000 will help me get a sizable number of decks printed on high-quality linen card stock in their own custom box. Since the samples have been approved, I can order the final decks once I'm funded and have them ready in time for Christmas.

If I don't reach my entire goal, I will still be able to go to print, I'll just create a smaller quantity of decks.

Perks!

There will be some special perks besides the Chef Deck playing cards. These include blank recipe cards for keeping track of your favorite recipes and limited edition prints to beautify your space.

  • Playing Cards - Standard deck with 54 cards (including Jokers). Printed on Casino quality, thick Linen card stock in their own box. 2.5" x 3.5".
  • Recipe Cards - Double-sided cards. 4" x 6". One set = 10 cards.
  • Print - Two-color limited edition print featuring kitchen utensils based on the card back. Hand-numbered and signed on fine art paper. 5" x 7".
  • Framed Print - Only 5 available. Hand-numbered and signed on fine art paper. Matted to 5" x 7", frame size is 9" x 11". Dark brown eco frame made of bamboo.
Shipping is free in the USA on everything except the framed prints.
Worldwide shipping prices are shown on available items.


Why Contribute?

This project is a unique opportunity for me to share my art and promote myself as a graphic designer and illustrator. It will allow me to share my skills with colleagues, customers, and potential employers.

I love what I do and this will help me share my art with all of you.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge is to just reach my goal. Proofs and samples of the deck have been approved in advance, so once I get my funding I can quickly go to print. I am in communication with the printer and they have ensured me that the decks will make my deadline.

I have experience in shipping and recieving and will not have any issues with the mailing portion of the project. My biggest concern will be getting the perks to everyone in a timely matter, this includes anyone buying for holiday gifts.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't in a place to help financially, don't worry. I appreciate that you are reading this. If you can, please let others know about my campaign by sharing through social media, email and good 'ol word of mouth. That's it. You're great. Thank you.

story:
Greetings and Welcome!


We are Haphazard Projects, a small-press game design crew with only one weakness: we have no artists! We have still managed to get two game books published (that part we do by ourselves - printing and distribution) and a free fan-work of DC's comics Green Lantern Corps for our in-house rules known as the DPS System, now in its "2nd Edition" and available to play via Facebook and G+ Hangouts.

Chronicles of the Orb: Shaedeam's Song is an epic RPG more than 25 years in the making. The whole time, the characters, races, setting details... everything but the mechanics have always been the same. 


The phrase "Chronicles of the Orb" is the title the game and "Shaedeam's Song" details the setting. There are indeed other "Songs" that have been written, but all will use the characters and creatures developed here within.

Shaedeam is a huge planet, more than twice the size of Earth, with more than 300,000 years of fictional history. The game elements are unique and have never before been seen in any novel, comic book, film or video game. Over 120 unique races and four levels of character creation: Adventurer, Explorer, Heroic and Epic. 

The DPS System is specifically designed to be intuitive and interactive. Creating a character takes as long as the player would like. Whether you spend ten minutes or two hours, the character balance remains the same.


We will make the game available for play prior to release so that you can play before you buy! Simply visit us on Facebook and watch out for our hosted game events!


The writing is the easy part, and that is what we do best. The Adventurer Core Set is complete and ready for release.  Shipping costs are included with the Perk Cost.

The other Core Sets are in various stages of development.

Phase One of this project will allow us to start pulling together an art staff and promotional materials.  Three more Phases of development will follow, each including new material to expand the game's optional mechanics and setting and the raised funds will also expand the art and layout of the Core Sets.

If we don't reach the $5000 goal, the money will be going towards promotional items and publicity via popular websites, podcasts and the like. Exposure can only help any further efforts to bring these games to life. Backers will still receive the PDFs and physical copies as per their purchased Perk level.


                   


One of the biggest items we can flaunt is the fact that this Gothic horror-fantasy RPG destroys the industry standard tropes. No human-centric lands or governments, no spell lists, no horses (a big in-house item), and over 120 races that have never been seen before in any venue - from comic books to novels, to video games and RPGs, you'll find strange and unique races become the standard for the setting. From the mighty M'Kecht Giants to the tiniest Ohpian Merchant-Kings.

                             


We have unique rules for two forms of arcane spell casting, eight schools of magic unique to Shaedeam, two unique forms of psychic powers and a role-play intensive faith-based system that is almost completely devoid of game mechanics.

                     

With our in-house core rules system, we have no Classes. It is a point based build allowing you to play whatever race you may want, any way you may desire and even create your own unique races just the way you want them - complete with in-game relationships to society and governments they may encounter during the game.

                      


Creating your own races can take as little as ten minutes. Using one of our in-game races can cut character creation down to a mere five minutes. Of course, you can take as long as you want to build your perfect character, but in a pinch you can get into a game without a lot of planning or study-time needed.


Time is our own side! Though we will probably get these books ready prior to our March '16 expected date, we want to make sure we aren't setting a goal without a little bit of rope to allow for some unforeseen problems... which invariably always crop up.


Plus, this project is just one step in increasing public awareness of the game. So even if we fail, we win!


If it boils down to contributions that are unable to cover the game's artwork, we will (*sigh*) release the books sans art. 



We understand that new RPGs are a tricky item. A lot of players are comfortable with what they are already playing, and we get that too. 

If you want to back us, but just don't have a  dollar to throw our way, you can still help us! All you have to do is play in one of our One-Shot groups online, post and share your opinions and experience with the setting with your friends and fellow gamers! Every time you post something about #ShaedeamSong, that's a few more folk that might be interesting in contributing to the project, and every post you make is just more publicity we can get!

Also, if you know people in the industry: bloggers, reviewers and such it would be amazing if you pointed us in that direction! In fact, that might be the biggest assist you might throw our way!

story:
(Actual Sample of Our Steam Riot Deck)

STEAM RIOT Playing Cards!

Come one come all ladies and gents adventure awaits you at Steam Riot City! You will find time is of no limitations or boundaries here. Blast into the past and future to unveil deep seeded mysteries of this high voltage electrifying city. Let this magical deck of playing cards be the ultimate masterpiece to your collection. Be the first to receive the 1st series of Steam Riot City decks made by D. Monstres, featuring Dr. Sharp's Steampunk Gear (www.drsharpsteampunk.com)!

Here are some of the highlights of the Steam Riot campaign: 

  • Custom illustrated deck by D. Monstres and crafted masks by Dr. Sharp.
  • Richly designed and eye catching deck.
  • Excellent Collector's item.
  • Hand drawn illustrations.
  • Custom tuck box.

 

PERKS

Risks & Challenges

The sample deck we printed with M.P.C turned out fantastic! If we can raise our goal higher, we're looking at USPCC!!  

As for the steampunk masks, Dr. Sharp has been creating costumes for many years and has a excellent reputation for creating quality work. He's worked with several high profile celebrities and also ran a couple of successful campaigns himself. He knows what to except to make sure pledges are fulfilled! 

As with most start up projects, we may encounter a "hiccup" here and there, but we anticipate that the project will run smoothly. We will keep everyone up to date if there are any issues along the way.

Other Ways to Help!

Please spread the word and follow our social media!!
Facebook:
www.facebook.com/dmonstrz 
www.facebook.com/drsharpsteampunk

Instagram: drsharpsteampunkgear
Tumblr: drsharpsteampunkgear
Twitter: drsharpsteampunkgear
Please also remember to use Indiegogo share tools!

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

story:
What is Kings of the North?

Kings of the North is a StarCraft II tournament series, built with a love for StarCraft, inspired by events like Iron Squid and Homestory Cup, and fueled by a desire to increase the amount of live events in North America. This is the second season of Kings of the North; this time we expanded its size and scope.

With the help of our partners and sponsors we have been able to raise a base prize pool of $3,000 to put on an event in our studio that we promise will be filled with great matches from Legacy of the Void and eSports debauchery all weekend long.

Who are we?

For years at ESCHAMP we have been putting on smaller local LANs through our TorCraft series in Toronto. Our objective is to step up our organizing efforts by creating something both entertaining to watch and of value to the community. We don’t believe the days of StarCraft events are over, so instead of waiting around for someone else to do something, we’ve decided to put to put this together.

The Plan

This is happening whether the world wants it or not (though we hope it does), but we wanted to find ways to help improve the event itself.  So, here we have an IndieGoGo campaign to allow the community to help contribute to growing the event.

Instead of just donating money we wanted to attach it to rewards and indieGoGo was the best place to do it. Everytime someone contributes it helps make for a better event. 

How are the Funds Being Used?

The original plan was to use the money to fill the bathtub with Jell-o, but we figured the community wouldn’t like that (or would you?). So instead we decided it’s best to use the funds on things that will actually help the event. 


The Players



The Tournament

Why a LAN Qualifer?  Well because it’s a throwback to our TorCraft Series that supported our local Toronto StarCraft scene. We never want to leave that behind, so while we have discontinued TorCraft we wanted to incorporate its spirit into Kings of the North.

More details for the tournament can be found on the event site.

Perks


The Goals 



**Special**

As part of our goal to put on a good show we’ll be doing a special live episode of SC2CTL Jeopardy! Your host Troy Pavlek will  grill our players and commentators on their StarCraft II knowledge.

What if I can’t afford to donate ?

There are many ways you can help out that don’t involve money. You could simply share the event, or watch it live on twitch.tv/eschamp

Or you could always send us a tweet or join our discord channel to tell us about awesome things. These are definitely the best ways to brighten our day.  :)

story:
Tour Goals

Firearms are so much more than just a topic for political debate.
The 2016 election year is the perfect time for an honest look at firearms in the U.S.A. through the collectors, gun shops, museums and gun shows around the country

We plan to travel across the United States sharing facets of the firearms owners experience

We will;

  • Seek Out & Share Firearms Stories in the USA
  • Visit and review interesting, local Gun Shops
  • Explore & set up at Gun Shows all over the U.S.A.
  • Share interesting Guns & Firearms Collections
  • Visit & promote Firearms Museums & Historic Locations
  • Interview Gun Rights Organization reps and interesting firearms industry & community individuals
  • Tour Manufacturers, Importers & Distributors
  • Encourage others to participate & contribute to 2nd amendment efforts

Backers & Perks

We are interested in assistance finding & contacting all the best gun shops, museums, gun shows and ranges along our way

We welcome financial help with Gas & Food 
Here is how we will break down the perks & contributions. 

Those who participate can decide where their funds will be used & backers will get a custom patch (or coin) in return for their support:

  • $5   - "Gas Money", Thank You
  • $25 - "Buy Us Breakfast", Feed the Crew & Get a Patch
  • $25 - "Feed the Dog", Get a Patch
  • $25 - "GW Pit Crew", Help with Repairs, Oil, Tires, etc & Get a Patch
  • $25 - "Tour Bus Pit Crew", help us buy the ambulance & Get a Patch
  • $25 - "Tour Tech Support", fund internet, cameras, software & Get a Patch
  • $100 - Tour Bus "Call Shotgun", help us buy the ambulance &  Get a fancy Patch
  • $100 - "Gun Show Table", help us get tables at shows &  Get a fancy Patch 
Suggest a stop on the tour
  • $100 - Featured Gun Shop
  • $50 - Featured Gun Show
  • $50 - Featured Gun Range
Limited Edition Coin
  • $50 - Tour Coin (only 100 will be made)

Funding Goals

We plan to set up at gun shows along the way, selling our patches, decals & other merchandise. We will welcome any financial assistance and plan to use it to fund the trips expenses. 

Here is how we will use funds that are raised

  • $0 - $3,000 All funds will be used for gas & trip expenses (Gas, Food, Hotel, Entrance Fees)
  • $3,000 - $5,000 If / When we reach this goal, we buy a vehicle as our tour bus / office. And then travel expenses drop to mostly food & gas
  • $7,500 - $15,000 This will fund an ambulance , or fix up any issues on the vehicle we get

Expected Results

We plan to document our adventures on multiple platforms and with various content:

  • Our daily LIVE show & podcast
  • Daily blogs & new articles on our websites devoted to Gun Shops, Gun Shows & Firearms 
  • You Tube Videos 
  • Photographs on IG, Gun Channels & our websites
  • We will update and expand our maps & event calendars 
  • GunChannles.com, You Tube, iTunes, Facebook, Instagram & more
We plan to: 
  • Travel across the country
  • Add to our growing list of Gun Shop & Gun Show Visits
  • Discover & Promote Firearms Museums
  • Raise awareness of Recreational & Sport Shooting
  • Seek out U.S. firearms history
  • Share interesting firearms collections
  • Visit Firearms Manufacturers, Importers & Distributors
  • Attend Machine Gun Shoots & other Shooting Events
Destinations:
The list of locations we plan to visit (this list will grow)
  • Bannerman Castle, New York
  • J.M. Davis Firearms Museum, Oklahoma
  • NRA National Meeting, Kentucky
  • Smithsonian Collection, D.C.
  • NRA Museum, Virginia
  • New NRA Museum, Missiouri 
  • Dayton Air Museum, Ohio
  • NORAD, Colorado
  • Real Surplus Stores
  • Interesting Gun Shops
  • As many Gun Shows as possible
Risks & Challenges

We will travel, how long we are able to continue will be a factor of how interested people are in our adventures. Risks are few for this campaign 

  • We will make or have made all the rewards (patches & coins) so there is no risk of not receiving them
  • The duration & scope of our travels will be determined by the success of this campaign

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people can't contribute, but they can still help a lot
If this is something you would like to see happen, 

  • Please help to get the word out & make some noise about this campaign.
  • Use the social media share tools above to share our campaign 

Thank You
story_txt:
Tour Goals Firearms are so much more than just a topic for political debate. The 2016 election year is the perfect time for an honest look at firearms in the U.S.A. through the collectors, gun shops, museums and gun shows around the country
We plan to travel across the United States sharing facets of the firearms owners experience
We will;  Seek Out & Share Firearms Stories in the USA
Visit and review interesting, local Gun Shops Explore & set up at Gun Shows all over the U.S.A.
Share interesting Guns & Firearms Collections
Visit & promote Firearms Museums & Historic Locations
Interview Gun Rights Organization reps and interesting firearms industry & community individuals
Tour Manufacturers, Importers & Distributors Encourage others to participate & contribute to 2nd amendment efforts
   Backers & Perks We are interested in assistance finding & contacting all the best gun shops, museums, gun shows and ranges along our way
We welcome financial help with Gas & Food Here is how we will break down the perks & contributions. 
Those who participate can decide where their funds will be used & backers will get a custom patch (or coin) in return for their support:


$5   - "Gas Money", Thank You
$25 - "Buy Us Breakfast", Feed the Crew & Get a Patch

$25 - "Feed the Dog", Get a Patch

$25 - "GW Pit Crew", Help with Repairs, Oil, Tires, etc & Get a Patch
$25 - "Tour Bus Pit Crew", help us buy the ambulance & Get a Patch

$25 - "Tour Tech Support", fund internet, cameras, software & Get a Patch

$100 - Tour Bus "Call Shotgun", help us buy the ambulance &  Get a fancy Patch
$100 - "Gun Show Table", help us get tables at shows &  Get a fancy Patch 

Suggest a stop on the tour


$100 - Featured Gun Shop
$50 - Featured Gun Show
$50 - Featured Gun Range


Limited Edition Coin

$50 - Tour Coin (only 100 will be made)
   Funding Goals We plan to set up at gun shows along the way, selling our patches, decals & other merchandise. We will welcome any financial assistance and plan to use it to fund the trips expenses. 
Here is how we will use funds that are raised


$0 - $3,000 All funds will be used for gas & trip expenses (Gas, Food, Hotel, Entrance Fees)

$3,000 - $5,000 If / When we reach this goal, we buy a vehicle as our tour bus / office. And then travel expenses drop to mostly food & gas
$7,500 - $15,000 This will fund an ambulance , or fix up any issues on the vehicle we get


Expected Results
We plan to document our adventures on multiple platforms and with various content:  Our daily LIVE show & podcast
Daily blogs & new articles on our websites devoted to Gun Shops, Gun Shows & Firearms 
You Tube Videos 
Photographs on IG, Gun Channels & our websites
We will update and expand our maps & event calendars 

GunChannles.com, You Tube, iTunes, Facebook, Instagram & more 
We plan to: 



Travel across the country


Add to our growing list of Gun Shop & Gun Show Visits


Discover & Promote Firearms Museums


Raise awareness of Recreational & Sport Shooting


Seek out U.S. firearms history

Share interesting firearms collections

Visit Firearms Manufacturers, Importers & Distributors

Attend Machine Gun Shoots & other Shooting Events


Destinations:

The list of locations we plan to visit (this list will grow)


Bannerman Castle, New York
J.M. Davis Firearms Museum, Oklahoma
NRA National Meeting, Kentucky
Smithsonian Collection, D.C.
NRA Museum, Virginia
New NRA Museum, Missiouri 
Dayton Air Museum, Ohio
NORAD, Colorado
Real Surplus Stores
Interesting Gun Shops
As many Gun Shows as possible

Risks & Challenges
    We will travel, how long we are able to continue will be a factor of how interested people are in our adventures. Risks are few for this campaign   We will make or have made all the rewards (patches & coins) so there is no risk of not receiving them
The duration & scope of our travels will be determined by the success of this campaign    Other Ways You Can Help Some people can't contribute, but they can still help a lotIf this is something you would like to see happen,   Please help to get the word out & make some noise about this campaign. Use the social media share tools above to share our campaign    Thank You

story:
The Shirt has Been Added

As mentioned in the Updates, we are throwing a release party and have been gathering sponsors and Raffle prizes and in the whirlwind. We have ended up with Branded shirts. So we have added them as a perk here. Available in sizes Xsm to 5XL It has it's own perk level, or you can fund whatever other perk you want +$25 (+$10 more for international shipping)
And if you are in the Seattle Tacoma area, come to the release party on Feb 26. Info Here https://www.facebook.com/events/1081777608539531/


Short Summary

We are Will Carson and Ron Leota of Attention Span Games. And this is the 2nd game, Laser Metal, in our 2nd franchise, Pocket RPGs.

Laser metal is the first real step in making our mix and match genre parody RPG series. Our first game in the series, DnDizzle was a comedic homage to Fantasy Table Top RPGs through the lens of 80-90's hip hop. Laser metal brings the same irreverence to a post apocalyptic future but this time with the medium of all things Metal. 

Each game in the series is it's own stand alone game with it's own world and setting, but each game also runs on the same basic 2d6 rule set. Which means, you can get any Pocket RPG and play it solo with no other source material. But you can also mix and match them for even more off the wall hilarity.

We have designed each book to be a pocket sized masterpiece. Measuring 6"wide by 4" tall, it is the perfect size to fit in your pocket, and with it, 2d6, some scratch paper (or printed character sheets) and a writing implement, you have everything you need to play, fit nicely into the inside pocket of your jacket... or any other pocket of that rough size. We also designed it to be worth it's cost just for the read and even more worth while for the person who wants to play in the world we have created. 

The creators of Laser Metal and why we are crowd funding

Every member of the Laser Metal team has an ownership stake in this project. And while we have the funding to print the books. It's selling them that gets us all paid for the time and effort we have put into this project. 

Laser Metal launches on February 12th. This campaign is specifically to open up our project of awesome to even more people. The presales that happen through this Indiegogo campaign go directly to paying the writer, editor, artists and everyone else who worked on and believes in this project. So we ask that if you like RPGs, If you love satire and/or you love the various forms of Metal. Support Independent creators with your contribution today. 

If you have friends who may enjoy this project, please share it to boost our signal.

story:
GetRekt -- eSports betting system

Our website will provide a betting system for games like: CS:GO, League of Legends, Dota2 etc.

The idea started last year when i was playing a lot of 1v1 League of Legends matches with my friends for money. 

On GetRekt you will be able to bet on players around the world or you can bet on your own matches on games like League of Legends, Counter Strike, Dota, Starcraft, and other multiplayer games.

The dekstop app will be able to record matches in real time and give you an easier way to find and acces players around the world.

Based on your profile history and other players profiles you'll get some suggestions from our matchmaker system

The funds will be used to acquire the website domain name, get a good hosting server and finish developing the website.

 So our betting system will provide:

  • Player vs player matches where you can win some money, with option to play in teams
  • Bets on your favourite eGaming team
  • Bets on other players around the world
  • A desktop app for an easy view of the matches.
  • The option to bet with skins or other in-game items.
  • More features coming soon.
PS: Check out "http://www.crowdfundfusion.com/" for help with your crowdfunding campaign

story:
This DLC-like radio station mod will add over 10+ brand new top quality voice acted radio stations into the game Fallout 4.


About this project

First came Old World Radio for Fallout New Vegas which added 11 brand new radio stations into the game. Many long days and hours went into the creation of the world's largest radio station mod for Fallout New Vegas. Old World Radio - Boston will continue this tradition for Fallout 4 and will have professionally voice-acted content including celebrity voices, lore-friendly audio-drama, lore-friendly commercials and plenty more and will also be a mass improvement compared to the original Old World Radio mod for New Vegas. We want to be able to make this radio station mod actually make people who haven't even previously played the game, want to play just for the incredible voice-acting, story telling and humor that it will bring to Fallout 4. These endorsements will contribute to the furthering of the quality and talent of this massive DLC-like radio station mod for Fallout 4. I want to thank the supporters, the talent and most of all, the support of all fans of Old World Radio and the Fallout video game series.


Risks and challenges

One of the biggest challenges is hiring and obtaining paid professional and celebrity voice-actors. We want to be able to pay them for their wonderful talent and have the content of this DLC-like addon be of top-notch quality! So far, we have completed 4 stations that feel like official DLC! We cannot complete a handful of current station projects due to financial reasons. We need to raise money to pay the talent. We also have plans to purchase rights to some incredible copyrighted material to feature in this project but we need your help! Most of us Old World Radio - Boston crew including the mastermind behind it all, are "average-joe" factory workers making under $30,000 a year! We are just everyday super-fans of the Fallout lore and Fallout game series that want to make something incredible to contribute to all the fellow fans and creators of this amazing universe we all know and love!


What we have created (and are working on) so far

Right now we have 11 stations completed and released and will be creating more soon!

RELEASED:
1. Cadillac Jack's Radio Shack-
This station is hosted by "Isaiah Pendergrass" and plays the best big band and swing old time music.  Isaiah is the brother of "Moses Pendergrass" who hosts the brand new Galaxy News Radio in Boston.

2. Tumbleweed Tunes-
This station is hosted by a Sam Elliott sound-a-like named "Dusty Dude" and he plays his numberous guitars on the air and tells stories of his days in New Vegas, travelling across country and western words of wisdom.

3. Agatha's Song Returns-
Back in Fallout 3, there was a quest where you help an old lady named "Agatha" get back her violin.  Once completed, it opened up a new radio station hosted by Agatha in where she would play her violin on the air.  We have brought her back and she tells stories of her travels from Washington D.C. to Boston and talks about characters in the game Fallout 4.  She plays an entire new playlist of solo violin songs.

4. Galaxy News Radio-
This station is hosted by the brother Isaiah Pendergrass from Cadillac Jack's Radio Shack.  His name is Moses Pendergrass and is voiced by one of the world's best Morgan Freeman sound-a-likes!  He has news reports and great blues music!  "He brings you the news, and the blues!"

5. Tales from the Zone-
This plays old episodes of The Twilight Zone

6.  Civil Defense Radio-
This station plays old conelrad civil defense audio regarding nuclear fallout and atom bombs and such.

7. Red Rocket Radio Bop-
This station plays the best old world Rockabilly tunes and is hosted by a Christopher Walken sound-a-like who is broadcasting from an old Red Rocket Truck Stop.  He hit his head coming out of the vault so he is a bit off.

8. Synthstream FM-
This station plays the best Synthwave a.k.a. "New Retro" 80's synthesiser music.  It is hosted by a Bobcat Goldthwait sound-a-like named "Ice Cream Carl" who broadcasts out of an armored weaponized ice cream truck.  He sells guns, ammo and of course glowing irradiated ice cream!  You get to listen to him get in trouble around the Boston wasteland while playing the best Synthwave music!  We have about 20+ popular synthwave artist's permissions to use their tunes in this awesome addition to Old World Radio - Boston!

9. Gopnik Radio - 
Plays the best old world Soviet propaganda music and is hosted by a hilariously funny voice acted DJ who is guaranteed to make you laugh!

10. X Minus One - 
Plays one of the best sci-fi old time radio shows in existence "X Minus One."  This is one to listen to while building your settlements for sure.

11. Pee-Wee's Playlist - 
Plays old audio from Pee-Wee's Playhouse and includes some wacky music too!

IN DEVELOPMENT:
1. NIN-OWR (aka: Nine Inch Nails - Old World Radio)- 
Plays the best in Nine Inch Nails instrumental music!  This one is a personal addition, but I am sure others will appreciate it as well!  Thank you Trent Reznor for making your music Creative-Commons licensed! (Creative Commons Attribution Non-Commercial Share Alike license.)

2. Uncle Jim's Jamboree - 
This will play songs by my Uncle Jim Morrison (not of The Doors) ...yet he did perform The Doors covers!  He will be his own DJ, telling crazy life stories and playing songs he has written himself and performed by himself and his musicians!

3. Made Man Radio - Plays the best gangster themed music from back in the 30's 40's and 50's and is hosted by a voice-acted DJ!

4. Irish Pride Radio - Plays the best old world Irish tunes and is hosted by an Irishman.

We have some other "secret plans" that we want to create but we definitely need your support to pull it off!
