story:
Please share on social media!

The Escapad Omnidirectional Virtual Reality walking board:

  • Walk in Place 
  • Turn 360 degrees
  • Portable
  • No harness and/or special shoes needed
  • Relatively Quiet
  • Accessible 

Omnidirectional treadmills are means to walk around in virtual reality. There are a few available and their mostly quite large and costly. We set out to create the proof of concept version of the Escapad.

At this phase, We are also interested in technically skilled partners and smart manufacturers to get in touch with!,..but ofcourse we will need support to be able to afford the making of a better prototype.


We hope that you see the potential of this re-imagined treadmill!



ESCAPAD: Omnidirectional Virtual Reality walking board

From the moment this idea came to mind and the conclusion that no-one has thought of this solution before, it has been a race to make a prototype and present this to you. This patent pending ESCAPAD is a dream come true. Before this hits retail you will own it and love it. 

2016 & Virtual Reality

We are all aware that the next big thing is Virtual Reality. It seems like every major electronics company is creating its own Virtual Reality headset. From dedicated sets, to headsets which require the insertion of a smartphone. The consumer is already able to access VR on a large scale, from relatively basic tech solutions, to hi-end installations. Especially in 2016 a lot of VR hardware and software is expected.

The Oculus rift/ Samsung gear VR, PlayStation VR, HTC Vive and also the Google cardboard are already well known and highly anticipated. Our ultimate goal is to gain support from these companies for full interaction and compatibility to their headsets.

The immersive experience relies a lot on movement. Imagination has been put into finding the best way to walk in Virtual Reality. We have seen other devices of which some have gained a lot of attention and support. Yet none have reached the dedicated consumer. This might have to do with the size and the mechanics of these devices. The consumer would very much like to have something less ostentatious, ultra-storable and none restraining. This is where the ESCAPAD makes the difference.


Not just for gaming

Even though gaming is the first thing that comes to mind when talking about virtual reality. There are a lot of serious applications that can be improved by this peripheral. Real estate agents will use the Escapad to give clients a walking tour through a virtual house that is for sale. Interior decorators, contractors, architects and more can now present their ideas in a more immersive way. 

Sports coaches can use this to explain a strategy to the team. If it is too rainy outside to jog, you can go jogging on the Escapad with or without a VR headset.

Being able to walk around can be useful to reconstruct situations like reenactments of a crime scene. The Escapad can also serve as a tool for several therapies.

Size

It is roughly the size of a small skateboard, with two sliding and turning plateaus for your feet. This portable gadget enables you to make a walking movement, turn 360 degrees at will, strafe as in FPS, make a kicking move and all while staying in place. 

Best of all, you can just step on it. Shoes or without shoes. It doesn’t matter how big or small you are because opposed to other popular devices, there is no harness involved. Where other devices claim to be without loud noise, the ESCAPAD wins in quietness due to the fact the board hardly touches the floor when walking.


Less fatigue

We know you have watched the other devices and wondered how long it would take for you to get tired on those. The ESCAPAD does not require you to walk in a manner that creates friction. It is simply the wobble you naturally make when walking, and the natural placing of your foot that creates the movement that translates into the virtual environment.  

We want you to have this. Imagine just using a smartphone inserted into a google cardboard for example and playing a game that connects to the ESCAPAD by Bluetooth!

What's in it/how does it work?

(Without going into the patent pending mechanics:)As with most VR Treadmills, this is not motorized. Your feet move the plateaus, the optical/motion sensors in the plateaus make sure the motion detection is direct and reliable. The position of the board determines which way the movement is directed to, also by use of optical/motion sensors. Vibration units in the board will complete the experience. We are working with software developers to make sure the movement of each step is translated into the gaming experience. The reactions on the prototype so far have been enthusiastic.  

This device is super portable and can be placed anywhere without taking up a lot of space. 

Environmental

If we expect our product to be a success, we must also take into account the environmental impact of manufacturing the Escapad. From the start we have and will explore the friendliest options. Keep an open mind and have quality and Safety aligned to be able to guarantee durability. Furthermore, the Escapad will require the same connectivity and energy supplies as your game controller.

Unpacking

We want you to have this. Experience the unpacking. Become one of the founders of a future we have all been longing for. Amaze your friends and let them join in the experience. Soon you will all have your device with you in the same place, or online. Playing the latest FPS, walking, running or crouching, wow!



Risks & Challenges

In order to uphold the reputation of crowdfunding we see it as our duty to keep you informed about the progress and give as much disclosure as the business allows. Fully aware that not all campaigns succeed even with the best intentions, we believe that good management involves security, responsibility and clear dialogue. 

Our business plan is taking into account various scenarios. As soon as we have a marketable product we will return to indiegogo in order to make sure our first round backers will receive their discount, as well as the promise of an early shipping!

 Depending on what percentage of our goal we reach, we have mapped out the best way to make sure you will get the Escapad within the projected timeframe.

Our journey will be logged for future projects along the same path. As part of the 'future making industry' we believe in the Escapad as being the most logical and convenient solution to walk in VR. 

Please feel free to contact us with any inquiries about the Escapad. And you can already help a lot by sharing this via social media!

The Oculus rift/ Samsung gear VR, PlayStation
VR, HTC Vive and also the Google cardboard are already well known and highly
anticipated. Our ultimate goal is to gain support from these companies for full interaction and compatibility
to their headsets.
The immersive
experience relies a lot on movement. Imagination has been put into finding the
best way to walk in Virtual Reality. We have seen other devices of which some
have gained a lot of attention and support. Yet none have reached the dedicated
consumer. This might have to do with the size and the mechanics of these
devices. The consumer would very much like to have something less ostentatious,
ultra-storable and none restraining. This is where the ESCAPAD makes the
difference.




Not just for gaming
Even though gaming is
the first thing that comes to mind when talking about virtual reality. There
are a lot of serious applications that can be improved by this peripheral. Real
estate agents will use the Escapad to give clients a walking tour through a
virtual house that is for sale. Interior decorators, contractors, architects
and more can now present their ideas in a more immersive way. 
Sports coaches can
use this to explain a strategy to the team. If it is too rainy outside to jog,
you can go jogging on the Escapad with or without a VR headset.
Being able to walk
around can be useful to reconstruct situations like reenactments of a crime
scene. The Escapad can also serve as a tool for several therapies.


Size
It is roughly the
size of a small skateboard, with two sliding and turning plateaus for your feet.
This portable gadget enables you to make a walking movement, turn 360 degrees
at will, strafe as in FPS, make a kicking move and all while staying in
place. 
Best of all, you can
just step on it. Shoes or without shoes. It doesn’t matter how big or small you
are because opposed to other popular devices, there is no harness involved.
Where other devices claim to be without loud noise, the ESCAPAD wins in
quietness due to the fact the board hardly touches the floor when walking.





Less fatigue
We know you have
watched the other devices and wondered how long it would take for you to get
tired on those. The ESCAPAD does not require you to walk in a manner that
creates friction. It is simply the wobble you naturally make when walking, and
the natural placing of your foot that creates the movement that translates into
the virtual environment.  
We want you to have
this. Imagine just using a smartphone inserted into a google cardboard for
example and playing a game that connects to the ESCAPAD by Bluetooth!
What's in it/how does
it work?
(Without going into
the patent pending mechanics:)As with most VR Treadmills, this is not
motorized. Your feet move the plateaus, the optical/motion sensors in the
plateaus make sure the motion detection is direct and reliable. The position of
the board determines which way the movement is directed to, also by use of
optical/motion sensors. Vibration units in the board will complete the
experience. We are working with software developers to make sure the movement
of each step is translated into the gaming experience. The reactions on
the prototype so far have been enthusiastic.  
This device is super
portable and can be placed anywhere without taking up a lot of space. 
Environmental
If we expect our product to be a success, we must also take into account the environmental impact of
manufacturing the Escapad. From the start we have and will explore the friendliest
options. Keep an open mind and have quality and Safety aligned to be able to guarantee durability. Furthermore,
the Escapad will require the same connectivity and energy supplies as your game
controller.
Unpacking
We want you to have
this. Experience the unpacking. Become one of the founders of a future we have
all been longing for. Amaze your friends and let them join in the experience.
Soon you will all have your device with you in the same place, or online.
Playing the latest FPS, walking, running or crouching, wow!








Risks &
Challenges
In order to uphold
the reputation of crowdfunding we see it as our duty to keep you informed about
the progress and give as much disclosure as the business allows. Fully aware
that not all campaigns succeed even with the best intentions, we believe that
good management involves security, responsibility and clear dialogue. 
Our business plan is
taking into account various scenarios. As soon as we have a marketable product we will return to indiegogo in order to make sure our first round backers will receive their discount, as well as the promise of an early shipping!
 Depending on what percentage of our goal
we reach, we have mapped out the best way to make sure you will get the Escapad within the projected timeframe.
Our journey will be
logged for future projects along the same path. As part of the 'future making
industry' we believe in the Escapad as being the most logical and convenient
solution to walk in VR. 

Please feel free to contact us with any inquiries about the Escapad. And you can already help a lot by sharing this via social media!

story:
The Bulgarian National Ladies Rafting team is young, dynamic and ambitious. Since the very start in 2007 we have participated in numerous competitions in the Balkans and in Western and won twice the Ladies' Eurocup in 2011, 2012, 2013 and 2015.

OUR FIRST WOLRD CUP

This year we have the outstanding opportunity to participate in the World Championship for Rafting in Indonesia (29 Nov – 8 Dec 2015) . To be able to take part, we are searching for sponsorship for our plain tickets. Currently, the Rafting federation in Bulgaria doesn't have financial possibilities to sponsor those. 

OUR GOAL:

Hence, the funding of our plain tickets to Jakarta, Indonesia would provide us the unique chance to compete on an international level for the first time in our lives. We will be able to face the best national teams in the world such as Brazilian, British, Czech and others.

These are the teams we have to compete against:
21 teams for Open Men and 16 teams for Open Women.
International Rafting Federation IRF World Rafting Championships IRF Euro Rafting ChampionshipsFederazione Italiana Rafting Team YAK Rafting Australia Sesia Rafting team & Italian Rafting teamRaft Team Denmark Ladies GBR Mens Whitewater Rafting Team GB Womens Raft Team GBR 2 & Masters Raft Teams US Whitewater Raft TeamClubRaft Femenino Costa Rica 2013 IRF White Water Rafting World Championships, New ZealandCangrejos del Atuel Rafting Team Brazil/Youth -Alaya Competition Bozo D' Água Brasil Rafting TeamUSA Women's Rafting

YOUR CONTRIBUTION:

We will highly appreciate your financial help and support! 

Help us bring this Trophey to Europe!

Let's make it happen !

story:
Security Council is a board game! It has rave reviews from people who have actually played it!  Own a war game that makes people laugh, conspire, shout, shake hands, and even flip a table or two!  The purpose of our campaign is to get games in your hands for less.  (NOTE: our teaser video is for an old Kickstarter campaign, but we're not doing that now.)

Security Council began as an idea where a colleague simply wanted a board game where we could 'nuke' each other. It was sort of a running gag. From the start, I knew I didn't want a game glorifiying nuclear. The way Security Council plays makes nuking your friends seem utterly devastating as far as a means to progress through the game. Players incorporate a lot of thought into their diplomatic actions around the table and I believe it gives appropriate weight to the issue of nuclear war.  

That being said, this is not an educational game, per say. Any thoughts formed about nuclear war is all a by product and up to each individual. It is filled with memories of players trying to be friends but enemies too. Many deals are struck and then rescinded when game conditions change. The act of playing with your friends is very fun and after each game new players are always eager to play again.

I began with an existing board from another game.  At the time, I envisioned the game would have it's own unique board.  After some play testing, we saw that a board would create two problems.  First, it would be difficult to balance.  Second, it might limit novelty.

And so, Security Council became a table-top tile-based game. You and your friends are the Security Council. 

Build your world with game tiles and then begin to stake your claim. How will it end? Trench-like warfare? Mutual nuclear destruction? An alliance of the ages? There are many ways to play and win!  

As an overview, begin by vying for territory with traditional troop warfare. To some, troop warfare is reminiscent of RISK by Hasbro but is resolved in a different way. Build up your nuke arsenal or nuclear deterrent! Next, fire your nukes or evacuate from your friends nukes! Can you strategically escape the end of days?

 Finally, take what is yours in the aftermath of humanity! All that remains are a resemblance of what your armies once were. Will you finally overwhelm your friends? Or will you miscalculate and end on the wrong side of history?  

 To summarize basic strategy, before nuclear war your focus is to produce traditional Troops. Secure special resource tiles, build Factories and stockpile a nuclear deterrent. Box other players in to create pressure and force concessions. Forge cautious alliances to keep you safe and keep others from growing too strong. Embargo others to keep any one player from monopolizing any Resource. 

 After Defcon 1, launch Nukes back and forth for a few turns. A good counter to a Nuke is a coordinated nuclear response from you and your allies. Strategically plan your evacuations to save the most Troops for your counterattack.

Finally, after all the initial Nukes have fallen, spread quickly. Ultimately, capture enough territories to win or strategically move to block other players and force surrenders.

1) To just put this game in peoples hands.

2) To lower the price slightly buy buying in bulk

I work full time at a wonderful job and still found time to create this game. Fame and fortune could be in my future, but that is not my goal.  I am a creator.  I will bring a project from conception to fruition time and time again. This is my first foray into the professional game board world and I couldn't be prouder of this entry. I know once you play Security Council, you and your friends and family will experience real feelings just like the classics we grew up with. There is something magical about Security Council and I believe it lies in the intersection between the game mechanics of cooperation and competition.  See for yourself.

story:
The Demo:

Before anything else please know you can download a FREE demo of the game, featuring the first two levels here: 

https://cancer-cinema.itch.io/bad-taste

As a thank you to those that choose to back the project, they will be given access to an exclusive build of the game that features three additional levels shortly after the end of the campaign (plus a few bonus items). Additionally they get a steam key (once bad taste is released to steam), and an itch.io key to play the newest builds and follow the games progress!

Controls:
WASD = Player movement
Left Click = Firearm weapon attack
Right Click = Melee weapon attack
Hold Shift+WASD = Run
R = Reload
Q = Use support item
Esc = Menu Options


Story:
Bad Taste is a loving send up, and homage of trash cinema, and exploitation films. The story revolves around a jaded police officer "Chet" (Spencer Rice), as he tries to escape the city of Victoria BC before it's nuked to eradicate a mutant zombie epidemic caused by genetically modified fast food. The game obviously taking it's title and some inspiration from the Peter Jackson film of the same name. 

Game Features: 
- 20 levels of insane zombie action. (17 at launch, 3 as free DLC)
- Levels with secrets, and multiple paths. 
- 5 different intense bosses to fight against. 
- 40+ monsters to battle. (Unique monsters, not color swaps)
- Several different weapons, and items to unlock. 
- Fully animated cinematics. 
- Beautifully grotesque 2D backgrounds, inspired by real locations in Victoria BC. 
- Voice acting by Spenny, Kenny, and additional special guest Lloyd Kaufman. 
- Soundtrack by the Finnish Band "Lodger"! 
Gameplay:
Gameplay is centered around "restricted combat", as each level will only allow the player to select 1 firearm, 1 melee, and 1 item to assist them through the stage from the pool of weapons/items the player has already unlocked. Certain firearms make noise, and will attract more zombies if shot, and some items are better suited to fighting some enemies than others, so the player will need to decide how to approach each level to maximize their score. 

*In the future, the game will be expanded to include additional character campaigns, as well as random enemy encounters, more weapons, and surviors to rescue, plus Co-op. 



What We Need:
Bad taste is a game that has been in production for over 2 years, the game was financed thus far entirely from my own private funds, and much progress has been made. 

The engine has been built, the voice acting is completed, 80% of the art is finished, and the game is already past the steam greenlight process.

During this time the project has grown in size and scope, it's a more ambitious project than what we originally had intended, more enemies were added, all the cinematics are now fully animated, and more secret area's were designed.

The main issue now is turning all this additional art into spritesheets, and programming the new enemy behaviours, this is a time consuming process, and we need at least $20000.00 in additional funding to pay the artist and programmer so they can work full time on this to have it ready by the years end. 

This is my first fundraising campaign, and I ask for this money to keep the game raw and raunchy, and to provide a product that isn't compromised in order to make a quick dollar.

Perks:
There are several perks available, the base perk is you can pre-order the game for $9.99 that's discounted from the $14.99 retail price the game will be sold at, plus you can play an early build (the first 5 levels), at the end of the campaign.

We also have posters, and a couple of opportunities to include you in the game as a zombie/mutant enemy, so you can get killed (or kill) Spenny. 


Spencer Rice (Dialogue Actor, & Co-Star of Bad Taste)
Spencer Rice is the co-star of the mega hit gemini nominated T.V. show Kenny Vs Spenny, as well as the director and star of Confessions of a Porn Addict, and X-Rayted.

Spenny lends his comedic talent, voice and likeness to Bad Taste, as the playable Character "Chet".

Personal website: http://www.spenny.tv

Kenny Hotz (Dialogue Actor, & Co-Star of Bad Taste)
Kenny Hotz is the co-star of the mega hit gemini nominated T.V. show Kenny Vs Spenny, and has written for South Park, he also created and starred in the T.V. show Triumph of the Will.

Additional credits include, a role in Kevin Smith's "Zack and Miri Make a Porno", as well as a recent role in the horror comedy "The Chickening".

Personal website: http://www.kennyhotz.com

Lloyd Kaufman (Dialogue Actor, supporting role in Bad Taste)

Considered by many to be the king of Trash Cinema, Lloyd Kaufman has supported several independent filmmakers through Troma, the film studio he founded. He has hundreds of supporting, and cameo roles in several films, including Slither, and Guardians of the Galaxy.


Lloyd also directed the cult classics The Toxic Avenger, and Poultrygiest, and is responsible for the invaluable indie filmmaker bible Make Your Own Damn Movie.

Personal website: http://www.troma.com

Lodger (Music, and soundtrack)

The Finnish band lodger has created several viral music video's including I Love Death, their music has been featured on MTV, as well as the Califonication soundtrack.

The band released their newest album Low Blue Flame for free as a digital download on their website.

Personal Website: http://www.lodger.fi


Celx Requin (Producer, creator, lead game designer, & scriptwriter)

Celx Requin has over 5 years in flash development, with many of his personal digital comic projects released for free on newgrounds (http://www.celx-requin.newgrounds.com).

Celx's work has been featured in Rue Morgue Magazine, and Scream Horror Mag, as well he has received commendations from newgrounds.com for his digital comic projects including the Newgrounds "critics pick" for his 2010 project Cooljaw.

Celx also founded Cancer Cinema, with the intention of creating, and supporting edgy independent media. http://www.cancer-cinema.com 

Jeremy Zaczek A.K.A. Sherbalex (Artist/Animator) 

Jeremy Zaczek has over a decade of experience using flash to animate. As a self taught artist Jeremy has created several dark short animated films, including the pug fuglies music video "The  Worst" that was nominated for the Newgrounds Tank Award, and has received several other daily awards.

His work can be found here: http://www.sherbalex.newgrounds.com


Alex Taylor (Programmer)

A self taught programmer Alex has years of experience experimenting in C++, and has taken over the duties of our prior programmer Mike Heavenor, who helped design the engine for the game.


Why our project matters:

Bad Taste is a return to form for 2D gaming, it's not meant to reinvent the wheel, but it is meant to be among the best of it's kind in the genre, that will hopefully reinvigorate not only classic 2D animation, but also the trash cinema we all love. 

Bad Taste preserves and captures the raw politically incorrect spirit of exploitation films, the game has been influenced by everything from The Toxic Avenger, to more modern cult classics like Slither.  

It's also unique in that the game is very Canadian focused, it stars two Canadian comedy legends (Kenny and Spenny), it takes place in Victoria, and surrounding parts of Vancouver island, and the majority of the staff is Canadian.


Scream Magazine (Online Edition)| 
http://www.screamhorrormag.com/fast-food-turns-you-into-a-zombie-in-the-trailer-for-bad-taste/

Rue Morgue| 
September 2015, Issue #159. 
Available at fine bookstores, and through digital download here: 
http://www.rue-morgue.com

Rely on Horror| 
http://www.relyonhorror.com/latest-news/bad-taste-brings-kenny-hotz-and-lloyd-kaufman-on-board-releases-new-trailer/

Indie Game Magazine| 
http://indiegamemag.com/screenshot-weekly-gravity-has-a-bad-taste-in-space/

Peninsula News Review| 
http://www.peninsulanewsreview.com/entertainment/291409171.html

Niche Gamer| 
http://nichegamer.com/2014/05/fight-mutant-fast-food-in-bad-taste-the-scathing-and-bloody-version-of-the-food-industry/

Risks & Challenges

Game development is something that is very time consuming, every new idea or challenge can potentially add a significant amount to the production.

However the game is now grounded in terms of it's vision, and what needs to be completed, we simply need the resources to get this done, the more we get the more time each staff member can spend on their respective tasks, and the sooner this project will be released.

Everyone involved in the game is 10 fingers and ten toes involved, if we fail to meet our goal, it would set us back, but we would find some way to eventually complete the project. 

We want to obtain funding so we don't need to remove any of the content, and keep this game independent and adult oriented. 

Additionally failure to complete funding would hurt the chances of a future DLC starring Kenny Hotz as a playable character.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this with your pals, follow the project on steam, and twitter, if you can't contribute right now that's fine we just like hearing from you guys.

Twitter: www.twitter.com/cancercinema

Steam: www.cancer-cinema.com/badtaste

Website: www.cancer-cinema.com

Bad Taste is a return to form for 2D gaming, it's not meant to reinvent the wheel, but it is meant to be among the best of it's kind in the genre, that will hopefully reinvigorate not only classic 2D animation, but also the trash cinema we all love. 
Bad Taste preserves and captures the raw politically incorrect spirit of exploitation films, the game has been influenced by everything from The Toxic Avenger, to more modern cult classics like Slither.  
It's also unique in that the game is very Canadian focused, it stars two Canadian comedy legends (Kenny and Spenny), it takes place in Victoria, and surrounding parts of Vancouver island, and the majority of the staff is Canadian.




Scream Magazine (Online Edition)| http://www.screamhorrormag.com/fast-food-turns-you-into-a-zombie-in-the-trailer-for-bad-taste/Rue Morgue| September 2015, Issue #159. Available at fine bookstores, and through digital download here: http://www.rue-morgue.comRely on Horror| http://www.relyonhorror.com/latest-news/bad-taste-brings-kenny-hotz-and-lloyd-kaufman-on-board-releases-new-trailer/Indie Game Magazine| http://indiegamemag.com/screenshot-weekly-gravity-has-a-bad-taste-in-space/Peninsula News Review| http://www.peninsulanewsreview.com/entertainment/291409171.htmlNiche Gamer| http://nichegamer.com/2014/05/fight-mutant-fast-food-in-bad-taste-the-scathing-and-bloody-version-of-the-food-industry/



Risks & Challenges Game development is something that is very time consuming, every new idea or challenge can potentially add a significant amount to the production.
However the game is now grounded in terms of it's vision, and what needs to be completed, we simply need the resources to get this done, the more we get the more time each staff member can spend on their respective tasks, and the sooner this project will be released.
Everyone involved in the game is 10 fingers and ten toes involved, if we fail to meet our goal, it would set us back, but we would find some way to eventually complete the project. 
We want to obtain funding so we don't need to remove any of the content, and keep this game independent and adult oriented. 
Additionally failure to complete funding would hurt the chances of a future DLC starring Kenny Hotz as a playable character.
    Other Ways You Can Help Share this with your pals, follow the project on steam, and twitter, if you can't contribute right now that's fine we just like hearing from you guys.
Twitter: www.twitter.com/cancercinema
Steam: www.cancer-cinema.com/badtaste
Website: www.cancer-cinema.com

story:
What is it?

The Gaming Place Manchester is the idea of one man. The aim to create a venue in the heart of Manchester (UK)'s City Centre, where people can come and play some awesome games; Everything from the latest blockbusters, to modern classics. We are planning on getting retro games from the likes of SNES, MegaDrive and even old school Atari, and arcade machines.

There will even be a lounge area for you to bring your handheld consoles so you can compete, help and share ideas with fellow gamers.

We will hold tournaments, competions and will host special events too.


You can help!

Every donation will help us to become a reality. All the funds we raise will go towards the equipment we need; from the consoles, games and TVs, to IT systems and security devices.

Check out the perks for some exclusive deals with regards to memberships, should we reach our goal. You can save upto 50% off the planned membership prices.

Membership details are still being fully finalised, but these perks will be honoured should we reach our goal.


What challenges will you face?

We know this is going to be a challenge, but with the help of the community (along with other funding) we can make this become a reality.

Security is going to be one of the biggest things to tackle. Not only to protect all of the expensive equipment at all times, but also for visitors. We will constantly be working to help protect everyone, not just those on site, but anyone who visits. CCTV will be in operation within the venue for your safety, and all your personal data will also be covered under the Data Protection Act.


How else can I help?

If you can't donate, then don't worry. Come and show your support by liking us on Facebook and following us on Twitter. You can also take a quick survey which will help shape the way we operate. This is completely anonymous unless you choose to request us to contact you.

If you wish to contact us, you can send an email to: funding@thegamingplacemanchester.co.uk


What happens if you don't meet your funding target?

Of course we would love to reach our goal, but we fully understand that we may not. We are still looking at alternative means of funding such as loans and grants to help out.

"So why are you asking for donations?" I hear you ask, well this is simple. It is so that we can get going as quickly as possible. It also means that we have less ongoing expenses, meaning more money to invest in the latest gaming goodness, and lower membership fees for visitors.

In the extreme case that we are not successful in securing enough funding and unable to launch, all donations raised (after IndieGoGo and PayPal fees) will be donated to a gaming charity, which will be decided at that time. Anyone who chooses the donation wall perk or higher will be featured on our Facebook page in a tribute post, along with a personal apology email.

But with your help, this will not happen!

Thank you for supporting The Gaming Place Manchester

story:
Google Play Game Services AIR Native Extension

Our principal motivation for creating this native extension is to exploit the great possibility to create multiplayer sessions which offers the Google Play Game Services, as this allows users to create game matches between Android and iOS devices in the same session, this coupled with the Adobe AIR platform that allows compile a project for iOS and Android, open a world of possibilities for apps developed in the Flash Platform.


What is an AIR native extension?

"Native Extensions for Adobe AIR are code libraries that contain native code wrapped with an ActionScript API. Native extensions provide easy access to device-specific libraries and features that are not available in the built-in ActionScript classes. Examples of native extensions include making a mobile device vibrate, integrating ad-networks and in-app purchasing systems into your games, and using the iOS Game Center in your iOS games."

You can find more information from Adobe Developer Connection.


Google Play Game Services

"Make your games social with Google Play game services. Add achievements, leaderboards, real-time multiplayer, and other popular features using the Google Play game services SDK. Let players sign in using their Google+ identities and share their gaming experience with friends".

You can find more information from Google Play Game Services.


After the campaign is over, we will not sell the ANE, then brings to the campaign now to get the ANE.

Scope

  • User sign in / out.
  • Save games.
  • Achievements.
  • Leaderboards.
  • Quests & Events
  • Finding people to initiate multiplayer games.
  • Game match through bluetooth  for Android.
  • Real-time multiplayer games for Android and iOS.
  • Turn-based multiplayer games for Android and iOS.


Progress*

*Progress Updated 01/15/2015.


Certainly is not possible play over Bluetooth on iOS using Google Play Game Services, but is a feature we are interested have therefore once completed development, we plan to include features of Game Center for iOS (this includes connection via Bluetooth between iOS devices) would share this update.

The Impact

Only one source code to get Real-Time Multiplayer with users on Android and iOS devices, all this powered by Adobe AIR and Google Play Game Services.


Risks & Challenges

Today, we have completed the code to create Real-Time Multiplayer sessions for Android devices (see video) and we have already begun with the part to add iOS devices to Multiplayer sessions with very good results.

In our view the Real-Time Multiplayer is the most complicated and we are sure that once this part is completed, the others will be much easier.

Why not to sell the ANE after the campaign will be over?

This component will be built to use ourselves in our developments, but to absorb the costs, we decided to launch this campaign in indiegogo. Sell this component involves having a virtual store and maintain it, that is something that we are not interested at this time. Then brings to the campaign now to get the ANE.


Documentation

When development is completed, we will have the full documentation.

To tests the ANE, we developed a small game that uses all functions, this game will be distributed with the ANE, as an example of implementation.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute with money, share this campaign, if we reach the goal and you helped this, we share a license with  you.

story:
AS SEEN ON CNBC, YAHOO and BIZ JOURNAL


***FACEBOOK CONTEST*** 

 Enter to win one Drank Tank. The more you share, the more chances you have to win your own http://www.thedranktank.com/contest/

We would like to introduce, The Drank Tank. It provides a revolutionary way of consuming non-alcoholic* drinks. The Drank Tank has been designed from the ground up for having a good time. The advantages of the Drank Tank is the ability to consume non-alcoholic* drinks without the calories, allows for a faster buzz, no hangovers, enhanced flavors (connoisseur’s be warned) and the effects of consuming non-alcoholic* liquids are felt immediately. We know you will enjoy it.

Because of the revolutionary nature of the Drank Tank’s approach to the consumption of non-alcoholic* drinks, it can be intimidating. However, it is simple, natural and enjoyable.

Liquid vaporizers are tools that allow you to consume non-alcoholic* drinks without drinking it - it is inhaled. They produce a vapor so that it can enter the blood stream easily through the lungs. As opposed to traditional means that take longer and place more stress on your body.

Liquid vaporizers are made with the view of enabling individuals to immediately take pleasure in the effects brought by combining non-alcoholic* drinks with oxygen. The non-alcoholic* vapor is subsequently carried to the user's mouth through a tube/straw. 

As with all inhaled products, it would be wise to consult your doctor. If you have any breathing issues this product might not be right for you. Our studies found no serious immediate health effects.

How does it work?

About 5 minutes after the vessel containing the non-alcoholic* liquid is placed on the base, it is ready to consume. The recommended amount of non-alcoholic* liquid is 1 ounce. One inhales through the straw and holds it in for a moment and then exhales. That’s it. The effects are felt immediately because the non-alcoholic* liquid is going directly through the bloodstream. Most people experience a relaxed and mellow feeling. Depending on how aggressively you consume the vapors in the Drank Tank, that one ounce of non-alcoholic* liquid, will be still active for 10-15 minutes. There will be liquid left in the vessel after the Drank Tank is exhausted, but that is merely the water and additives in the liquid.The effects don’t last as long as traditional consumption, but that can certainly be a positive aspect.

 ***FACEBOOK CONTEST*** 

 Enter to win one Drank Tank. The more you share, the more chances you have to win your own http://www.thedranktank.com/contest/

Testimonials

These testimonials are from REAL products testers that helped us out testing our working prototypes. Without their help, this product would not have existed. A big thanks goes out to them. Thanks again everyone.

"I was skeptical at first. After trying it out I ordered 5, these will be the star of my next party!"

Party Man 5000

"5 drank tanks out of 5"

Mike C.

"WOW, I WANT ONE NOW!!!"

George.

Traditional Drinking vs the Drank Tank


A traditional drink, it takes about 20 minutes before nearly all the booze reaches your small intestines, the liver and followed by the pancreas. In this period, it’s possible the ultimate impacts of the drink won't have shown yet, getting the person to believe he or she may continue to consume more booze. Often times many people will have multiple drinks throughout the night (stacking drinks), meaning shot after shot or drink after drink. At this time, they will have over consumed and will not understand the absolute effects until it is too late. The worse part of all this, is it will take hours for the liquor to break down, allowing you to feel normal and sober again.

When consumed as vapor, non-alcoholic* drinks bypass the body’s digestive system and is absorbed directly into the bloodstream, passing through the lungs briefly before moving quickly onto the brain. Because it circulates freely and is not subject to dilution, inhaled non-alcoholic* liquid fumes are able to deliver their mind-altering kick immediately, leaving the user feeling instantly intoxicated for 30 to 40 minutes. There is no hangover once the initial buzz wears off.

Why we created the Drank Tank

We have complied a list of reasons and benefits on why we created the Drank Tank. As you will see below, it only made sense for us to create this new product since the history of drinking has stayed the same since the beginning of time; we wanted to change that. After MANY prototypes, we would like to introduce you the revolutionary way for consuming non-alcoholic* liquids; The Drank Tank. We know you will enjoy it.

WITHOUT THE CALORIES

Since you are not consuming non-alcoholic* liquids in the traditional sense, you are only getting a fraction of the calories

ENHANCED FLAVOR

 Smell is the main determining factor of an item’s taste and since the non-alcoholic* liquid vapor is airborne, you get a much richer taste sensation. This allows connoisseur’s to enjoy their non-alcoholic* drink on another level, one that has not been experienced before

FASTER BUZZ

The feeling of being buzzed happens much faster and the non-alcoholic* drink hits your blood stream without having to get processed by the other organs

NO HANGOVERS

 In our “testing” all the participants that normally would have hangovers the following day, felt much better and in most cases had felt none of the symptoms

DETOX QUICKER

 The feeling of being buzzed happens much faster and the non-alcoholic* liquid hits your blood stream without having to be processed by the other organs

CHEAP BUZZ

Due to the by-passing the organs that normal drinking would have to go through, a lot less non-alcoholic* liquid is needed to have a good time

DON’T LOSE YOUR LUNCH

 Soon as your body recognizes that it has had too much, it wants to purge. Since there is no liquor, additives and sugars in your stomach, the urge to puke is minimal


TimeLine


End of January 2015 – Funding process

February – Have molds created/tested and order the remaining parts

March through May – Production starts

June through July – The first batch of the Drank Tanks are shipped out

August – Everyone will have received their Drank Tank’s by this time

*I’d like start off by saying this is an very educated timeline, unforeseen issues may push the dead line back but please note this is the plan. The Drank Tank Team has put their heart and soul into this product. We will do everything in our power to get the product on time, if not before schedule.

Why Indiegogo

We would like to manufacture a complete line of these devices as well as devices that are built to customer specifications.

Risks and challenges

Our biggest financial hurdle is the creation of the molds, each one will set us back a few thousand dollars. Every other part is sourced from various suppliers from around the globe. During our research we found that many overseas companies have a tendency of making products that are lacking in quality. To prevent that, all the units will be assembled in Canada in our facility. Our goal is to keep our budget as lean as possible and to scale the business onwards.

All projects have their fare share of risks. That being said we have taken every precaution to minimize them. First the product will be assembled locally so that we have full control over quality control. Second we used parts that were designed to be as simple as possible, but having safety as our number one priority. Third we have sourced all of the necessary parts and equipment that will be needed to complete the project.

We have already met and signed all the necessary agreements with all of our suppliers and manufacturers.

story:
Across the world, the average person has few (if any) opportunities to experience a Filipino's life through gaming. Help us fund and build The Girl Who Sees to increase the positive representation of Filipinos and the Philippines in media and pop culture. This video game is great to play solo or with friends and family. Explore Filipino mythology and battle some monsters now by checking out our free demo! Pre-order a copy of the full game today!

Let's bring Filipino voices and experiences into the spotlight, so that the rest of the world can appreciate Philippine culture and its awesome people. 
 

As Filipinos continue to migrate to other parts of the world, we must be more vocal about representing ourselves and sharing our culture and identities with those around us. However, the historical weight of colonial mentality has encouraged the idea that Filipino culture is somehow less interesting or less impressive than Western cultures. 

Let's break that cycle. Let's remind Filipinos that Philippine culture is rich and deserving of the spotlight. Let's show Filipinos that we can share our culture in creative, significant ways that can transcend these cultural barriers. 

We're promoting this video game the way that other indie game studios would because we recognize that The Girl Who Sees will appeal to non-gamers and gamers alike. We're certainly committed to making a quality, compelling video game, but our greatest goal is to introduce gaming as a vehicle for showcasing culture and identity. We want lolos and lolas (grandparents) to play this game with their apos (grandchildren). We want yayas (nannies) to share more about their homeland with the young ones around them. 

Whether you are Filipino or not, we hope you agree that it is important to learn about other cultures. Why not have some fun while doing so? Fund this game because you recognize that learning about other people and other places creates a more peaceful and understanding world. 

Watch our first official trailer: 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We will use any and all funds raised to build, market, and promote this video game to the globe. All of the funds raised through this campaign will be used towards improving the quality of our game and increasing its visibility. 

We the creators are committed to putting this game out within a year or less of our campaign’s end date. But, maybe with support, we can even reach to even greater heights than we could ever have hoped for. How much content we get to build and to what level of professional quality will be entirely up to all of you.

Funding Level 1 - $30,000

Our base milestone of $30,000 indicates the minimum amount of money that we need to be able to develop, promote, and publish this game in one year to the minimum quality and standards that we are willing to give you with our current team and a minimal amount of contract work. This amount provides us enough to build the full envisioned four chapters of the game at a level of quality typical of some indie games. It might not feel as polished, but you’ll definitely be able to learn and enjoy Quina's full story. 

Planned game features for Funding Level 1:

  • Translate the mysterious ancient scroll with Quina - learn some Tagalog!
  • Fight a range of creatures from mythical lore - level up on stats and attacks
  • Complete quests for Manong Kapre
    • Interact with Japanese soldiers and hidden guerrilla fighters
    • Talk with a diverse village of Christian and tribal Muslim residents
    • Assist friendly magical creatures in the forest
    • Re-teach itik itik birds their favorite dance
    • Settle a dispute between two rowdy bungisngis giants
    • and much more!


Bungisngis image by isaiahpaul via DeviantArt

​Funding Level 2 - $36,000

Our next milestone of $36,000 is the amount of money we need to raise to build this game in one year with our current team and some guest experienced game designers. This version of the game would look like a standard indie point-and-click PC adventure, like OxenFree or Broken Age. This version would also include more robust battle gameplay and side plot quests.

Planned game features for Funding Level 2:

  • Mini-game: train in Filipino martial arts
  • Mini-game: help cook a Filipino feast
  • More monsters and special attacks in battle
  • Side quests for more mature audiences inspired by historical events of WWII

​Funding Level 3 - $41,000

The final milestone of $41,000 is our big dream goal. This is how much we would need to build the game in one year at a robust level of quality with a fair amount of work from guest experienced game designers. The volume and depth of gameplay would be much more significant, and it would play as a standard 20+ hour game.

Planned game features for Funding Level 3:

  • Mini-game: match tribal patterns and wear for a fashionista monster
  • Mini-game: help the albularyo collect herbal remedies
  • Release the tormented soul of a kaperosa
  • 2 game endings

We realize that these values might seem high for those less familiar with video game development. To give you some perspective, Angry Birds cost $140,000 to make. Nintendo's new Zelda: Breath of the Wild cost $100 million. We're asking for a very small fraction of that cost.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't still help:

Tell everyone you know about The Girl Who Sees. Who do you know that is interested in Filipino culture? Spread the word about the game and what we're aspiring to do with it.

Share this campaign and help us reach our top funding level!

The core team of InterIntellectus Studios are Pattie, Nathan, Jerald, and Cherisse. They are committed to seeing this game through to its release. While we are deeply committed to making The Girl Who Sees a reality, we are developing this game during off-hours of full-time jobs. Your funding will give us the boost we need to add talent to our team, produce and distribute the game, and advertise the game at relevant venues.
story_txt:
Across the world, the average person has few (if any) opportunities to experience a Filipino's life through gaming. Help us fund and build The Girl Who Sees to increase the positive representation of Filipinos and the Philippines in media and pop culture. This video game is great to play solo or with friends and family. Explore Filipino mythology and battle some monsters now by checking out our free demo! Pre-order a copy of the full game today!Let's bring Filipino voices and experiences into the spotlight, so that the rest of the world can appreciate Philippine culture and its awesome people.  As Filipinos continue to migrate to other parts of the world, we must be more vocal about representing ourselves and sharing our culture and identities with those around us. However, the historical weight of colonial mentality has encouraged the idea that Filipino culture is somehow less interesting or less impressive than Western cultures. Let's break that cycle. Let's remind Filipinos that Philippine culture is rich and deserving of the spotlight. Let's show Filipinos that we can share our culture in creative, significant ways that can transcend these cultural barriers. We're promoting this video game the way that other indie game studios would because we recognize that The Girl Who Sees will appeal to non-gamers and gamers alike. We're certainly committed to making a quality, compelling video game, but our greatest goal is to introduce gaming as a vehicle for showcasing culture and identity. We want lolos and lolas (grandparents) to play this game with their apos (grandchildren). We want yayas (nannies) to share more about their homeland with the young ones around them. Whether you are Filipino or not, we hope you agree that it is important to learn about other cultures. Why not have some fun while doing so? Fund this game because you recognize that learning about other people and other places creates a more peaceful and understanding world. Watch our first official trailer:  What We Need & What You GetWe will use any and all funds raised to build, market, and promote this video game to the globe. All of the funds raised through this campaign will be used towards improving the quality of our game and increasing its visibility. We the creators are committed to putting this game out within a year or less of our campaign’s end date. But, maybe with support, we can even reach to even greater heights than we could ever have hoped for. How much content we get to build and to what level of professional quality will be entirely up to all of you.Funding Level 1 - $30,000Our base milestone of $30,000 indicates the minimum amount of money that we need to be able to develop, promote, and publish this game in one year to the minimum quality and standards that we are willing to give you with our current team and a minimal amount of contract work. This amount provides us enough to build the full envisioned four chapters of the game at a level of quality typical of some indie games. It might not feel as polished, but you’ll definitely be able to learn and enjoy Quina's full story. Planned game features for Funding Level 1:
Translate the mysterious ancient scroll with Quina - learn some Tagalog!
Fight a range of creatures from mythical lore - level up on stats and attacks
Complete quests for Manong Kapre
Interact with Japanese soldiers and hidden guerrilla fighters
Talk with a diverse village of Christian and tribal Muslim residents
Assist friendly magical creatures in the forest
Re-teach itik itik birds their favorite dance
Settle a dispute between two rowdy bungisngis giants
and much more!


Bungisngis image by isaiahpaul via DeviantArt​Funding Level 2 - $36,000Our next milestone of $36,000 is the amount of money we need to raise to build this game in one year with our current team and some guest experienced game designers. This version of the game would look like a standard indie point-and-click PC adventure, like OxenFree or Broken Age. This version would also include more robust battle gameplay and side plot quests.Planned game features for Funding Level 2:
Mini-game: train in Filipino martial arts
Mini-game: help cook a Filipino feast
More monsters and special attacks in battle
Side quests for more mature audiences inspired by historical events of WWII
​Funding Level 3 - $41,000The final milestone of $41,000 is our big dream goal. This is how much we would need to build the game in one year at a robust level of quality with a fair amount of work from guest experienced game designers. The volume and depth of gameplay would be much more significant, and it would play as a standard 20+ hour game.Planned game features for Funding Level 3:

Mini-game: help the albularyo collect herbal remedies
Release the tormented soul of a kaperosa
2 game endings
We realize that these values might seem high for those less familiar with video game development. To give you some perspective, Angry Birds cost $140,000 to make. Nintendo's new Zelda: Breath of the Wild cost $100 million. We're asking for a very small fraction of that cost. Other Ways You Can HelpEven if you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't still help:Tell everyone you know about The Girl Who Sees. story:
Game for real Vikings is coming

 

Bonus table for backers supported us on early stages

 

 

VALHALL — a multiplayer Viking first & third person Hack and Slash game with a skill-based free-flowing combat system.

 

 

Real-time collision

 

 

Play as from the first person view as well 3rd

 

is just the first game mode

 

We have bigger plans on this game

See some of them on our Community board

 

  • Bronze Chest (1 pair of Boots and 1 pair of Gauntlets)
  • Beta Test Access (1 Steam Key)
  • Name in credits
  • FULL Game & Early Access

 

  • Weapons Chest (1 Weapon)
  • Silver Chest (1 Armor and 1 Helmet)
  • Bronze Chest (1 pair of Boots and 1 pair of Gauntlets)
  • Beta Test Access (1 Steam Key)
  • Name in credits
  • FULL Game & Early Access

Example of quality

 
  • Exclusive Odin’s Helmet
  • Runes Chest (1 Rune)
  • 3X Weapons Chests (3X Weapons)
  • 2X Golden Chests
  • 2X Silver Chests
  • 2X Bronze Chests
  • Beta Test Access
  • Name in credits
  • FULL Game & Early Access

 

Runes add the visual effects to your weapon

 

You will get 2 items from 1 chest!

VALHALL is not a pay to win game. The items from the chests are cosmetic and allow you to look unique - you will feel like a boss on the map.

Furthermore, you will never receive the same items which you already have from a chest.

 With great pleasure we present to you our way of interaction with the community

  This allows us to communicate with you in more detail and most importantly, to jointly determine the direction in which VALHALL will develop.

https://realtimeboard.com/app/board/o9J_kyAnuMk=/

  Why is this board interactive? - Your opinion will be taken into account and the board will be modified according to your suggestions.

  It's not a space for empty words and unanswered pleas. This space will have a meaningful and significant effect on the development of the game. Board is dynamic and will be updating, give it some time, and we hope to see it flourish with your input.

  We hope this space not only provides us all with a lot of fun as a place to foster new relationships, but also allows us to shape the future of the VALHALL franchise effectively together.

  The second part of the interaction tool, which incorporates the ability to vote for the features which you would like to see developed with the single press of a button. Through this process, we hope to offer our shared vision of certain ideas and see your reactions to it.

  At this stage our new official Discord server will play a key role in this process.

https://discord.gg/z5pwABS

  Our team of moderators and community manager have put together a well polished and engaging space for our continued interaction.

We sincerely hope that you like it!

  In the process of evaluating new features, interacting with the development process and presenting your ideas, we have established a channel where your feedback and input will directly affect the interactive board discussions.

  It should be noted that at the moment, due to the fact that all our resources are directed to the development of the game, we are forced to use third-party software to implement an interactive whiteboard. We don't see this as an issue for the time being, however, we hope to develop our own tool for this process on our website later.

  With regards to the Discord server, verification of this server as official by the administration of Discord (which gives official servers the little tick in their name) will be carried out immediately after the start of Beta testing - this is due to Discord's rules, as the game needs to have been released before the server can be verified. We're just as eager as you are.

  On the new official server you will find both moderators, who many of you are already familiar with, as well as some members of the development team.

  We ask you to keep in mind that we try to answer all the questions we receive on various social networking platforms as soon as possible, but at the same time each and every member of our team has a certain set of duties, the fulfillment of which affects both the quality and development time.

  Therefore, we ask you to understand that there will be cases where one of our developers is online in the Discord, but does not have the opportunity to give an answer to a question immediately or to take part in conversation. Please be respectful of this, we work long hours to develop the game which you are patiently awaiting. If you need anything please contact one of our moderators.

 All of this will help us to develop a game which is truly a work of art.

 

Help to bring VALHALL to life!

Invite your friends and get your squad assembled! There is much more fun to be accompanied than on your own. Having assembled your troop, you can easily do the famous Shield wall and stop push of your enemy.

You can spread a word about VALHALL

 

 

We're a fully independent international team at the beginning of its journey. 

  What is more, we're gamers. We've been playing such great games as Skyrim, Chivalry, Mount & Blade and a lot of others for long time. That experience leads to the deep understanding how to implement important aspects of the game the best way.

  Also, our independence allows us to listen to the suggestions of our community and make the improvements the payers want.

That experience leads to the deep understanding how to implement important aspects of the game the best way.  Also, our independence allows us to listen to the suggestions of our community and make the improvements the payers want.

story:
The Premise:

Last year, over 25,000 unaccompanied children arrived in Europe looking for a new home, along with hundreds of thousands more adults and children fleeing war and persecution.

Many of these people have found themselves trapped in camps across Europe, with no wish to go back and no hope of going forward.

In many of these camps food is short, medication is lacking, and gangs prey on the weak. It is nothing short of an atrocity.

‘Seeking Asylum’ offers us a chance to step into this tragedy through a true RPG. Take the role of Sami who has fled to Europe with his daughter Amira, escaping the horrors of war-torn Syria.

Believing a better life is waiting in Britain, he has made it as far as the notorious ‘Jungle Camp’ in Calais but can go no further.

Can you keep both yourself and Amira fed and healthy when food and medicine is scarce? Can you keep Amira safe amidst the gangs and violence? Can you find a safe way into Britain for both of you?

 

Why do this?

I am a white, British, male living in the UK, one of the most prosperous countries in the world. I know how privileged I am. A few months ago, while working out how much I could afford to send to refugee aid charities, I realised that whatever I sent would not be enough. It was then I came up with the idea of creating a game, not only to showcase the horrors and atrocities of living in a refugee camp, but to use as a way of getting more money to the camps, both through making people aware of the situation and through a fifty percent cut of the game’s profits.

I began by watching all the footage I could find, then by speaking to as many asylum seekers and refugees as I could find. With a small team I have begun placing their stories into a narrative that will be playable by everyone, and that will, hopefully, create a larger awareness of the horrible situation through which so many people are living.

  

About The Game:

'Seeking Asylum' could perhaps be called a survival sim. To keep you and your daughter safe you'll need to queue for food, avoid the bad guys, and find ways of acquiring medicine for your daughter's medical conditions. Though it is possible to die by upsetting the wrong gang or falling under the wheels of a truck as you try to leap aboard, you are more likely to get weaker, more hopeless, and more in debt until you are left with only terrible options.

As in real life, it is possible to win the game. You can, if clever and lucky, make it into Britain illegally to a life of hiding from authorities and facing the rise of right wing parties - but hey, you've won, right?

This game contains adult themes and would definitely not be suitable for children under 16. Please don't get this for your kids!

 

The Money:

The game is currently around one third complete. We have most of the graphics, scripts, and systems: what we are lacking is truth. With the money raised in this campaign, our team plans on visiting the refugee camps first-hand to collect stories from the refugees to place in the game and to view the conditions for ourselves. Needless to say, we will be doing all we can to help during our time out there.

With the remaining funds we plan on hiring composers to create a unique and compelling musical score, to hire voice actors for the main characters, and for translators to put the script into more languages.

 

Awareness:

It took a lot of consideration, discusion, and cups of tea, before we decided to go ahead with this project. The last thing we'd ever want to do is make light of the terrible situation happening across Europe. We promise to handle everything we do with the utmost care and in collaboration with refugees past and present, faith groups, and our backers. 

Once we release the game we plan to distribute a minimum of 50% of all profits to refugee charities across Europe. We also hope to raise awareness, and shame our governments (especially the UK government) into allowing more refugees into the country!

story:
Short Summary

About us & our goal

  • We are a group of university students from Guatemala  studying Entrepreneurship at UFM.
  • This is a project that we want to bring to life so we can give young people, in Guatemala and around the world, a traditional concept with a twist so that the original game of Kings is more fun.
  • With your support you can help us make this game a reality, granting us the capacity to finish the designs and production, eventually allowing us to distribute and share with you King of Kings.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Product:

  • Box with logo and instructions.

  • 9 personalized cups, including the King´s Cup.

  • Full set of cards

 

What we need:

  • Raw materials for production - $1200
  • Design - $400
  • Shipping - $500
  • Advertising - $400

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, it doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Spread the word, share and like our Facebook page.

With your support you can help us make this game a reality, granting us the capacity to finish the designs and production, eventually allowing us to distribute and share with you King of Kings.

Spread the word, share and like our Facebook page.

story:
#1 Charity Platform For Games

Empowering REAL donations through FREE games

 

"Games have a major impact on all aspects of life and that's how the idea for this project was born" - Artur Grigorjan, Co-founder at Cooltivate

 

 

To use games as a foundation for building an ecosystem, where people can help the planet while enjoying a game sounded like a great idea. With this campaign my team and I are aiming to achieve what others have never thought of before - to use games in a value exchange model that will help clear the world of pollution. 

How does that work? You play a game and collect points, each of them will convert to real money that you will be able to send to environmental protection organisations of your choice.

 

 

It's a shame to see how irresponsible some people may be in the real world, when they litter, over-consume and simply neglect the environment in which they live. This has to change!

Our Planet is in danger! We overproduce mass goods. Surely that improved the quality of our lives, but there is a price to pay. Handling waste irresponsibly lead to environmental crisis across the globe and we need to act quick! 

Marine debris injures and kills marine life, interferes with navigation safety, and poses a threat to human health.

Pollution can affect the food we eat. Heavy metals and other contaminants can accumulate in seafood and make it harmful to eat. More than one-third of the shellfish-growing waters of the United States are adversely affected by coastal pollution.

Hundreds of thousands of sea turtles, whales, and other marine mammals, and more than 1 million seabirds die each year from ocean pollution and ingestion or entanglement in marine debris.

 

The games will feature all known topics, which require attention and help. Ranging from fighting ocean pollution up till protecting animals and preventing deforestation. All of this aspect are embedded into fun and challenging game mechanics to engage people while playing and give them tools to help, while they enjoy a great gaming experience.

Cooltivate platform works with reliable charities only. Companies that are making a change. This will include the following:

 

 

Try the game here if you haven't already!

 

 

By creating this charity platform for games we invest your time (which becomes real money) into supporting NGOs that are trying to save the Planet and protect our unified home against pollution. Separately we won't make much of a difference, but together, if we unite, we are able to make a change! And what better way to do it, if you have some fun along the way, when you play great games.

 

 

We can STOP this once and for all, if we act now! We need your help to support our project and enable the use of our platform to raise awareness and support charities with fighting these problems in real life.

FUNDING:

We are raising money to fund two aspects of this project:

  • Development and testing - Building Games and the Charity platform ($80k)
  • Marketing and PR - Spreading the word and investing into paid advertising ($120k)

We have already published our first game Ocean Care on Google Play! 

 

Download for your android device!

 

Every person that contributes at least $5 will become legacy and end up in the Hall of Fame section on our Official Website. The world will know it's heroes once this project gets some traction and we will make it a great success together with your help!

More perks than ever before! Show more love for this project and show off in front of friends and family, that you have what it takes to rescue our planet from this horrible tragedy, that it is facing.

Show people that  you care by supporting our project with the Admirer Pack, that includes a branded T-shirt. Choose a color that best represents you:

If we don't reach the funding goal, then we will NOT stop, as this project will be fulfilled regardless of anything. We are already building the games and the platform and need your support to finish it quicker and start making an impact on the world!

If we overreach the funding goal, then we will invest the extra amount into building more great games powered by the charity platform. 

 

If you cannot or do not wish to support this project financially, then spread the news about it on Social Media. Invite your loved ones to participate and let them know about our cause! Our goal is to reach the stars and we can only do that with your help!


NB! Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools to help and guide people to this page!

 

 

Let's save the world by playing games together!

 

-------- follow us on social media --------

    

 - or get in touch -

 Visit Our Website              Send Us An Email
story_txt:
#1 Charity Platform For Games
Empowering REAL donations through FREE games
 
"Games have a major impact on all aspects of life and that's how the idea for this project was born" - Artur Grigorjan, Co-founder at Cooltivate

 

 
To use games as a foundation for building an ecosystem, where people can help the planet while enjoying a game sounded like a great idea. With this campaign my team and I are aiming to achieve what others have never thought of before - to use games in a value exchange model that will help clear the world of pollution. 
How does that work? You play a game and collect points, each of them will convert to real money that you will be able to send to environmental protection organisations of your choice.

 

 
It's a shame to see how irresponsible some people may be in the real world, when they litter, over-consume and simply neglect the environment in which they live. This has to change!
Our Planet is in danger! We overproduce mass goods. Surely that improved the quality of our lives, but there is a price to pay. Handling waste irresponsibly lead to environmental crisis across the globe and we need to act quick! 

Marine debris injures and kills marine life, interferes with navigation safety, and poses a threat to human health.

Pollution can affect the food we eat. Heavy metals and other contaminants can accumulate in seafood and make it harmful to eat. More than one-third of the shellfish-growing waters of the United States are adversely affected by coastal pollution.

Hundreds of thousands of sea turtles, whales, and other marine mammals, and more than 1 million seabirds die each year from ocean pollution and ingestion or entanglement in marine debris.

 

The games will feature all known topics, which require attention and help. Ranging from fighting ocean pollution up till protecting animals and preventing deforestation. All of this aspect are embedded into fun and challenging game mechanics to engage people while playing and give them tools to help, while they enjoy a great gaming experience.

Cooltivate platform works with reliable charities only. Companies that are making a change. This will include the following:

 
















 
Try the game here if you haven't already!

 

 

By creating this charity platform for games we invest your time (which becomes real money) into supporting NGOs that are trying to save the Planet and protect our unified home against pollution. Separately we won't make much of a difference, but together, if we unite, we are able to make a change! And what better way to do it, if you have some fun along the way, when you play great games.


 

 
We can STOP this once and for all, if we act now! We need your help to support our project and enable the use of our platform to raise awareness and support charities with fighting these problems in real life.
FUNDING:
We are raising money to fund two aspects of this project:

Development and testing - Building Games and the Charity platform ($80k)
Marketing and PR - Spreading the word and investing into paid advertising ($120k)

We have already published our first game Ocean Care on Google Play! 
 
Download for your android device!

 


Every person that contributes at least $5 will become legacy and end up in the Hall of Fame section on our Official Website. The world will know it's heroes once this project gets some traction and we will make it a great success together with your help!

More perks than ever before! Show more love for this project and show off in front of friends and family, that you have what it takes to rescue our planet from this horrible tragedy, that it is facing.
Show people that  you care by supporting our project with the Admirer Pack, that includes a branded T-shirt. Choose a color that best represents you:


If we don't reach the funding goal, then we will NOT stop, as this project will be fulfilled regardless of anything. We are already building the games and the platform and need your support to finish it quicker and start making an impact on the world!
If we overreach the funding goal, then we will invest the extra amount into building more great games powered by the charity platform. 
 




If you cannot or do not wish to support this project financially, then spread the news about it on Social Media. Invite your loved ones to participate and let them know about our cause! Our goal is to reach the stars and we can only do that with your help!

NB! Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools to help and guide people to this page!
 

 
Let's save the world by playing games together!
 
-------- follow us on social media --------

    
 - or get in touch -
 Visit Our Website              Send Us An Email

story:
Play233 is a startup game development company based in Ghana. Gaming is a platform we use to highlight and celebrate local cultures and important issues impacting the society. We created Door of Return to highlight the problematic modern slavery which has not been getting enough attention despite the continuous global outcry.

The Door of Return Adventure

Door of Return will take you on a quest to freedom against all odds. The story line is loosely themed around the Trans-Atlantic slave trade in the Castles and Fortresses which affected Ghana and the whole of West Africa, dating as far back to the 14th century. 

 

As a player you will take on the role of Zuka, an escapee slave whose parents sacrifice their lives to help him run away from the dungeons. Grief of losing them awakens a new force within him which changes his life forever.

                                          

As Zuka, you will become the one to help other captives regain freedom battling enemies and empowering yourself and your brothers and sisters in the process.

Your spiritual powers grow as you explore dungeons and defeat enemies. The powers can be used to overcome all of your foes, and you can also customize them to suit your playing style.

Game flow

In the course of the game you will fight your way through a number of dungeons each of which will bring a new challenge. In every location you will combat castle guards to rescue captives, gain new abilities and services to support you in your quest.

                                

Features

  • Action Adventure Dungeon crawling with RPG-ish aspects.
  • Engaging story loosely based on true events.
  • Customize your powers.

The reality is, slavery never ended. In fact, its present forms such as Human Trafficking and Mental Slavery are even more damaging. For over 10 million children kidnapped across the world, slavery could not be more real. The modern-day slaves are trafficked within and across the borders of their countries and sold for cheap labor from a very tender age. If not saved, once they fall into the arms of their masters, they spend the rest of their lives toiling in deplorable inhumane conditions.

Where Do You Come In? 

To make this fantastic game a reality and be part of the war against slavery, we need your support. With your kind donations, we will be able to hire the best programmers and animators to ensure the Door Of Return gaming app is exceptional. Every donation counts.

Also, please don't forget to spread the word by sharing this campaign on social media - use the Indiegogo share tool! 

Join Play 233 and together, let us put an end to slavery permanently.
