story:
It's been a long road, getting from there to here, hasn't it?

Thanks for checking out our long-awaited third crowdsourcing campaign for our game Divergence: Online!

Divergence: Online is the MMORPG that began as the spiritual successor to Pre-CU Star Wars Galaxies but has since grown into its own living, breathing universe.

Divergence brings back the golden years of MMORPGs and pushes the envelope even further than before to new extents.

UPDATE: Divergence Reaches #1 In All Steam Greenlight Games!

Special thanks to everyone who voted for us on Steam Greenlight, but we aren't out of the woods yet - If you have friends or family who use Steam, please hassle them to take a few moments and checkout our project!

Checkout Divergence: Online on Steam Greenlight!


ANNOUNCED: PVP-Optional Server To Be Included!

We've had so many articles come out wherein hundreds, if not thousands, of people make mention in some form that they "would contribute if it weren't for the open-pvp", that we've completely re-evaluated the situation and decided to include a second "consentual-pvp" server based on "TEF" regardless of the game's funding status, and not as a stretch goal :)

 Players on the new server can either spend their days harvesting, crafting, dancing, playing as non-combatants, or flag themselves for PVP with a "TEF" and engage in an afternoon of RvR fun.

What's a TEF?

A "TEF" or "Temporary Enemy Flag" occurs either intentionally, by flagging yourself via chat command, or by performing certain actions. A few of those are:

  • Healing or buffing factionally-combative players in a state of PVP.
  • Killing or harming faction NPCs, such as town guards of an opposing faction.
  • Being forcefully ejected from a player city or establishment where you are unwelcome.

Essentially, if you're playing just to craft, harvest, dance, or even if you're healing or aiding other players (so long as they are not recently engaged in PVP), you can no longer be harmed, debuffed, or otherwise negatively affected by other players.

Won't this require your current game code to be changed, and how soon would this be available?

Running a secondary "PVP-Optional" server will not require significant changes to combat, since that's already the focus of our IndieGoGo, there is none! It will simply require more resources to be directed at developing the aforementioned "TEF" system. This is something we're more than prepared to do for the players, so long as we don't have to detract money from the overall development of the game to do it. Therefore, what we decided to do was add a brand new stretch goal to invite the players to make it possible for us to develop this "optional PVP".

What we hope this'll do, is give all those people who write us and say "I'd contribute but... Open PVP" a way of putting their money where their mouth is. while simultaneously funding both the game itself, and the style of gameplay they prefer. We could bring it online even before our Steam release for testing.

Will there be any other differences between the Primary server and the secondary "PVP-Optional" server?

There will be a few minor differences between the two geared mainly to gently nudge people towards our primary server, such as story events, and GMs playing notable NPCs and faction leaders on the primary server, but as far as game mechanics and features are concerned, they both get the same content. Additionally, we're experimenting with the idea of allowing characters to transfer between servers if they meet certain stipulations and even keep their character names, so long as it can be done in a manner that neither rewards nor penalizes the practice.

What if people contribute specifically to make the PVP-Optional server happen, but then it doesn't meet that stretch goal?

In that case, depending on how close it comes to the goal, we'll either elect to do the PVP-Optional server regardless of that fact, or we'll offer refunds to those people. Basically in either scenario, you can't lose :)

Thanks again for all your support guys, and let’s make this damn game happen!

-------------------------------------------------------------


The Setting:

It's the year 2330, Earth Standard Date.

If you're a Terran Human, Synthetic, Veli Vindicator, or Lokri, you're a momentary survivor of a massive crash-landing event wherein your capitalship was inexplicably  and violently ripped from its orbit down to the surface of this alien moon.

You don't know why. Nobody knows why at this moment, but you suspect your enemies, one of the other factions your ship was locked in a Mexican standoff with only hours before, had something to do with it.

Somehow, you were pulled down to this alien, yet familiar planetoid, orbiting a super-earth.

Chaos. Bodies burning. Conduits belching violent current into twisted forms of broken super-structure, as your fellow shipmates desperately labor under yawning bulkheads to free trapped humans, aliens, and machines.

And all the while, the endless chattering in the dark just beyond the threshold of your perception.

Eyes, watching you. Two. Ten. A hundred. A thousand. My God, my science, they're everywhere! It's an attack!!!

The native creatures. Other survivors from the other ships. They're all equally dangerous; Your only hope being the frantic and desperate repair and re-establishment of make-shift cloning facilities at your base-camp immediately adjacent the smoldering ruin of your once pristine starship; Now buried face-first in a landscape hideously scarred by your arrival.

You Must Survive

Find your friends. Know where your enemies are. Venture out to establish outposts of your own but not too far, lest you be fell upon by the world's native inhabitants, agents of enemy factions, mercenaries, assassins, bandits, or even the conditions of the environment itself.

Superior Resource Surveying and Harvesting

Resource locations, concentrations, and individuals stats appear and disappear as they're used up all over the world's surface. Some will last mere hours, some, potentially months, so use your surveying tools to find the best resource locations and stake your claim before other players do!


Once you've found those high-quality resources, construct automated harvesting rigs to target and extract those materials from the world in realtime whether you're online or offline.


Superior Crafting :// Become An Industry Master

Every item from your pants to your nightlight relies on stats directly determined by the stats of the raw materials and components you fed into it during crafting.


Increase the strength of walls by using specialized low-grade ore with a high "unit toughness" rating, or increase the speed and energy-efficiency of your resource harvesters by creating their circuitry using rare high "conductivity" copper. Or perhaps decrease the weight while increasing heat dissipation of your firearms  by crafting the barrels out of  alloys, then use a personal factory to mass-produce and sell them on the open market!

Combative and Non-Combative Progression

Through careful choosing of your professions, players in Divergence can change careers as often as they like, or stick with the same profession for years on end.

Choose from any combination of combat-derived professions, such as Bounty-Hunting, Teras Kasi, or Rifleman, or totally non-combative professions such as Dancing, Engineering, Narcotics, Tailoring, or many, many more.


True Exploration :// True Discovery

There is (without cartography) no minimap, nor world map in Divergence. You arrive on one huge 262sqkm central continent which is also surrounded on all sides by numerous additional islands and continents ranging in size from 1sqkm to over 300sqkm, many of which containing just under their surface vast quantities of undiscovered resources and wealth, just awaiting the first player explorers to discover them.

Divergence IS SWG v2.0

  • Complete recreation of SWGs Pre-CU professions system, including both the original 40+ SWG Professions and brand new professions such as Psychic, Hacker, and Operator.
  • Complete recreation of SWGs original and legendary crafting system, modernized and streamlined for maximum creativity without over-complication.
  • Tons of your favorite houses, structures, components and items completely recreated with up with a 1,000% increase in texture detail, with hundreds of additional items planned for recreation as well!
  • Complete overhaul and vast improvement to SWGs famed player housing and player cities features! Don't just drop a house, but truly manage it and your city's electrical power systems all from the comfort of your mayor's office!
  • Vast character customizability faithful yet vastly superior to SWGs original systems.
  • Total upgrade to SWGs original surveying and harvesting systems!
  • Massive upgrade from using only pre-made houses to now design your entire home(s) from scratch!


And So Much More...

  1. One single contiguous server. Everyone on Earth who plays Divergence shares the same world and is apart of the same community.
  2. A huge 250km2 game world, streamed to you in real-time, eliminating zones.
  3. Up to 6km view range on max graphical settings.
  4. Several biomes, including but not limited to temperate forest, arid desert, high desert, rain forest, barren steppes, open meadows, polar tundra, and alien environments as well.
  5. Up to eight playable species (13 if you count the 5 breeds of humans) many with vastly different playstyles and capabilities.
  6. Open PVP everywhere, no exceptions.
  7. Limited perma-death depending on location and species.
  8. Over forty career paths able to be mixed and matched into thousands of possible combinations.
  9. High-resolution (4x higher resolution than Minecraft) building-blocks system for sculpting homes, structures, and facilities.

To Be Civilized, Or To Be Civilized Not

It's up to the players to determine whether they will share resources willingly, or brutalize one another to further their own goals.
Perhaps your faction, or your group within that faction, will establish a safe-haven of trade between factions governed by civic law and order. Or, perhaps you and your friends are assholes and will scour the wastelands, deserts, jungles, and forests accosting merchant caravans to liberate them of their own supplies and liqueur.


You don't need to trust us... Play the fucker right now!

Leery of cash-grab crowdsourced vaporware bullshit? We don't blame you one bit... The internets are inundated with them nowadays, aren't they.

That's why, instead of asking anyone to take our word for anything, you, the potential contributor can download the freaking thing right now and see that it isn't a bunch of crap.  It's actually less than 30% crap as a matter of fact*! Why not right now? Think (for instance) our crafting system is a bunch of Photoshop malarkey? Download the damn thing and see for yourself this minute, sucker, at:

www.Divergence-Online.com/download


Why would I give you squat if I can download it right now, smart guy?

Because you can't mess up paying contributors stuff in the game world unless you become one of those paying contributors. In fact, as a free player, you are their plaything, created solely for their pleasure and amusement. Do we love them more than we love you? Yes. But you can buy into that same love for the one-time cost of $100! If you don't think that's a good deal, clearly you don't know jack about relationships.

Additionally, you need a ferrocrete tool to build with ferrocrete (blocks) in our game, and right now, the only way to get one is by buying-in at the $100 level.

Wait... You're running an IndieGoGo to fund development of a game... But the game already exists? What's up with that?

What's up with it is very simple;

Yes, the game does exist, and it is live, but it's missing crucial features required for us to consider this a "real game" worthy of an actual release on Steam; such as combat.

Right now, you can create things to an amazing extent and begin to build an awesome life for yourself on Rook. However, that guy next door who decided to build a house with "This guy sucks" written on it and an arrow pointing to your property... The guy who needs to get face-fisted... Well, you can't feed him his (or her) own teeth right now because there is no combat.

So you can clearly see that without the threat of violence to keep ones neighbors in check, society cannot exist. Without the ability to die at the hands of a dozen blood-thirsty spear-wielding lizards, life has no meaning. In essense, this game is not meant to be known merely as "crafting simulator 2015". In order for it to grow, we have to take it to the next level and that means a shitload of bug fixes and an even greater shitload of bullets flying.

Oh, and how about this reason; We're two damn people. Two. Two people did this, but it's going to take more than two to make this game all that it could be.

And thus, we aim to bring pain and suffering to the masses.

Help us to continue to develop the online gaming world that the world of today desperately needs; nay, deserves!

What can you do with total freedom?

  1. Craft completely unique items of higher or lower quality than every single other item in the world.
  2. Have other players beg you to sell them your wares because they're a lot better than everyone elses.
  3. Collaborate with your friends and fellow factionmates to Create a homestead/community/town/city/metropolis/Davidian compound to call your own and design it completely as you wish.
  4. Defend your home against the guv'ment, come to take away your guns and freedoms.
  5. Enslave the native inhabitants of the world, imprison them in cages and harvest their secretions to create insanely good narcotics that you can get totally fucked-up on, or sell to customers.
  6. Assault scumbags who enslave the native inhabitants of the world for their sick bile-farming business and wipe their taint from the surface of the world.
  7. Create a utopian NATO-style round-table of the major factions in the game, preventing war and maximizing quality of life for all Rook's inhabitants.
  8. Wipe all other factions from the game world and oppress any dissent.
  9. Bring law and order to the wilderness, prohibiting deforestation and imposing social justice.
  10. Obliterate hippie-scum and strip-mine every square foot of rain-forest for your own benefit.
  11. Beat the shit out of scrubs who need it.


Q: What happens if you guys don't make enough money to keep going?

Then the empire has already won. You were our last hope.

What you're talking about is a very niche market. You'd make a lot more revenue if you used "The WoW Format.

Divergence is meant to provide an A-grade experience for a few thousand players, not a C+ experience for a million mouth-breathers.


Civic Boosters

Get a head start founding your player city with your choice of either a massive city-hall, or cantina in the generic (neutral) style. Both buildings are pre-equipped with all prerequisite hardware including modules and lighting and have integrated hoppers, allowing for decorations, supplies, and virtually all other possessions to be saved both within, and on their property.

Additionally, both structures are created using near-perfect resources and components, resulting in the highest possible obtainable ratings for all relevant stats, such as energy-efficiency, storage, and structural integrity.

Because of their very-high efficiency ratings, these structures consume a lot less electrical power, and require a lot less in maintenance costs (credits per hour) to operate.


Pre-Order Eyewear Choices


Limited-Quantity Upgrade


Your choice of a Vindicator or Verrator playable character gives you a one-time opportunity to be the baddest sumbitch' in the valley. The 7-foot tall alien cyborg ninjas have a strength and agility that no other humanoid can withstand. A single blow from their Theta/Metal Blades can rend a typical player in half, then disappear in the blind of an eye, "teleporting" to another location. With proper effort they can even swat ballistic rounds out of the air. The tradeoff? These two opposed breeds of the same species are nearly extinct and once they're gone they're gone. Seeing one of these on the battlefield is the closest thing to divine intervention any player of Divergence will ever witness.

Thank you!

Again, thanks so much for checking up on Divergence and if you have any inquiries or maybe would even like to step-up and see if you have the skills necessary to join the team, please dont hesitate to send an email straight to me at: ethan@divergence-online.com

*By matter of fact, we mean "Matter of opinion. Our opinion."

What's a TEF?
A "TEF" or "Temporary Enemy Flag" occurs either intentionally, by flagging 
yourself via chat command, or by performing certain actions. A few of those 
are:

Healing or buffing factionally-combative players in a state of PVP.
Killing or harming faction NPCs, such as town guards of an opposing 
faction.
Being forcefully ejected from a player city or establishment where you are 
unwelcome.

Essentially, if you're playing just to craft, harvest, dance, or even if 
you're healing or aiding other players (so long as they are not recently engaged 
in PVP), you can no longer be harmed, debuffed, or otherwise negatively affected 
by other players.
Won't this require your current game code to be 
changed, and how soon would this be available?
Running a secondary "PVP-Optional" server will not require significant 
changes to combat, since that's already the focus of our IndieGoGo, there is 
none! It will simply require more resources to be directed at developing the 
aforementioned "TEF" system. This is something we're more than prepared to do 
for the players, so long as we don't have to detract money from the overall 
development of the game to do it. Therefore, what we decided to do was add a 
brand new stretch goal to invite the players to make it possible for us to 
develop this "optional PVP".
What we hope this'll do, is give all those people who write us and say "I'd 
contribute but... Open PVP" a way of putting their money where their mouth is. 
while simultaneously funding both the game itself, and the style of gameplay 
they prefer. We could bring it online even before our Steam release for 
testing.
Will there be any 
other differences between the Primary server and the secondary "PVP-Optional" 
server?
There will be a few minor differences between the two geared mainly to 
gently nudge people towards our primary server, such as story events, and GMs 
playing notable NPCs and faction leaders on the primary server, but as far as 
game mechanics and features are concerned, they both get the same content. 
Additionally, we're experimenting with the idea of allowing characters to 
transfer between servers if they meet certain stipulations and even keep their 
character names, so long as it can be done in a manner that neither rewards nor 
penalizes the practice.
What if people contribute specifically to make the 
PVP-Optional server happen, but then it doesn't meet that stretch 
goal?
In that case, depending on how close it comes to the goal, we'll either 
elect to do the PVP-Optional server regardless of that fact, or we'll offer 
refunds to those people. Basically in either scenario, you can't lose :)
Thanks again for all your support guys, and let’s make this damn game 
happen!
-------------------------------------------------------------

The Setting:

It's the year 2330, Earth Standard Date.
If you're a Terran Human, Synthetic, Veli Vindicator, or Lokri, you're a momentary survivor of a massive crash-landing event wherein your capitalship was inexplicably  and violently ripped from its orbit down to the surface of this alien moon.
You don't know why. Nobody knows why at this moment, but you suspect your enemies, one of the other factions your ship was locked in a Mexican standoff with only hours before, had something to do with it.
Somehow, you were pulled down to this alien, yet familiar planetoid, orbiting a super-earth.
Chaos. Bodies burning. Conduits belching violent current into twisted forms of broken super-structure, as your fellow shipmates desperately labor under yawning bulkheads to free trapped humans, aliens, and machines.
And all the while, the endless chattering in the dark just beyond the threshold of your perception.
Eyes, watching you. Two. Ten. A hundred. A thousand. My God, my science, they're everywhere! It's an attack!!!
The native creatures. Other survivors from the other ships. They're all equally dangerous; Your only hope being the frantic and desperate repair and re-establishment of make-shift cloning facilities at your base-camp immediately adjacent the smoldering ruin of your once pristine starship; Now buried face-first in a landscape hideously scarred by your arrival.
You Must Survive
Find your friends. Know where your enemies are. Venture out to establish outposts of your own but not too far, lest you be fell upon by the world's native inhabitants, agents of enemy factions, mercenaries, assassins, bandits, or even the conditions of the environment itself.

Superior Resource Surveying and HarvestingResource locations, concentrations, and individuals stats appear and disappear as they're used up all over the world's surface. Some will last mere hours, some, potentially months, so use your surveying tools to find the best resource locations and stake your claim before other players do!


Once you've found those high-quality resources, construct automated harvesting rigs to target and extract those materials from the world in realtime whether you're online or offline.
Superior Crafting :// Become An Industry Master
Every item from your pants to your nightlight relies on stats directly determined by the stats of the raw materials and components you fed into it during crafting.



Increase the strength of walls by using specialized low-grade ore with a high "unit toughness" rating, or increase the speed and energy-efficiency of your resource harvesters by creating their circuitry using rare high "conductivity" copper. Or perhaps decrease the weight while increasing heat dissipation of your firearms  by crafting the barrels out of  alloys, then use a personal factory to mass-produce and sell them on the open market!

Combative and Non-Combative Progression
Through careful choosing of your professions, players in Divergence can change careers as often as they like, or stick with the same profession for years on end.
Choose from any combination of combat-derived professions, such as Bounty-Hunting, Teras Kasi, or Rifleman, or totally non-combative professions such as Dancing, Engineering, Narcotics, Tailoring, or many, many more.




True Exploration :// True Discovery
There is (without cartography) no minimap, nor world map in Divergence. You arrive on one huge 262sqkm central continent which is also surrounded on all sides by numerous additional islands and continents ranging in size from 1sqkm to over 300sqkm, many of which containing just under their surface vast quantities of undiscovered resources and wealth, just awaiting the first player explorers to discover them.


Divergence IS SWG v2.0


Complete recreation of SWGs Pre-CU professions system, including both the original 40+ SWG Professions and brand new professions such as Psychic, Hacker, and Operator.

Complete recreation of SWGs original and legendary crafting system, modernized and streamlined for maximum creativity without over-complication.

Tons of your favorite houses, structures, components and items completely recreated with up with a 1,000% increase in texture detail, with hundreds of additional items planned for recreation as well!

Complete overhaul and vast improvement to SWGs famed player housing and player cities features! Don't just drop a house, but truly manage it and your city's electrical power systems all from the comfort of your mayor's office!

Vast character customizability faithful yet vastly superior to SWGs original systems.
Total upgrade to SWGs original surveying and harvesting systems!

Massive upgrade from using only pre-made houses to now design your entire home(s) from scratch!







And So Much More...


One single contiguous server. Everyone on Earth who plays Divergence shares the same world and is apart of the same community.
A huge 250km2 game world, streamed to you in real-time, eliminating zones.
Up to 6km view range on max graphical settings.
Several biomes, including but not limited to temperate forest, arid desert, high desert, rain forest, barren steppes, open meadows, polar tundra, and alien environments as well.
Up to eight playable species (13 if you count the 5 breeds of humans) many with vastly different playstyles and capabilities.
Open PVP everywhere, no exceptions.
Limited perma-death depending on location and species.
Over forty career paths able to be mixed and matched into thousands of possible combinations.
High-resolution (4x higher resolution than Minecraft) building-blocks system for sculpting homes, structures, and facilities.


To Be Civilized, Or To Be Civilized NotIt's up to the players to determine whether they will share resources willingly, or brutalize one another to further their own goals.Perhaps your faction, or your group within that faction, will establish a safe-haven of trade between factions governed by civic law and order. Or, perhaps you and your friends are assholes and will scour the wastelands, deserts, jungles, and forests accosting merchant caravans to liberate them of their own supplies and liqueur.




You don't need to trust us... Play the fucker right now!
Leery of cash-grab crowdsourced vaporware bullshit? We don't blame you one bit... The internets are inundated with them nowadays, aren't they.
That's why, instead of asking anyone to take our word for anything, you, the potential contributor can download the freaking thing right now and see that it isn't a bunch of crap.  It's actually less than 30% crap as a matter of fact*! Why not right now? Think (for instance) our crafting system is a bunch of Photoshop malarkey? Download the damn thing and see for yourself this minute, sucker, at:
www.Divergence-Online.com/download

Why would I give you squat if I can download it right now, smart guy?
Because you can't mess up paying contributors stuff in the game world unless you become one of those paying contributors. In fact, as a free player, you are their plaything, created solely for their pleasure and amusement. Do we love them more than we love you? Yes. But you can buy into that same love for the one-time cost of $100! If you don't think that's a good deal, clearly you don't know jack about relationships.
Additionally, you need a ferrocrete tool to build with ferrocrete (blocks) in our game, and right now, the only way to get one is by buying-in at the $100 level.
Wait... You're running an IndieGoGo to fund development of a game... But the game already exists? What's up with that?
What's up with it is very simple;
Yes, the game does exist, and it is live, but it's missing crucial features required for us to consider this a "real game" worthy of an actual release on Steam; such as combat.
Right now, you can create things to an amazing extent and begin to build an awesome life for yourself on Rook. However, that guy next door who decided to build a house with "This guy sucks" written on it and an arrow pointing to your property... The guy who needs to get face-fisted... Well, you can't feed him his (or her) own teeth right now because there is no combat.
So you can clearly see that without the threat of violence to keep ones neighbors in check, society cannot exist. Without the ability to die at the hands of a dozen blood-thirsty spear-wielding lizards, life has no meaning. In essense, this game is not meant to be known merely as "crafting simulator 2015". In order for it to grow, we have to take it to the next level and that means a shitload of bug fixes and an even greater shitload of bullets flying.
Oh, and how about this reason; We're two damn people. Two. Two people did this, but it's going to take more than two to make this game all that it could be.
And thus, we aim to bring pain and suffering to the masses.
Help us to continue to develop the online gaming world that the world of today desperately needs; nay, deserves!
What can you do with total freedom?



Craft completely unique items of higher or lower quality than every single other item in the world.

Have other players beg you to sell them your wares because they're a lot better than everyone elses.

Collaborate with your friends and fellow factionmates to Create a homestead/community/town/city/metropolis/Davidian compound to call your own and design it completely as you wish.


Defend your home against the guv'ment, come to take away your guns and freedoms.


Enslave the native inhabitants of the world, imprison them in cages and harvest their secretions to create insanely good narcotics that you can get totally fucked-up on, or sell to customers.


Assault scumbags who enslave the native inhabitants of the world for their sick bile-farming business and wipe their taint from the surface of the world.

Create a utopian NATO-style round-table of the major factions in the game, preventing war and maximizing quality of life for all Rook's inhabitants.
Wipe all other factions from the game world and oppress any dissent.
Bring law and order to the wilderness, prohibiting deforestation and imposing social justice.
Obliterate hippie-scum and strip-mine every square foot of rain-forest for your own benefit.

Beat the shit out of scrubs who need it.






Q: What happens if you guys don't make enough money to keep going?
Then the empire has already won. You were our last hope.

What you're talking about is a very niche market. You'd make a lot more revenue if you used "The WoW Format.
Divergence is meant to provide an A-grade experience for a few thousand players, not a C+ experience for a million mouth-breathers.



Civic BoostersGet a head start founding your player city with your choice of either a massive city-hall, or cantina in the generic (neutral) style. Both buildings are pre-equipped with all prerequisite hardware including modules and lighting and have integrated hoppers, allowing for decorations, supplies, and virtually all other possessions to be saved both within, and on their property.Additionally, both structures are created using near-perfect resources and components, resulting in the highest possible obtainable ratings for all relevant stats, such as energy-efficiency, storage, and structural integrity.Because of their very-high efficiency ratings, these structures consume a lot less electrical power, and require a lot less in maintenance costs (credits per hour) to operate.
Pre-Order Eyewear Choices
Limited-Quantity UpgradeYour choice of a Vindicator or Verrator playable character gives you a one-time opportunity to be the baddest sumbitch' in the valley. The 7-foot tall alien cyborg ninjas have a strength and agility that no other humanoid can withstand. A single blow from their Theta/Metal Blades can rend a typical player in half, then disappear in the blind of an eye, "teleporting" to another location. With proper effort they can even swat ballistic rounds out of the air. The tradeoff? These two opposed breeds of the same species are nearly extinct and once they're gone they're gone. Seeing one of these on the battlefield is the closest thing to divine intervention any player of Divergence will ever witness.Thank you!Again, thanks so much for checking up on Divergence and if you have any inquiries or maybe would even like to step-up and see if you have the skills necessary to join the team, please dont hesitate to send an email straight to me at: ethan@divergence-online.com*By matter of fact, we mean "Matter of opinion. Our opinion."

story:
Short Summary

I'm an indie game developer working on this amazing new game for mobille!

I already have experience working on video games for mobile, i created not too long ago this game called Jumping Simulator, completely free and really addicting:

App Store: https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/jumping-simulator/id1163553061?mt=8

Google Play: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.jepr.JumpingSimulator2

 

The game will be a fresh new experience for sci-fi/psychological games, i want to combine beautiful environments with the thrill and fear of the unknown and unfathomable.

All the enemies will have a very bizarre look giving you a chilling and hopeless experience.

The environments will be gigantic and beautiful however, giving you some degree of freedom.

As soon as this campaign becomes successful, all the people who pledged will get the game for free! The first release might only have a few maps, one campaign level and 3 survival mode maps, but i'll add more content, more levels, maps, weapons, features, etc. All of that in updates for that very game you will have, so you won't miss a thing!

 

What We Need & What You Get

The amount i need is $500usd (same as $10,000mxn)...

With this money i'll be able to get what i really need the most, Adobe Creative Suite.Although GIMP is useful, it's not as good as Photoshop, with Photoshop i'll be able to make high quality textures for my 3D models, with Illustrator i'll be able to create HD UI elements, with After Effects and Premiere Pro i'll be able to create amazing videos teasers and since i'm also a web developer i want to use Dreamweaver to create my own website. Needless to say, Derelict won't be my last game, so future games will also use this software for the same reasons!

 

For the amazing potential backer

I know sometimes it's hard to make the decision of pledging, but trust me, it's gonna be worth it!

Not only will you get the game for pledging any amount, but you will also get credits in the game itself and videos, you can get honorable mentions with me advertising a link or two to social media of your choosing, you can have early access to multiplayer mode, months before the general audience, you can have input on the decisions i take for the game, new weapons, characters, items or even maps! You tell me your ideas, i make them reality, and you get credits for those ideas!

But i think the most special thing is what i'm willing to give away if enough is pledged... knowledge. That's right, i'm willing to give you a course through a private video streaming where i'm gonna teach you how to create a First Person Shooter Video Game from scratch using unity! I'm gonna teach you everything in the most simple way (including assets and code of course), from how to make level design, to how to create the 3D models, textures, sound files, interfaces, the player, enemies, weapons, power-ups, real time events, and a hell of a lot more!

By the end of the course that might take two days you will go from being a total beginner, to a person fully capable to create a cross-platform video game from scratch! Just ready for you to sell it! Trust me, that is a great investment if you actually want to become a game developer!

 

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Extra Funding

Although my goal is to get that software pack, i wish to get extra funding to also pay for other software that will be as helpful to improve gaming experience in all aspects:

  • 3ds Max: I want to get the license so i can use it, i had the education version of the game but it's license won't allow me to use it for this game. I'm very good with that software, the difference will be noticeable for you if i get to use 3ds Max for my game development. I'll be able to create astonishing environments with it.
  • Unity Pro: Although Unity Personal Edition has most of the necessary tools, there are certain tools and services i need from unity pro to make the game as good as possible and prevent errors or performance drops. To prevent this, Unity Pro offers a service that allows me to monitor in real time the performance on user's phones, that way i can spot bugs more easily, the other use will be adding extra features to the enemies, since i'll be able to add more behaviors that will make the enemies harder to deal with and i'll also be able to add something called asset bundle, which will allow me to update the game much faster, and also make the app smaller in size since most 3D elements and assets will be located in a server/database thanks to this, so i'll not only be able to update the game faster but also fix bugs faster!
  • Assets from Unity's Asset Store: I've been doing most of the work for the game in all aspects, from visual elements to programming, there are certain things that can only be added if i purchase certain assets, these assets will allow me to make the game more enjoyable and intuitive. Among the assets i want to add some are 3D models and textures, UI elements, special effects, game mechanics and extra services.
  • More time dedicated to the game and thus getting updates done at least 3x faster: It's difficult to work on a FPS game by yourself, especially if you just graduated. With this amount i'll manage to sustain myself at least for a couple months, that way i'll be able to work faster with the updates i'll be releasing after the first release on December.

Although my goal is only $500usd, my wished goal is $4,000usd... with this i'll be able to make this game even more awesome and more competent with the videogame market that exists today, i'll also be able to work faster and more efficiently...

 

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

My major challenge won't be being able to work on the game, but the speed i'll be doing it, once the game is uploaded, my goal is to update it at least once a week or every two weeks, but there might be times that it might take me a little longer... not that much but still longer, this challenge can be easier to overcome if my wished goal is reached however...

The major risk on the other side would be on the campaign mode of the game... so far i got no problems with what i've programmed, survival mode works like a charm and multiplayer won't be an issue. The problem is not about the code or ability... is about details on the ideas i have for the story/plot of the game, there might be delays from me regarding the campaign mode because i need to make extremely precise planning to be able to make the levels exactly as i want... so that's my biggest risk and fear but nothing i can't overcome

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't pledge that's ok! The best help you can always give me is spread the word! Tell your friends, share my content in my social media, spread the word! That's the best help i can get from all of those who wish to help in any way possible! :)

Here are the links to all my social media!

Faceook personal page: https://www.facebook.com/JEPRGameAppDev/

Game dedicated Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/Derelict-FPS-game-for-iOS-Android-By-JEPR-English-263748153965204/

Twitter: https://twitter.com/jepr_derelict

YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/user/ChBgt909

Unity WIP Thread: https://forum.unity3d.com/threads/wip-derelict-first-person-shooter-game-for-ios-android.401877/

 

Photo Gallery

Now, without further ado, here are some screenshots of the game taken from my phone:

Now, without further ado, here are some screenshots of the game taken from my phone:

story:
“To navigate you must be brave, and to be brave, you must remember” –Mau Piailug

 

 

What is ʻUkulele Meʻe?

ʻUkulele Meʻe is an educational exploration game set in a chain of mythical Hawaiian islands. It immerses the player into Kanaka Hawaiʻi culture by allowing the player to explore islands, interact with characters, and learn how to navigate between islands by using the stars.

In this game, the player takes on the role of an ʻulili bird however, the stars disappear from the sky, leaving the ʻulili and the people of the islands unable to navigate between islands.

It is up to you, the ʻulili, to explore and discover stars in order to return the key constellations to the four major quadrants of the night sky and restore the ability to wayfind.

 

Characters


 

Here are some examples characters that we have already created for ʻUkulele Meʻe!

Honu (Green Sea Turtle) 

 

ʻUlili (Wandering tattler, player character) 

 

Keiki (Young Child)

 

Story

In order to restore the stars to the sky, you go on quests which take you through Hawaiian legends and sacred narrative – remembering the past, the culture in order to move forward.

There are four star families. Each one has a few constellations and notable stars in them. This game will focus on the first star family.

 

 

Ke Kā o Makali‘i (The Bailer)

Ke Kā o Makali‘i is made up of five major stars that curve across the sky from north to the south. It rises from the east, scooping up the stars and pouring them into the sky.                         

In our game, this is the key constellation that has fallen from the sky. 

The player must restore the five key stars by completing four major quests.

 

  •  Hoku-Lei (“Star-Wreath”)

the name of the brightest star at the ‘akau (north) end of the constellation. Hoku-lei is also the name of a five star constellation that form a star-lei, with Hokulei being the brightest.

  • Na Mahoa (“The Twins”) a pair of stars

The player helps to break up a fight between Pele (a goddess associated with volcanoes and island creation) and Nāmaka (Pele’s sister, a goddess associated with the ocean).

The player will learn about the legends regarding these two sisters and restore some peace to their islands.

  • Puana (“Blossom”)

Lovers are reunited when two halves of the flower (one from the sea, one from the mountains) are brought together to form a whole.

  • ‘A’a (“Burning Brightly, Fire”)

The player learns about the secret of fire making, and how Maui originally stole fire. Alae ‘Ula (mudhens) knew the secret of fire, but kept it hidden. Maybe they’re also hiding a star?


Gameplay

Glide - The ability to soar through the air until you reach the ground


 

Jump - The ability to single jump, double jump and high jump

 

Ukulele (Ice, Fire, Spirit World, High Jump) - With your ukulele, enter 'ukulele mode' and strike combinations of notes to use magical powers!

 

Who We Are

We are Pocket Dimension Games, a group of students based out of Champlain College in Burlington, Vermont.

We started out as a team working on a project for Production 2: a class that combines game designers, producers, programmers, and artists and tasks us with spending the class creating a vertical slice of a game.

By the end of the semester, we realized we had something special. After a great test run of our game with the public at Champlain Games Festival, we discovered just how powerful a complete version of our game could be for educating people about Kanaka Hawaiʻi culture.

 

 

We began the process of forming our own independent studio for the sake of turning our student project into a compact & rich gameplay experience.

One of our team members, Kylie O'Keefe, is a native of Hawaii and has been, and continues to be, a cultural guide for the team throughout this project.  She is the Creative Director of this game.

 

Rad Magpie


This summer, The ʻUkulele Meʻe team is working under a new umbrella studio called Rad Magpie, a nonprofit dedicated to supporting underrepresented creators and radical interactive media.

Through this, we have been given the opportunity to work as a team outside of the college. Rad Magpie provides for us an office for us to work in, as well as invaluable mentorship & support from industry professionals.

Learn more about Rad Magpie here.
 

Project Timeline

This game has been in development since the beginning of the year. At first it was a class project, but we decided to continue working on this game into the summer. 

Many of our key systems and processes are nailed down -- we're just hoping to add even more content and story to the game. 

 

Alpha version of the game: July 23rd, 2018

Beta version of the game: August 13th, 2018

Stopping development: 27th August, 2018

Release date & reward tiers distributed: September 2018 

 

 

Why Should I Donate?

Pocket Dimension Games believes strongly in the power of games as a tool for education.

 

We intend on donating the completed game to a museum, cultural or arts organization focused on Kanaka Hawaiʻi culture. We hope they will be able to use it as an educational tool for teaching people about the rich and diverse culture of Hawaiʻi. We want to inform people about a not often talked about culture in a fun way and a video game can do just that. The funds will allow us to completely focus on the game as some members of our team work other jobs in order to afford daily necessities. With your help, we can fully dedicate our time to create both a fun and educational game!

 

Where’s My Money Going?

The funds gained from this campaign will be used primarily to pay our team members for their time invested in the game during our summer development.

Many of us are working full-time at other jobs, and funding will allow us to spend as much time as possible bringing this game to life.


The funds gained from this campaign will be used primarily for:

Purchasing software licenses for Autodesk Maya (a 3D modeling program)
Paying team members
Allowing team members to work more on this project than other full-time jobs
Contributing toward rent for workspace
 

Stretch Goals

If enough money is raised to extend production of this game, the quests can be extended out to include stars in and around Ke Kā o Makali‘i, for a total of 12 quests. This would complete one out of four of the major star families.

 

Follow Us!

Check us out on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram!

 

How Can I Help?

Please consider donating to our campaign and sharing it with your friends on Facebook, Twitter, email, or any other social media platform. Each share helps to get our campaign out there!

We thank you for any donation you can provide, no matter the size. To show our gratitude for any donations we receive we will be putting any willing donors names into the credits of our game, with the help of the organization that we work with.

We're excited to have the chance to bring our game to you, and we hope you're just as excited to experience the continuing development of 'Ukulele Me'e along with our team.
story_txt:
“To navigate you must be brave, and to be brave, you must remember” –Mau Piailug  What is ʻUkulele Meʻe?ʻUkulele Meʻe is an educational exploration game set in a chain of mythical Hawaiian islands. It immerses the player into Kanaka Hawaiʻi culture by allowing the player to explore islands, interact with characters, and learn how to navigate between islands by using the stars.In this game, the player takes on the role of an ʻulili bird however, the stars disappear from the sky, leaving the ʻulili and the people of the islands unable to navigate between islands.It is up to you, the ʻulili, to explore and discover stars in order to return the key constellations to the four major quadrants of the night sky and restore the ability to wayfind. Characters
 Here are some examples characters that we have already created for ʻUkulele Meʻe!Honu (Green Sea Turtle)  ʻUlili (Wandering tattler, player character)  Keiki (Young Child) StoryIn order to restore the stars to the sky, you go on quests which take you through Hawaiian legends and sacred narrative – remembering the past, the culture in order to move forward.There are four star families. Each one has a few constellations and notable stars in them. This game will focus on the first star family.  Ke Kā o Makali‘i (The Bailer)Ke Kā o Makali‘i is made up of five major stars that curve across the sky from north to the south. It rises from the east, scooping up the stars and pouring them into the sky.                         In our game, this is the key constellation that has fallen from the sky. The player must restore the five key stars by completing four major quests.  Hoku-Lei (“Star-Wreath”)the name of the brightest star at the ‘akau (north) end of the constellation. Hoku-lei is also the name of a five star constellation that form a star-lei, with Hokulei being the brightest.Na Mahoa (“The Twins”) a pair of starsThe player helps to break up a fight between Pele (a goddess associated with volcanoes and island creation) and Nāmaka (Pele’s sister, a goddess associated with the ocean).The player will learn about the legends regarding these two sisters and restore some peace to their islands.Puana (“Blossom”)Lovers are reunited when two halves of the flower (one from the sea, one from the mountains) are brought together to form a whole.‘A’a (“Burning Brightly, Fire”)The player learns about the secret of fire making, and how Maui originally stole fire. Alae ‘Ula (mudhens) knew the secret of fire, but kept it hidden. Maybe they’re also hiding a star?

Rad Magpie provides for us an office for us to work in, as well as invaluable mentorship & support from industry professionals.Learn more about Rad Magpie here. Project TimelineThis game has been in development since the beginning of the year. At first it was a class project, but we decided to continue working on this game into the summer. Many of our key systems and processes are nailed down -- we're just hoping to add even more content and story to the game.  Alpha version of the game: July 23rd, 2018Beta version of the game: August 13th, 2018Stopping development: 27th August, 2018Release date & reward tiers distributed: September 2018   Why Should I Donate?Pocket Dimension Games believes strongly in the power of games as a tool for education. We intend on donating the completed game to a museum, cultural or arts organization focused on Kanaka Hawaiʻi culture. story:
FOR FAQ'S SCROLL DOWN. 

 „Hunting on Myths“ ist ein Adventure MMORPG, das im Piratenzeitalter spielt. Hier kann sich der Spieler zu Beginn des Spiels entscheiden, ob er als Teil der Royal Navy, Händler oder Pirat in das Abenteuer eintauchen möchte. Je nach gewählter Klasse gibt es unterschiedliche Startpunkte auf der Karte, die der Spieler auswählen kann. Zum Schluss wird noch ein Schiff gebaut und schon kann es nach einer kleinen Umfrage, die sich auf die persönlichen Quests auswirkt, losgehen. Das Spiel kann entweder mit Maus und Tastatur oder einem Game Pad gespielt werden.

In den Städten kann man bei den NPCs Aufgaben (Quests) annehmen und nach erfolgreichem Abschluss wieder abgeben. Außerdem kann man neue Teile wie Segel, Flaggen, Rumpf, Kanonen für sein Schiff, wie auch weitere Schiffe an Land erwerben und in einer Werft die Teile an seinem Schiff anbringen lassen. Außerdem steht es jedem frei, das Land auf eigene Faust zu erkunden. Vielleicht stößt man ja etwas außerhalb auf eine bisher unentdeckte Höhle…

Auf See befindet sich das Schlachtfeld, auf dem sich die Piraten mit der Royal Navy anlegen oder auch gemeinsam als Gilde in den Kampf gegen einen Killerwal ziehen können. Doch auch die Händler sind mit Kanonen bewaffnet unterwegs, um ihre Waren vor den Piraten zu schützen und unbeschadet ans Ziel gelangen zu können.

 

  „Hunting on Myths“ is an adventure MMORPG playing in the pirate age. At the beginning of the game the player can decide to enter the adventure as part of the Royal Navy, tradesmen or a pirate. The player can choose one of the own start points on the map, which every group has. At least a ship’s getting build and after a view questions, which have an effect on the personal quests, you can start the game.

The game can be played with mouse and keyboard or gamepad.

In the cities you can accept tasks (quests) at an NPC and return after successful completion. You an buy new parts for your ship linke sails, flags, bodies, canons and also more Ships. Your ship can get redesigned and equipped in a dockyard. In addition you can discover the whole island. Maybe you can find a cave a little distance outside.

At sea is the battlefield where pirates can fight against the Royal navy or attack the big orca together with their guilds. And also the tradesmen are armed with little canons to protect their goods against the pirates to arrive at their destination.

 

Thema: „Piraten“

Setting: Piraten, 17. Jahrhundert, Vogelperspektive, 3rd Person, 1st Person

Genre: Adventure MMORPG

Betriebssyteme

  • Microsoft Windows
  • Mac OS
  • Linux

Releaseplattform

  • Steam

 

 Vor langer, langer Zeit gab es einen ganz besonderen Schatz. Niemand weiß heute mehr, wie dieser genau aussah oder wofür er gedacht war, aber jeder kennt die Geschichte, wie alles begann…

Eine Gruppe Kundschafter machte sich einst auf den Weg, fremde Länder zu entdecken und zu erkunden. Dabei machten sie auf einer kleinen Insel eine einzigartige Entdeckung: Sie fanden einen Schatz, der so mächtig war, dass er selbst die Krone Englands in den Schatten stellte. Schnell waren sich die Kundschafter einig, diesen Schatz zu nutzen, um nicht weiter von der Krone abhängig zu sein. Sie versteckten ihn tief im Innern der unentdeckten Insel und beschlossen, dieses Paradies als neue Heimat anzusehen.

Schnell wurde den Kundschaftern klar, dass sie nicht länger nur mit den Rohstoffen der Insel überleben könnten. Also beschlossen sie, eine weitere Insel aufzusuchen, an der sich eine Handelsroute befindet. Doch der Schatz möge bewacht bleiben und so ließen die Erkunder einen Freiwilligen zurück, der dafür sorgen würde, dass der Schatz in seinem Versteck gut behütet war.

Eine weitere Insel, an welcher oft eine Handelsflotte vorbei fuhr, war schnell gefunden und so ließen sich die Kundschafter dort nieder. Als auch hier die ersten Rohstoffe anfingen, knapp zu werden, fingen sie an, die Händler zu überfallen und die Waren zu plündern. Schließlich musste für Nachschub gesorgt werden. So waren die ersten Piraten geboren.

Doch die häufigen Angriffe auf die Handelsflotten blieben nicht unbemerkt. Schon wenige Monate später rückte die Royal Navy aus, um dem entgegen zu wirken und den Piraten Einhalt zu gebieten. In der Zwischenzeit hatten ein paar Händler ein Abkommen mit den Piraten vereinbart, welches die Handelsschiffe unbeschadet lassen würde, solange auch Handel mit den Piraten betrieben werde.

So entstand ein Krieg zwischen den Piraten und der Navy, der bis heute andauert. Die Generationen kamen und gingen und mit der Zeit geriet die unentdeckte, paradiesische Insel, wie auch der mystische Schatz in Vergessenheit und blieb lediglich als mündliche Überlieferung bestehen.

 

 A long long time ago there has been a very special treasure. Today noone ever knows, how it does look like or why it has been. But everyone knows the story of the beginning...

Once a group of scouts set off to find foreign territories and discover them. So they detect something unique on an isle: They found a treasure, so mighty, that it outshined the queen herself.

A short time after the scouts have agreed on using the treasure to get independent. So they've hidden it deep inside the undetected Isle and decided to call this paradise their new home.

A view weeks later the scouts were clear in their mind, that they couldn't survive only with the ressources of the isle. Then they decided to search for a new island with an existing trading route nearby. But the treasure had still to be watched and so the scouts let a volunteer stay to keep a jelous watch over the treasure while the others have left the isle.

Another island with an trading route nearby has been found quickly and the scouts settled down. When the first ressources ran short on the new island, too, the scouts began to hi-jack the first trading ships and reaved their goods to save the supplies. So the first pirates were born.

But the frequent attacks on the trading ships haven't been unnoticed. Already a view months  

later the Royal Navy got ready to fight against the pirates. Within this time a view tradesmen got a contract with the pirates. The ships gotn't damage as long as they've been merchandising with the pirates.

That's how todays' war between the pirates and the Royal Navy began. The generations have been coming and going and over the decades the undetected, paradisiac isle with the mystical treasure fell into oblivion. There only was an oral tradition about this story.

 

 Es stehen verschiedene Piratenbuchten für den Eintritt in das Abenteuer zur Auswahl. Als Pirat muss man sich um die Versorgung kümmern, indem man andere Schiffe überfällt und entert. Natürlich sitzt einem dabei auch die Royal Navy im Nacken, die stetig versucht, die Piraten an ihrem Vorhaben zu hindern.

  • Kann nicht in Häfen der Royal Navy einfahren
  • Schiff ist mit Kanonen ausgestattet

 

 At the beginning you can choose one of a view pirate bays to launch the adventure. As a pirate you have to take care of your supplies by robbing and boarding other ships. But pay attention to the Royal Navy!

  • Can't visit harbours of the Royal Navy
  • Ship has canons to fight

 

 Es stehen verschiedene Stützpunkte der Royal Navy für den Eintritt in das Abenteuer zur Auswahl. Als Teil der Royal Navy hat man die Hauptaufgabe, das Land von Piraten zu befreien und für Frieden und Sicherheit in der Welt zu sorgen.

  • Kann nicht in Häfen der Piraten einfahren
  • Schiff ist mit Kanonen ausgestattet

 

 At the beginning you can choose one of a view bases of the Royal Navy to launch the adventure. As part of the Royal Navy you'll have the main task to relieve the country of the pirates and ensure peace and safe the world.

  • Can't visit harbours of the pirates
  • Ship has canons to fight

 

 Als Händler ist man unabhängig und hat freien Zugang zu den Stützpunkten der Royal Navy, als auch zu den Piraten buchten. Doch auch ein Händler muss sich auf den ein oder anderen Kampf gegen andere Schiffe einstellen. Daher sollte ein Händler seine Waren mit Bedacht verkaufen. Denn sobald er eine Fraktion durch einen Handel unterstützt hat, bekommt der Händler ein schlechteres Ansehen bei der anderen Fraktion.

  • Händlerwert von -50 bis 50 möglich
  • Zu Spielbeginn liegt der Händlerwert bei 0
  • Pro Handel mit Piraten geht der Wert -1
  • Pro Handel mit er Royal Navy geht der Wert +1
  • Bei einem Wert von -5 bis 50 darf man in die Häfen der Royal Navy einfahren
  • Bei einem Wert von -50 bis 5 darf man in die Häfen der Piraten einfahren
  • Mit Beitritt in eine Piratengilde geht der Wert -15
  • Mit Beitritt in eine Gilde der Royal Navy geht der Wert +15
  • Mit Beitritt in eine Handelsgilde geht der Wert bis zu 10 Einheiten gegen 0
  • Nach Beitritt einer Gilde durch den Spieler (der automatische Eintritt durch einen Gildenpass zählt in diesem Falle nicht!) ist der Spieler 7 Tage für einen weiteren Beitritt gesperrt (um zu schnelles Wechseln zu verhindern)
  • Schiff ist mit kleinen Kanonen ausgerüstet

 

 As a tradesman you're independent and have free access to the bases of the Royal Navy and also to the pirate bays. But a tradesman has to fight against some ship or other. The goods have to be traded advisedly, because if you support a fraction by dealing, you'll get a worse prestige at the other fraction.

  • Trademan value from -50 to 50 possible
  • At game start: value is 0
  • Per trade with pirates: value goes -1
  • Per trade with the Royal Navy: value goes +1
  • With value from -5 to 50 you’re allowed to visit harbours of the Royal Navy 
  • With value from -50 to 5 you’re allowed to visit harbours oft he Pirates
  • By joining a pirate guild the value dropps down to -15
  • By joining a guild oft he Royal Navy the value rises to +15
  • By joining a tradesmen guild the value goes until 10 points to 0
  • After joining a guild by a player, the player is locked for 7 days to join a new guild (this should prevent fast switching; in case of automatic joining by a guild pass this locking doesn’t count.) 
  • Ship has small canons to protect

 

                                                                

Jean-Pierre Köhler, CEO | Lead Programmer             Lisa Riehm, COO | Head of Creative

       j.koehler@birnchen-studios.com                                                  l.riehm@birnchen-studios.de

Torsten Fergens, Lead Artist | Programmer

t.fergens@birnchen-studios.de

 

     

    Sounds, OST & Web Design     

     

Gaming Community

Gaming Community

 

 Was ist das primäre Ziel des Spiels?
Primär geht es darum als Pirat, bzw. Royal Navy mit Hilfe der Händler die Herrschaft über die Meere zu sichern und als Händler das Gleichgewicht zwischen den Fraktionen zu wahren. 
Das Besondere dabei ist, dass ein Händler zur eigenen Verteidigung nur eine kleine Kanone mit sich führen und bei wertvollen Waren Begleitschutz brauchen wird. Ein Pirat, bzw. ein Schiff der Royal Navy sollte einen Händler mit sich führen, damit Waren von geenterten/ besiegten Schiffen in den nächsten Hafen transportiert werden können.
An Land selbst findet kein PvP statt, außer man befindet sich in einer der dafür speziell vorgesehenen Arenen. Die betretbaren Inseln sind vielmehr wichtiger Bestandteil für das Questsystem, Handel oder auch den Erkundungsfaktor. 

 

 Was ist das Hauptziel?
Wie der Titel schon vermuten lässt, geht es in dem Spiel darum, einen großen mystischen Schatz zu finden und diesen dann auch vor den anderen Fraktionen zu verteidigen.
Das ganze wird im Laufe des Spiels mit verschiedenen Events und geänderten Content unterstützt.

 

 Wie genau wird das Questsystem aussehen?
Jede Fraktion hat ihre Ansicht der Hauptstory zur Verfügung. Wichtige Punkte der Geschichte sind hierbei in der Geschichte jeder Partei integriert. Neben der Hauptstoryline und verschiedenen Nebenquests wird es auch eine persönliche Storyline geben. Diese variiert anhand der Antworten des Fragebogens in der Charaktererstellung. Es gibt Aufgaben, die man direkt vor Ort, bzw. auf der Insel erledigen kann. Doch es gibt ebenso Aufgaben, die sich auf anderen Inseln oder auf hoher See abspielen. Hierzu gibt es auch spezielle Instanzen und Raidbosse.

 

 Steuert man jetzt einen Schiff oder Charakter? In welcher Perspektive?
Sowohl als auch. An Land steuert man den Charakter mit WASD oder Gamepad (Mapping anpassbar, verwendbare Controller u.a. XBox/Playstation/Steam) in der 3rd Person Perspektive. Später ist auch ein Umschalten in die Ego Perspektive möglich.
Auf See kann man das Schiff per Mausklick, bzw. über den linken Analogstick steuern. Mit WASD, bzw. dem rechten Analogstick lässt sich die Kamera über die gesamte Welt bewegen. 

 

 Wie groß ist die Welt?
Zu Beginn bezieht sich die Map (über anfahrbare Häfen lassen sich Inseln betreten) auf eine Seekarte mit ein paar wenigen Häfen und Inseln (für die Alpha sind bisher 15 Städte geplant).
Im späteren Spielverlauf soll die Welt von Contenterweiterung zu Contenterweiterung wachsen, bis eines Tages ein Globus (geschlossener Kreislauf) entsteht.

 

 Was ist unter einem Gamepad oder einem Controller zu verstehen?
Mit Gamepad/Controller sind unter anderem XBox, Playstation und Steamcontroller für PC gemeint. 

 

 Was enthält die Alpha Version, die mit dem Early Access heraus kommen soll?
Ein komplett spielbares Startgebiet mit verschiedenen Inseln für jede Fraktion. Außerdem ist die PvP-Funktion auf hoher See komplett integriert.

 

 Wie sieht es zwecks PvP / Konfrontation zweier Fraktionen in Gebieten "außerhalb" aus?
Da ist das Spiel klar definiert. Befindet man sich mit dem Schiff auf hoher See, bzw. mit dem Charakter in einer Arena, ist dort ein PvP-Gebiet. Häfen der Piraten, bzw. der Royal Navy können nicht von der jeweils anderen Partei befahren oder angegriffen werden. Ein Händler muss entsprechendes Vertrauen in die jeweilige Fraktion haben, um deren Häfen ansteuern zu können. Doch es gibt auch Häfen und Städte mit neutralem Boden, wo Piraten und Royal Navy freundlich gesinnt aufeinander treffen. Der Ideale Ort zum handeln oder Informationen austauschen.

Schnell waren sich die Kundschafter einig, diesen Schatz zu nutzen, um nicht weiter von der Krone abhängig zu sein. Sie versteckten ihn tief im Innern der unentdeckten Insel und beschlossen, dieses Paradies als neue Heimat anzusehen.Schnell wurde den Kundschaftern klar, dass sie nicht länger nur mit den Rohstoffen der Insel überleben könnten. Also beschlossen sie, eine weitere Insel aufzusuchen, an der sich eine Handelsroute befindet. Doch der Schatz möge bewacht bleiben und so ließen die Erkunder einen Freiwilligen zurück, der dafür sorgen würde, dass der Schatz in seinem Versteck gut behütet war.Eine weitere Insel, an welcher oft eine Handelsflotte vorbei fuhr, war schnell gefunden und so ließen sich die Kundschafter dort nieder. Als auch hier die ersten Rohstoffe anfingen, knapp zu werden, fingen sie an, die Händler zu überfallen und die Waren zu plündern. Schließlich musste für Nachschub gesorgt werden. So waren die ersten Piraten geboren.Doch die häufigen Angriffe auf die Handelsflotten blieben nicht unbemerkt. Schon wenige Monate später rückte die Royal Navy aus, um dem entgegen zu wirken und den Piraten Einhalt zu gebieten. In der Zwischenzeit hatten ein paar Händler ein Abkommen mit den Piraten vereinbart, welches die Handelsschiffe unbeschadet lassen würde, solange auch Handel mit den Piraten betrieben werde.So entstand ein Krieg zwischen den Piraten und der Navy, der bis heute andauert. Die Generationen kamen und gingen und mit der Zeit geriet die unentdeckte, paradiesische Insel, wie auch der mystische Schatz in Vergessenheit und blieb lediglich als mündliche Überlieferung bestehen.  A long long time ago there has been a very special treasure. Today noone ever knows, how it does look like or why it has been. But everyone knows the story of the beginning...Once a group of scouts set off to find foreign territories and discover them. So they detect something unique on an isle: They found a treasure, so mighty, that it outshined the queen herself.A short time after the scouts have agreed on using the treasure to get independent. So they've hidden it deep inside the undetected Isle and decided to call this paradise their new home.A view weeks later the scouts were clear in their mind, that they couldn't survive only with the ressources of the isle. Then they decided to search for a new island with an existing trading route nearby. But the treasure had still to be watched and so the scouts let a volunteer stay to keep a jelous watch over the treasure while the others have left the isle.Another island with an trading route nearby has been found quickly and the scouts settled down. When the first ressources ran short on the new island, too, the scouts began to hi-jack the first trading ships and reaved their goods to save the supplies. So the first pirates were born.But the frequent attacks on the trading ships haven't been unnoticed. Already a view months  later the Royal Navy got ready to fight against the pirates. Within this time a view tradesmen got a contract with the pirates. The ships gotn't damage as long as they've been merchandising with the pirates.That's how todays' war between the pirates and the Royal Navy began. The generations have been coming and going and over the decades the undetected, paradisiac isle with the mystical treasure fell into oblivion. There only was an oral tradition about this story.  Es stehen verschiedene Piratenbuchten für den Eintritt in das Abenteuer zur Auswahl. Als Pirat muss man sich um die Versorgung kümmern, indem man andere Schiffe überfällt und entert. Natürlich sitzt einem dabei auch die Royal Navy im Nacken, die stetig versucht, die Piraten an ihrem Vorhaben zu hindern.
Kann nicht in Häfen der Royal Navy einfahren
Schiff ist mit Kanonen ausgestattet
  At the beginning you can choose one of a view pirate bays to launch the adventure. As a pirate you have to take care of your supplies by robbing and boarding other ships. But pay attention to the Royal Navy!
Can't visit harbours of the Royal Navy
Ship has canons to fight
  Es stehen verschiedene Stützpunkte der Royal Navy für den Eintritt in das Abenteuer zur Auswahl. Als Teil der Royal Navy hat man die Hauptaufgabe, das Land von Piraten zu befreien und für Frieden und Sicherheit in der Welt zu sorgen.
Kann nicht in Häfen der Piraten einfahren
Schiff ist mit Kanonen ausgestattet
  At the beginning you can choose one of a view bases of the Royal Navy to launch the adventure. As part of the Royal Navy you'll have the main task to relieve the country of the pirates and ensure peace and safe the world.
Can't visit harbours of the pirates
Ship has canons to fight
  Als Händler ist man unabhängig und hat freien Zugang zu den Stützpunkten der Royal Navy, als auch zu den Piraten buchten. Doch auch ein Händler muss sich auf den ein oder anderen Kampf gegen andere Schiffe einstellen. Daher sollte ein Händler seine Waren mit Bedacht verkaufen. Denn sobald er eine Fraktion durch einen Handel unterstützt hat, bekommt der Händler ein schlechteres Ansehen bei der anderen Fraktion.
Händlerwert von -50 bis 50 möglich
Zu Spielbeginn liegt der Händlerwert bei 0
Pro Handel mit Piraten geht der Wert -1
Pro Handel mit er Royal Navy geht der Wert +1
Bei einem Wert von -5 bis 50 darf man in die Häfen der Royal Navy einfahren
Bei einem Wert von -50 bis 5 darf man in die Häfen der Piraten einfahren
Mit Beitritt in eine Piratengilde geht der Wert -15
Mit Beitritt in eine Gilde der Royal Navy geht der Wert +15
Mit Beitritt in eine Handelsgilde geht der Wert bis zu 10 Einheiten gegen 0
Nach Beitritt einer Gilde durch den Spieler (der automatische Eintritt durch einen Gildenpass zählt in diesem Falle nicht!) ist der Spieler 7 Tage für einen weiteren Beitritt gesperrt (um zu schnelles Wechseln zu verhindern)
Schiff ist mit kleinen Kanonen ausgerüstet
  As a tradesman you're independent and have free access to the bases of the Royal Navy and also to the pirate bays. But a tradesman has to fight against some ship or other. The goods have to be traded advisedly, because if you support a fraction by dealing, you'll get a worse prestige at the other fraction.
Trademan value from -50 to 50 possible
At game start: value is 0
Per trade with pirates: value goes -1
Per trade with the Royal Navy: value goes +1
With value from -5 to 50 you’re allowed to visit harbours of the Royal Navy 
With value from -50 to 5 you’re allowed to visit harbours oft he Pirates
By joining a pirate guild the value dropps down to -15
By joining a guild oft he Royal Navy the value rises to +15
By joining a tradesmen guild the value goes until 10 points to 0
After joining a guild by a player, the player is locked for 7 days to join a new guild (this should prevent fast switching; in case of automatic joining by a guild pass this locking doesn’t count.) 
Ship has small canons to protect
                                                                 Jean-Pierre Köhler, CEO | Lead Programmer             Lisa Riehm, COO | Head of Creative       j.koehler@birnchen-studios.com                                                  l.riehm@birnchen-studios.deTorsten Fergens, Lead Artist | Programmert.fergens@birnchen-studios.de          Sounds, OST & Web Design          Gaming CommunityGaming Community  Was ist das primäre Ziel des Spiels?Primär geht es darum als Pirat, bzw. Royal Navy mit Hilfe der Händler die Herrschaft über die Meere zu sichern und als Händler das Gleichgewicht zwischen den Fraktionen zu wahren. Das Besondere dabei ist, dass ein Händler zur eigenen Verteidigung nur eine kleine Kanone mit sich führen und bei wertvollen Waren Begleitschutz brauchen wird. Ein Pirat, bzw. ein Schiff der Royal Navy sollte einen Händler mit sich führen, damit Waren von geenterten/ besiegten Schiffen in den nächsten Hafen transportiert werden können.An Land selbst findet kein PvP statt, außer man befindet sich in einer der dafür speziell vorgesehenen Arenen. Die betretbaren Inseln sind vielmehr wichtiger Bestandteil für das Questsystem, Handel oder auch den Erkundungsfaktor.   Was ist das Hauptziel?Wie der Titel schon vermuten lässt, geht es in dem Spiel darum, einen großen mystischen Schatz zu finden und diesen dann auch vor den anderen Fraktionen zu verteidigen.Das ganze wird im Laufe des Spiels mit verschiedenen Events und geänderten Content unterstützt.  Wie genau wird das Questsystem aussehen?Jede Fraktion hat ihre Ansicht der Hauptstory zur Verfügung. Wichtige Punkte der Geschichte sind hierbei in der Geschichte jeder Partei integriert. Neben der Hauptstoryline und verschiedenen Nebenquests wird es auch eine persönliche Storyline geben. Diese variiert anhand der Antworten des Fragebogens in der Charaktererstellung. Es gibt Aufgaben, die man direkt vor Ort, bzw. auf der Insel erledigen kann. Doch es gibt ebenso Aufgaben, die sich auf anderen Inseln oder auf hoher See abspielen. Hierzu gibt es auch spezielle Instanzen und Raidbosse.  Steuert man jetzt einen Schiff oder Charakter? In welcher Perspektive?Sowohl als auch. An Land steuert man den Charakter mit WASD oder Gamepad (Mapping anpassbar, verwendbare Controller u.a. XBox/Playstation/Steam) in der 3rd Person Perspektive. Später ist auch ein Umschalten in die Ego Perspektive möglich.Auf See kann man das Schiff per Mausklick, bzw. über den linken Analogstick steuern. Mit WASD, bzw. dem rechten Analogstick lässt sich die Kamera über die gesamte Welt bewegen.   Wie groß ist die Welt?Zu Beginn bezieht sich die Map (über anfahrbare Häfen lassen sich Inseln betreten) auf eine Seekarte mit ein paar wenigen Häfen und Inseln (für die Alpha sind bisher 15 Städte geplant).Im späteren Spielverlauf soll die Welt von Contenterweiterung zu Contenterweiterung wachsen, bis eines Tages ein Globus (geschlossener Kreislauf) entsteht.  Was ist unter einem Gamepad oder einem Controller zu verstehen?Mit Gamepad/Controller sind unter anderem XBox, Playstation und Steamcontroller für PC gemeint.   Was enthält die Alpha Version, die mit dem Early Access heraus kommen soll?Ein komplett spielbares Startgebiet mit verschiedenen Inseln für jede Fraktion. Außerdem ist die PvP-Funktion auf hoher See komplett integriert.  Wie sieht es zwecks PvP / Konfrontation zweier Fraktionen in Gebieten "außerhalb" aus?Da ist das Spiel klar definiert. Befindet man sich mit dem Schiff auf hoher See, bzw. mit dem Charakter in einer Arena, ist dort ein PvP-Gebiet. Häfen der Piraten, bzw. der Royal Navy können nicht von der jeweils anderen Partei befahren oder angegriffen werden. Ein Händler muss entsprechendes Vertrauen in die jeweilige Fraktion haben, um deren Häfen ansteuern zu können. Doch es gibt auch Häfen und Städte mit neutralem Boden, wo Piraten und Royal Navy freundlich gesinnt aufeinander treffen. Der Ideale Ort zum handeln oder Informationen austauschen.

story:
MuniReality will be a website where people living with mental illness can freely share their stories without fear of judgement. In turn, these stories (which can be shared in the form of writings, pictures, music and videos) will be transformed into video games.

Disclaimer: Mockup of MuniReality Website
 

The games will be built around and modified based on comments and contributions from the community.

 

The games will be designed to visually emulate the mood and inner struggles of the people sharing them.

Disclaimer: Screenshots and video from "Depression Simulator", a semi-finalist in Stylist x Diet Coke Creators Collective, by Michelle Chen. The game was developed through collaborative stories collected via HitRecord.

 

We aim to make one game each month but it might take longer depending on the specific storyline or gameplay.

We want the games to be a highly collaborative process where everyone can be a part of. All contributors per game will be properly credited and we will have a revenue sharing system in place if the games become profitable. The games will be monetized through the “Pay-what-you-want” model so that it can be freely shared and be accessible to everyone.

 


Disclaimer: Screenshots from "The Predator", a Global Game Jam entry, "From Strawberry", an Indie Speed Run entry, and "Le Petit Prince x Mixed Reality",  an escape the room game that combines a handcrafted environment with AR and VR, that was exhibited at Maker Faire Taipei and a finalist for Taiwan's Digital 4C Competition. The games are developed by Michelle Chen and her team.


According to the World Health Organization, around 450 million people currently suffer from mental illness, making it the leading cause of ill-health and disability worldwide. But even so, more than half remain untreated. Stigma and discrimination are still the main reasons why people choose to keep it to themselves, as well as people around them not believing it is a “real” illness.

But mental illness is real. Depression, Bipolar Disorder, Eating Disorders, Anxiety Disorders, PTSD, OCD, Schizophrenia…. These are all serious and painful conditions, and it is important to make more people aware of this.

By making games from personal stories, we hope to generate interest about mental health that would not otherwise be achieved by simply telling people to care about it. We believe that the games will be able to better communicate the issue to more people because it is visual, interactive, and the games will be shared by the people whose stories they contain.

 

dibdib studios is a new gaming company incubated in London. “dibdib” is a Filipino word that translates to ‘chest’, where the heart lies. The company aims to create games that spreads awareness about important subjects and have a positive social impact.

 

Michelle Chen is programmer with more than 8 years experience in game development. She makes game and other things under the name purplelilgirl. She graduated with a degree in Computer Science from De La Salle University-Manila. She is a Toptal STEM for Women scholar, who pursued a MSc in Video Game Enterprise and Production at Birmingham City University. As part of her Masters by Practice, she made a point-and-click puzzle game about depression to promote mental health awareness, which became a semi-finalist in Stylist x Diet Coke Creator’s Collective. She is also a BAFTA Crew Games Member, STEM Ambassador and Women in Games Ambassador, who regularly volunteers at game industry events.

 

Michelle Co is a BS Psychology graduate from the Ateneo de Manila University and has a special interest on the intricacies of happiness and the resilience of the mind. Currently she is studying Graphic Arts and illustration at the University of the Arts London. She owns WilQuote Publishing, which has since published books on poetry and quotations. She is the creator of Bunster and Hariet, a webcomic about the happenings inside a girl’s mind, depicted by cute bunnies.

 

Anthea Tan earned her Doctor of Medicine from the University of Santo Tomas and currently finishing her specialization in Internal Medicine. As a licensed physician, she does not only treat the disease or illness but also focus on a holistic approach on the impact of the disease on the family, friends and the patient himself. She would like to educate people, create awareness, that will improve the quality of life and well being of a person.
