story:
MAJOR UPDATE

We recently collaborated with AI expert Ameen from INFINITEWARE to create a very special Artificial Intelligence to accompany our game.

Together we are working on creating and implementing a very special, never seen before Artificial Intelligence engine called SSAI (Subconscious Sentiment Artificial Intelligence)

SSAI is a magical piece of software that grabs your sentiment and behaviour as a player and feeds it into the game to give you a personalised gameplay experience.

As Musa, you the player have a direct yet subconscious impact on the behaviour of your little brother. Every player will get to explore this sibling dynamic in their own personalised way.

This has never been done before and we have great plans for the engine to give you really exciting gameplay.

This is another great reason for you to back our crowdfunding campaign, so that together we can bring this AI innovation to the world.

THE STORY

"Musa- a brother's story" is a story of two refugee brothers. The shows the journey that refugee children go through, using meaningful and engaging gameplay. 

The player plays as Musa, the older brother, who is now in charge of the care-taking of his younger brother.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT

"Musa-a brother's story" is a game that shows the journey of two refugee brothers. It's of the puzzle adventure genre, and is 2.5d. It is a single player game where the player is Musa, and is an examination of the sibling relationship
What makes the game stand out, are two things.
1. It highlights a cause that is very much a crisis of our age and is inspired by true stories (availed through partner agencies) 
2. It will employ a new AI Engine that will map players input behaviour and make changes to the behaviour of the brother NPC, based on this information. This includes indicators like effective exploring of the level, reading or observing in game material, button mashing etc. Thus we use a players subconscious choices to create customised gameplay.

GAME MECHANICS

There are three main game mechanics or gameplay elements that are in the game.

1. Musa is able to interact with his environment, including observing, climbing over, hiding etc. 

2. The game also employs quicktime events where players need to react fast, during running or adrenaline packed levels.

3. Musa is an avid inventor so part of the game play would be him crafting different items to take gameplay forward or just create toys for his little brother.

4. AI element that records subconscious behaviour.

THE PROTOTYPE

In the first level that I created, Musa wakes up in his house, his bedroom. It is partially destroyed. He is afraid and confused. He starts exploring the house, looking for his parents, while observing his changed environment and overcoming obstacles in the destroyed home. He does not find his parents, but does find his little brother, and then safely guides  him outside the house. This is how Musa's story begins, just like a lot of refugee children. He goes to bed just a normal child, and wakes up an orphan, a refugee and a guardian to his younger brother.

This is the level that was showcased at IGN. Musa could observe his environment, interact with it, search for his brother, and will be able to overcome environmental puzzles as well.

THE FINAL PRODUCT

Of course I know that this is a very sensitive story to share, and I don't want to do it in isolation or misrepresent it in any way. This is why I am currently in conversations with a global refugee agency to cover authentic stories in the game.  The complete Musa story will be a culmination of these authentic stories put together.

In order to tell you why I'm creating a video game about the refugee crisis, I need to tell you my story.

In 2014, I went on a short trip to Turkey, to volunteer at an organic farm. It was a difficult time in my life and I decided to do something to re-discover myself by being in nature and working with my hands.

I also happened to spend a few days in Istanbul, where I saw something I was not expecting. Numerous child refugees, and whole families living under a bridge. There were children on each tourist street, some entertaining the crowd for money, some selling trinkets to get by and some just begging. I still remember the boy who followed me over 300 meters at Taksim just because I didn't have any change to give him. He was barefoot, and it was a cold October.

All these children were refugees, and their memories and faces stayed with me. Upon my return I decided to donate more to the refugee cause, but I wasn't satisfied with my impact. I wanted to do more. I wanted to tell their stories, give them a human face, and a name, and allow others to see their journey. 

So I turned to video games. This was an art form that I was good at, and I decided to use it for impact.

You see,  I have grown up playing video games, they have been my escape for the longest time, especially in hard times. And a few years ago, I discovered a new genre of games, "indie" games, many of which were emotional experiences and really made me "feel" what the character is feeling. This opened my eyes to the real potential of video games, and I got into game development. I started creating short games, and even created an award winning game with my friends about depression. 

And last  year, I finally built up my courage to tell this very important story that was within me. So I created a demo of our video game, "Musa- a brother's story". I did almost everything, from the 3d modeling, to the animations, to level design, and even the music!

I also wanted to validate my idea, so I joined a gaming event, called IGN convention and had over 80 people test my game and idea. They all loved it, especially the music! And I feel more passionate than ever to continue this and to make an impact.

"Musa- a brother's story" is scheduled to release next year, in August 2019. And it will be released on the PC first, for both windows and mac, using the popular platform Steam.

I started work on the prototype in October 2017, and from now till launch, it will take around 16 months to create a polished game with around 4 hours of gameplay.

 

The plan is also to launch on mobile and other consoles by the end of 2019.

 

Since Musa is a story-based gaming experience, music is very important for the story to move forward. This is why we are in the process of creating a full soundtrack with at least 15 different tracks for the different levels and moods. 

You can listen to some of the tracks here. These are all original (voiced by me) that I created with the help of my good friend Henrique Carvalho. Henrique heard about my game on facebook and was very happy to be a part of this game and its music.

Here are a few of the tracks still being developed and refined.

 

 

Do I really think creating a video game can make an positive impact to the refugee cause? Absolutely!

People take positive action when they are driven by empathy. And video games as a medium is the best way to inspire this empathy. It's not a facebook video that you can skip or a news channel that you can change. This is an immersive and engaging medium that will show the story instead of telling it. Imagine having a deep understanding of this situation. It can change the way refugees are treated by residents anywhere. I am not trying to change policies, I'm trying to change hearts and attitudes.

But don't just take my word for it. There are two recent studies out by UNESCO that show a direct correlation between digital games and empathy.

Read these here:

Empathy, perspective and complicity: How digital games can support peace education and conflict resolution- Paul Darvasi, York University 

The limits and strengths of using digital games as empathy machines- Matthew Farber, Ed.D., University of North Colorado & Karen Schrier, Ed.D.,​ Marist College

In addition to raising awareness,  I plan to do to directly contribute, is to donate 2.5% of all sales revenue from the game back to the cause.

And finally, I plan to make this a collaborative work of art, with contributions from refugees themselves. This idea is still in the very early stages, and I'm in talks with a wonderful individual running business incubators for refugees, who could locate talent that could make this game even more enriching and at the same time, provide work to displaced people as well.

Here are 3 ways we will be creating impact:

 

 

So, don't underestimate the impact of your pledge amount. Your contribution can make a huge difference!

 

Why am I raising money?

Well, I am currently working on the game by myself and a little help from my wonderful husband and co-founder of our studio, Sajad Hameed, who believes in me more than anyone. But if I am to tell this story and tell it well, then I need to do this full time and put all my focus on this. I need to cover my development costs, and I need more people. I need a bigger team, so that we can give "Musa" the treatment it deserves.

 

I am raising $23,000 in this campaign. This is not enough to completely develop, market and launch the game, but it's a good start.

The amount that I am raising here is just enough for me to quit my job and direct all my energy to making this game a reality and making this my full time work. The amount will also allow me to buy a new PC to continue development. (I am still using my 8 year old alienware to type this, and developing the game currently). 

This amount is good enough for at least 5 months of development at the end of which we are going to complete a 3 complete levels, the proprietary AI engine in place, as well as the full story and game design plan.

Doing this full-time will give me enough room to work on the development as well as working on making the business sustainable, and raising more funds later on.

You can check at the bottom on what I plan to do, if we raise more than the campaign target.

And of course, you don't go away empty-handed when you contribute.

I have created some really cool perks, based on the amount you pledge here.

 

 

But wait...

I know what you may be thinking. Can she really do it? 

The answer is "yes,". All I know is that I have a lot more to lose here if I don't make this work. I am quitting my full time job as a consultant in a great company, and I'm certainly not a young man right out of college who will just join the workforce if this doesn't work out.

But here the things that will go right. I am 34 years old. I have over 10 years of experience as a leader and project manager. I have experience in marketing and consulting and I have developed an award winning game before. I've been making games for 4  years now. And this project is my passion, my life purpose, my calling. So I'm pretty confident that I will see through, and I can pull this off, with you by my side. 

ABOUT THE TEAM
I have a great team and partners around me. The main development is being carried out by me and my co-founder, Sajad Hameed. We are two lifetime gamers turned developers, who have created three short games for game jams. One of them was a platformer about a girl suffering from depression that won at the jam.
In addition we have over 15 years of experience in project management, leadership and marketing, which seems like an odd mix but which would be prudent to us hitting our target launch date, as well as manage the development effectively. We are also working with a leading AI partner.

OUR ACHIEVEMENTS
We have developed a prototype to showcase the story concept, art style and music and had this assessed with over 80 people to positive feedback.
We are in the process of completing our AI engine.
We have won three pitch competitions in our region for the same game, and gotten good local and regional media coverage, that you can check below.

https://www.thestoriesstudio.com/in-the-news

I also have other endeavors and achievements to my name. I am a black belt in Zen-Do kickboxing, and I am a certified women's crisis advocate.

All I need is a little bit of your belief in me.

Here is a plan on what I can do if we raise more money. Of course, I would love your suggestions on how else we can create an impact once we raise more.

 

Thank you again for your support on this!
story_txt:
MAJOR UPDATEWe recently collaborated with AI expert Ameen from INFINITEWARE to create a very special Artificial Intelligence to accompany our game.
Together we are working on creating and implementing a very special, never seen before Artificial Intelligence engine called SSAI (Subconscious Sentiment Artificial Intelligence)
SSAI is a magical piece of software that grabs your sentiment and behaviour as a player and feeds it into the game to give you a personalised gameplay experience.
As Musa, you the player have a direct yet subconscious impact on the behaviour of your little brother. Every player will get to explore this sibling dynamic in their own personalised way.
This has never been done before and we have great plans for the engine to give you really exciting gameplay.
This is another great reason for you to back our crowdfunding campaign, so that together we can bring this AI innovation to the world.
THE STORY"Musa- a brother's story" is a story of two refugee brothers. The shows the journey that refugee children go through, using meaningful and engaging gameplay. The player plays as Musa, the older brother, who is now in charge of the care-taking of his younger brother.WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT"Musa-a brother's story" is a game that shows the journey of two refugee brothers. It's of the puzzle adventure genre, and is 2.5d. It is a single player game where the player is Musa, and is an examination of the sibling relationshipWhat makes the game stand out, are two things.1. It highlights a cause that is very much a crisis of our age and is inspired by true stories (availed through partner agencies) 2. It will employ a new AI Engine that will map players input behaviour and make changes to the behaviour of the brother NPC, based on this information. This includes indicators like effective exploring of the level, reading or observing in game material, button mashing etc. Thus we use a players subconscious choices to create customised gameplay.GAME MECHANICSThere are three main game mechanics or gameplay elements that are in the game.1. Musa is able to interact with his environment, including observing, climbing over, hiding etc. 2. The game also employs quicktime events where players need to react fast, during running or adrenaline packed levels.3. Musa is an avid inventor so part of the game play would be him crafting different items to take gameplay forward or just create toys for his little brother.4. AI element that records subconscious behaviour.THE PROTOTYPEIn the first level that I created, Musa wakes up in his house, his bedroom. It is partially destroyed. He is afraid and confused. He starts exploring the house, looking for his parents, while observing his changed environment and overcoming obstacles in the destroyed home. He does not find his parents, but does find his little brother, and then safely guides  him outside the house. This is how Musa's story begins, just like a lot of refugee children. He goes to bed just a normal child, and wakes up an orphan, a refugee and a guardian to his younger brother.This is the level that was showcased at IGN. Musa could observe his environment, interact with it, search for his brother, and will be able to overcome environmental puzzles as well.THE FINAL PRODUCTOf course I know that this is a very sensitive story to share, and I don't want to do it in isolation or misrepresent it in any way. This is why I am currently in conversations with a global refugee agency to cover authentic stories in the game.  The complete Musa story will be a culmination of these authentic stories put together.In order to tell you why I'm creating a video game about the refugee crisis, I need to tell you my story.In 2014, I went on a short trip to Turkey, to volunteer at an organic farm. It was a difficult time in my life and I decided to do something to re-discover myself by being in nature and working with my hands.I also happened to spend a few days in Istanbul, where I saw something I was not expecting. Numerous child refugees, and whole families living under a bridge. There were children on each tourist street, some entertaining the crowd for money, some selling trinkets to get by and some just begging. I still remember the boy who followed me over 300 meters at Taksim just because I didn't have any change to give him. He was barefoot, and it was a cold October.All these children were refugees, and their memories and faces stayed with me. Upon my return I decided to donate more to the refugee cause, but I wasn't satisfied with my impact. I wanted to do more. I wanted to tell their stories, give them a human face, and a name, and allow others to see their journey. So I turned to video games. This was an art form that I was good at, and I decided to use it for impact.You see,  I have grown up playing video games, they have been my escape for the longest time, especially in hard times. And a few years ago, I discovered a new genre of games, "indie" games, many of which were emotional experiences and really made me "feel" what the character is feeling. This opened my eyes to the real potential of video games, and I got into game development. I started creating short games, and even created an award winning game with my friends about depression. And last  year, I finally built up my courage to tell this very important story that was within me. So I created a demo of our video game, "Musa- a brother's story". I did almost everything, from the 3d modeling, to the animations, to level design, and even the music!I also wanted to validate my idea, so I joined a gaming event, called IGN convention and had over 80 people test my game and idea. They all loved it, especially the music! And I feel more passionate than ever to continue this and to make an impact."Musa- a brother's story" is scheduled to release next year, in August 2019. And it will be released on the PC first, for both windows and mac, using the popular platform Steam.I started work on the prototype in October 2017, and from now till launch, it will take around 16 months to create a polished game with around 4 hours of gameplay. The plan is also to launch on mobile and other consoles by the end of 2019. Since Musa is a story-based gaming experience, music is very important for the story to move forward. This is why we are in the process of creating a full soundtrack with at least 15 different tracks for the different levels and moods. You can listen to some of the tracks here. These are all original (voiced by me) that I created with the help of my good friend Henrique Carvalho. Henrique heard about my game on facebook and was very happy to be a part of this game and its music.Here are a few of the tracks still being developed and refined.

 
 

Do I really think creating a video game can make an positive impact to the refugee cause? Absolutely!
People take positive action when they are driven by empathy. And video games as a medium is the best way to inspire this empathy. It's not a facebook video that you can skip or a news channel that you can change. This is an immersive and engaging medium that will show the story instead of telling it. Imagine having a deep understanding of this situation. It can change the way refugees are treated by residents anywhere. I am not trying to change policies, I'm trying to change hearts and attitudes.
But don't just take my word for it. There are two recent studies out by UNESCO that show a direct correlation between digital games and empathy.
Read these here:
Empathy, perspective and complicity: How digital games can support peace education and conflict resolution- Paul Darvasi, York University 
The limits and strengths of using digital games as empathy machines- Matthew Farber, Ed.D., University of North Colorado & Karen Schrier, Ed.D.,​ Marist College
In addition to raising awareness,  I plan to do to directly contribute, is to donate 2.5% of all sales revenue from the game back to the cause.

And finally, I plan to make this a collaborative work of art, with contributions from refugees themselves. This idea is still in the very early stages, and I'm in talks with a wonderful individual running business incubators for refugees, who could locate talent that could make this game even more enriching and at the same time, provide work to displaced people as well.
Here are 3 ways we will be creating impact:
 

 
So, don't underestimate the impact of your pledge amount. Your contribution can make a huge difference!
 
Why am I raising money? Well, I am currently working on the game by myself and a little help from my wonderful husband and co-founder of our studio, Sajad Hameed, who believes in me more than anyone. But if I am to tell this story and tell it well, then I need to do this full time and put all my focus on this. I need to cover my development costs, and I need more people. I need a bigger team, so that we can give "Musa" the treatment it deserves. I am raising $23,000 in this campaign. This is not enough to completely develop, market and launch the game, but it's a good start.The amount that I am raising here is just enough for me to quit my job and direct all my energy to making this game a reality and making this my full time work. The amount will also allow me to buy a new PC to continue development. (I am still using my 8 year old alienware to type this, and developing the game currently). This amount is good enough for at least 5 months of development at the end of which we are going to complete a 3 complete levels, the proprietary AI engine in place, as well as the full story and game design plan.Doing this full-time will give me enough room to work on the development as well as working on making the business sustainable, and raising more funds later on.You can check at the bottom on what I plan to do, if we raise more than the campaign target.And of course, you don't go away empty-handed when you contribute.I have created some really cool perks, based on the amount you pledge here.  
But wait...I know what you may be thinking. Can she really do it? The answer is "yes,". All I know is that I have a lot more to lose here if I don't make this work. I am quitting my full time job as a consultant in a great company, and I'm certainly not a young man right out of college who will just join the workforce if this doesn't work out.But here the things that will go right. I am 34 years old. I have over 10 years of experience as a leader and project manager. I have experience in marketing and consulting and I have developed an award winning game before. I've been making games for 4  years now. And this project is my passion, my life purpose, my calling. So I'm pretty confident that I will see through, and I can pull this off, with you by my side. ABOUT THE TEAMI have a great team and partners around me. The main development is being carried out by me and my co-founder, Sajad Hameed. We are two lifetime gamers turned developers, who have created three short games for game jams. One of them was a platformer about a girl suffering from depression that won at the jam.In addition we have over 15 years of experience in project management, leadership and marketing, which seems like an odd mix but which would be prudent to us hitting our target launch date, as well as manage the development effectively. We are also working with a leading AI partner.OUR ACHIEVEMENTSWe have developed a prototype to showcase the story concept, art style and music and had this assessed with over 80 people to positive feedback.We are in the process of completing our AI engine.We have won three pitch competitions in our region for the same game, and gotten good local and regional media coverage, that you can check below.https://www.thestoriesstudio.com/in-the-newsI also have other endeavors and achievements to my name. I am a black belt in Zen-Do kickboxing, and I am a certified women's crisis advocate.All I need is a little bit of your belief in me.Here is a plan on what I can do if we raise more money. Of course, I would love your suggestions on how else we can create an impact once we raise more. Thank you again for your support on this!

story:
Our history

We are a group of players who, after thousands of hours playing together, saw the need to create a new genre of video games with greater playability than many shooters offer today.

At the beginning of 2019 we decided to join forces to create World Titans War. Since then and until now, the group has grown and we have already achieved great milestones within the project that will make it possible for World Titans War to be played within the first quarter of 2021.  The project is at 60% development and we need your collaboration to finish it.

 

 

The game will be released in Early Access within the first quarter of 2021, but at the moment we already have a closed alpha active so that some members of the community  can have access and help us debug errors . and have fun playing World Titans War. If you want to access, you can do so by participating in this crowfunding.

 

Completed Goals after € 25.000 

 

  • Map of Europe with real form scaled with more than 500 km squares.
  • Two armies in the game
  • Simple resources integration.
  • Portugal, Spain and France designed.
  • Simple Construction integration
  • Transport vehicles integration.

 

Remaining Goals

  • € 25.000 - Half of the map of Europe in operation, 4 armies (USA, France, Germany and UK) with infantry, transport vehicles and 3 types of tanks, simple survival system. Construction of base camps and economic system through user interface. Allied AI to defend automatic points.
  • € 40.000 - We will include 1 army (Italy) and the remaining resistance faction in addition to expanding the army tanks from 3 types to 7. advanced economic system through interaction with NPCs distributed throughout the map.
  • € 65.000 - We will include the ships (destroyer and aircraft carrier) between 60 and 70% of the map of Europe in operation. Weapons constructions for the defense of camps, (nests of machine guns, mortars ...)
  • € 75.000 - We will include siege weapons to build in the field such as machine guns or mortars, a complete tank tree, in addition to including motorcycles for the infantrymen. Improvement of the allied AI to defend points, being able to manage it to define defense strategy.
  • € 100.000 - Complete working Europe map, 1 more army (USSR) will be included with the full vehicle tree.
  • € 150.000 - We will include the planes and the aviation squads in each army, more advanced survival system, including the construction of objects such as ammunition, boxes etc. And hunting. Day / night cycle and meteorology.

 

Description of World Titans War

World Titans War will be a game developed for a massive multiplayer PC platform set in World War II in an open, tactical and strategic world combining FPS action. Live the Second World War like you have never done before using the appropriate tactics and strategies. Collaborate with your army to win the war by advancing through the terrain inch by inch. Manage your financial and material resources correctly.

 

 

World Titans War immerses you in its open world just before the start of the Second World War, so there is no axis and there are no allies, you can fight on the side of any of the following armies:

- Germany
- UK
- United States of America
- Italy
- Soviet Union
- France
- The resistance

 

World Titans War is not only a shooter, it is a game that combines different genres:

- Survival
- Shooter FPS
- Strategy

 

All armies will fight for the conquest of Europe, in an open world of more than 500km2.

In the environment of World Titans War you will be able to enter the skin of a soldier, fight in the war as you have never done, evolving your character in the chain of command of your army, specialize in any of the necessary roles to lead your army to victory.

You will meet all kinds of enemies; both rival armies and independent resistance groups that will be managed by other players or by the AI.

 

Unique World Titans War Features:


Vehicles

You will have transport vehicles, logistics vehicles and combat vehicles such as tanks, airplanes and ships.

You will be able to evolve each one of them within a skill tree that we have expressly prepared so that each player can decide their specialty.

Will you manage to become a true gunner, airplane pilot or a great captain of a warship?

 

 

Weapons

Depending on the role, you occupation within your faction, you will have a basic kit of weapons that you can improve within an evolution tree. You will also have the possibility of obtaining weapons from other factions, stealing them from those who have fallen in combat or going to different markets with NPC's located all over the map.

 

 

Resources

They will be necessary for your conquest. You will be able to obtain and manage them, obtaining them at different points on the map; cities, towns, farms, train stations, enemy camps, etc.

You will need construction materials for the repair of your vehicles and the construction of your camps, fuel, food for you and your faction, ammunition to annihilate your enemies, medicines for your hospitals and money to acquire equipment, resources and improvements of weapons and vehicles .

 

 

Character Skills

Performing all kinds of actions will train your soldier by improving his skills, so you can become the perfect soldier.

 

Weapon upgrade

You will have an evolution tree through which you can improve and unlock new weapons.

 

 

Conquest of the Map

Your objective as an army soldier is to conquer the European map. To accomplish this, you must expel the enemy and occupy the different strategic locations; farms, towns, industrial estates, cities, etc., in each of the 144 sectors.

To achieve this, you will have to coordinate with your team or hire resistance groups to help you. Both your soldier and your army will get a financial payment for each part conquered. In addition to conquering a sector completely, your army will be able to increase the ranks of AI soldiers that will help you defend.

If, on the other hand, you have a rebellious soul and decide to be part of the independent groups of the Resistance, your objective will be to liberate the areas occupied by the different armies or to fulfill liberation contracts.

 

 

Building

Although every army has its main base, the logistics squad will have to build advanced camps that will serve to respawn the fallen in combat, vehicles and resupply the entire army etc ...

Additionally, each squad will be able to deploy field radio for the respawn of its team members as well as defenses and siege weapons to immerse you even more in this frantic battle, allowing you to create your own strategy in each attack.

 

 

Armies

The armies are made up of 56 members who are divided into different squads:

1 Logistics Squad
3 Infantry Squads
2 Maritime squadrons
2 Aviation Squadrons
2 Tank Squad

Resistance

Tired of following orders? Do you want to have more freedom?
The resistance awaits you, liberate Europe from the oppressors or act as a mercenary.

 

 

Working without the support of a nation is more difficult, but it has a greater reward, your skills will improve more easily but on the contrary you must be able to move and find your own resources, will you have the necessary survival skills to survive in a world in war?

 

Artificial Inteligence:

World Titans War will incorporate different types of Artificial Intelligence.

Artificial Intelligence of commerce and improvement.
They are NPCs that you will find in different stores on the map with which you can interact to buy and / or sell weapons and resources.
 

Allied Artificial Intelligence
They are soldiers that will help you defend your conquered points, but you must decide the deployment strategy.
 

Enemy Artificial Intelligence
You will find it in the form of rebel groups. Their intentions are hostile, fleeing will not be an option.

 

Mobile APP

You will have a mobile application that will be available for both IOS and Android; with it you can control the status of the game, being able to see which areas the enemy is conquering, the progress of your companions in battle and much more. You will also have the option of notifications to trigger alarms when different events happen, such as enemy sightings or enemy attacks.

 

Community

 

 

OUR WEBSITE

 

System Requirements

We have modelled our system requirements based in private testers. They are subject to change based on further development.

Desktop PC .

Windows 7 64-bit 

Quad-core Intel or AMD processor, 2.5 GHz or faster.

NVIDIA GeForce 470 GTX or AMD Radeon 6870 HD series card or higher.

8 GB RAM.

story:
GAMER'S ARSENAL

Battling it out on Smash Bros Ultimate with RYU giving one last HADOUKEN, but instead of a fiery fierce blue ball of death....POOF, nothing. Weak wifi is the culprit which then the game decides to disconnect you.  And if disconnection repeats, you're banned. 

Stable Internet Connection

Our Ethernet (RJ45) port will not let you down in an epic moment of battle.  A solid cable internet connection from your modem/router without any configurations. Literally, Plug and Play!  

 

USB 3.0 and USB 2.0 ports

Use your Gamecube controllers and pug in other devices into Stingray.

Plug and play anywhere

On the go travel adapter or for your 2nd HDTV.

Ultra lightweight and doesn't take up space in your backpack while traveling.

 

Stingray was designed by Charlie, Co-Founder of CharJenPro with my wife Jenny.  Hence, Char +Jen + Pro! 

With my vast knowledge of over 22 years in digital and physical design and my passion for tech,  and Jenny's sense of solving problems, we created Stingray.  Our family-owned company has developed Premium USB C Hubs and Adapter over 4 years.  We have vastly grown with an awesome community of CharJenPro users and would like to become bigger with the Indiegogo community.

Our supporters are the most important to us.  We will never forget that.  I hope you can join us and know this is a special moment in our lives that we are very excited about.

 

Over 1078+ reviews...

from our Premium USB C Hub on Amazon.  Got your attention? Great.  Reason I point that out because we are the best-selling USB C Hub on the market.  Trusted by tons of our users world-wide.  We have over 10 Premium products that help people's tech lives everyday.

  • MacStick
  • MacStick V
  • MacBar
  • MacBar E
  • Premium USB C Hub
  • Skinny USB C Hub
  • Prime USB C Hub
  • MiniStick
  • MicroStick
  • ...many more

We got USB C Hubs and Adapters on lock down.  Check our products out: www.charjenpro.com

Risks & Challenges

Depending on how many people are interested, we will still make sure we get your products in your hands in time!  In an event where we didn't anticipate a huge number of backers, then awesome!  We will work our butts off to make sure to produce and ship Stingrays out like our lives depends on it. 

To Our Supporters

Again, we know the importance of our supports and users.  We wouldn't be here, if it wasn't for our current CharJenPro users.  We treat them very good in awesome promo through our site.  If you think this project is great but don't have a Nintendo Switch, by sharing this Indiegogo project, that right there would be very awesome and I thank you in advance for that.

story:
The History of Onion River

The river that runs along the border of my hometown of Burlington, Vermont is called “Winooski”. Translated from Abenaki, the word means “onion” or “leek”. From the fiery foliage to the cobbled marketplace, every aspect of this fictional town pays homage to the beautiful city I grew up in.

For my Senior Thesis at the Memphis College of Art, I decided to create something unique. I have loved life simulation games like Animal Crossing and MySims since I was a child and knew I had the dedication to make something similar.

I had never programmed anything in my life but wanted to take on the challenge. I downloaded the Trial Version of GameMaker Studio 2 and got to work watching tutorial after tutorial and teaching myself how to make a video game from scratch. After a long year of hard work, the short Demo for my game was finally complete!

Now that Graduation has come, work for the final version of my game is just beginning! I hope to continue this project over the next year and finish it. As I am working alone and without sponsorship, I am in need of a way to fund my work!

 

The Goal

To keep on track, I am asking for a base goal of $2,000 USD. This money will be split between paying for the full licensed version of GameMaker Studio 2, obtaining a license subscription to the Adobe Suite of Products, a Grammarly Premium account for the game’s writing, and helping pay for a year of rent and groceries while I work. (I’m a fresh college graduate, after all!)

Should you decide to fund this passion project, you will gain access to exclusive content and perks only available to investors of Onion River. Whether your contribution is $5 or $500, your patronage will be greatly rewarded. For more information on perks, please head on over to that page for a detailed description.

 

The Final Product

The Demo version of Onion River, titled “The Brew”, includes a preliminary design for the player character, as well as a working design for “The Brew”. The player can explore the bar, interact with objects, and talk to Seamus. These rough mechanics are a reference point for how I envision the final product to feel and look like.

With some additional elements like skill levels, status points, and inventory, Onion River will closer resemble its inspirations in the Life Simulation genre of games. The final product will include all six dateable characters, a variety of character creation/selection options, as well as a fully explorable map with more locations. The game will be available on Steam for download, and supporters of this Indiegogo will receive a free copy of the game as one of their perks.

At the end of this year, by April 30th, 2020, I should have a fully finished and published game. Should that time arrive, and the game is near completion, I will release it and continue to publish updates and patches to polish it up. All backers will receive their free copies at that point.

 

How Can You Help?

Again, any and all financial support is appreciated. However, if money’s a little tight at the moment, but you really want to express your enthusiasm for my project, go ahead and share this campaign! Spreading the word about this labor of love will do wonders to get me ahead in the indie gaming industry. I personally know how passionate everyone can be about games like Stardew Valley and Undertale. I would love to see even a fraction of that excitement for my own game.

By following the Official Tumblr, located at https://onionriver.tumblr.com/, you can stay in the loop for all Onion River updates and content.

 

Your support means the world to me. Thank you for taking the time and care to invest in my project. I’ll see you on the other side!

story:
Dark Table CCG is more than just a card game. It is multiplayer card gaming re-imagined: Free-to-play, online 4-player, unrivaled instant deck-building, and a focus on social atmosphere and table politics.

 

 

Set in a grim Lovecraftian theme, Dark Table brings a unique strategic experience with up to 4 players battling in a free-for-all, using temporary alliances and mutual interest to get ahead. Select your leader and build your deck around it to survive the onslaught and claim your world.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

One of the great perks on Indiegogo is the option to Design a Card. You will work with the Doonamai team to pick the card type, traits/abilities, stats, and appearance. Let's show you how that process works:

 

 

Backers will first choose a card type from the options above. Then they will choose what they want the traits and/or abilities to be. Here is where there can be a lot of freedom as long as it fits within the game rules. Maybe you want an assassin, but also want an ability that makes it unique. This would be the time to define how that card will be used in-game.

Next you will pick what you want the Strength and Skill of the the card to be if it is a Unit. Our algorithms will adjust the skill, cost, and rarity with you to find a balanced medium that gives you what you want.

Finally, you will describe what you want the art to look like and we will get concept sketches from our artists. Once you pick the sketch you like we will progress to final card. Let's show you what that process can look like from a Backer that has already designed a card:

 

 

Here the Backer chose to create a Unit. He wanted an ability that would transform a low-power Unit into a very high-power Unit. We settled on a "Pay 7 to transform into a 13 Strength - 4 Skill Airborne with 'Deal 3 damage to Target' ability." Assuming a base Strength and Skill of 1 to keep the card cost down, the algorithm showed we could have the cost of the card be 4 Knowledge Points and have a Diamond rarity.

From there the Backer described the Unit's appearance as a purple dragon that started small and cuter in appearance, but actually had a hidden larger form that he would transform into. We sent that description to get concept sketches and allowed the Backer to choose which he want to see as a final product. After the portrait art was finished we were able to build the final card: 

 

 

As you can see, if you choose to Design a Card you will get to be involved with a lot of the process and put a unique spin on a card in Dark Table CCG. Your name will be added to the credits as the designer of the card and you will leave a permanent mark on the game. This is a very unique opportunity and once that won't be offered for long.

Now that you have seen what is being offered, it is time to learn how Dark Table CCG works, what types of cards exist, and how they function.

 

 
In Dark Table your health for a game is dictated by the leader you choose. Each leader has different amounts of health based on its rarity, enrage ability, and enrage cost. Leaders with low enrage cost will typically have lower health, so carefully craft your deck around your leader.
 
 

 

Each leader has specific “Enrage Abilities” that significantly affect the game once triggered. Enrage Abilities have different trigger types such as Knowledge Level, Berserk, and Bloodshed.

Knowledge Enrage Abilities required a certain level of knowledge be obtained in a game before the leader unlocks. For this type of leader, all knowledge points not used at the end of the battle phase goes into your knowledge pool toward the trigger. Knowledge Enrages usually have to stall the longest to get an Enrage.

Berserk Enrages require the Leader to be damaged down to a threshold health level in order to enrage and unlock. This creates particularly interesting mechanics which can dissuade early game damage to a Berserk Leader.

Bloodshed Enrages require a certain number of deaths in combat by your creatures, traps, or spells. Death of your own creatures counts toward the trigger. Poison kills after your Battle Phase do not count. Bloodshed makes for a very aggressive early game.

 

 

Strength of a unit is the amount of health the unit currently has and also the amount of damage it can do to another unit. As a unit is damaged its strength lowers, which means it has lower health and produces less damage. 

For example, if a 2-strength unit battles a 5-strength unit, the 5-strength unit will end the fight with 3 strength meaning it has 3 health left and can only produce 3 damage. Any healing to a unit restores its strength thus increasing its damage back up to the original.

 

 

Skill is the measurement of fighting experience of a unit. Units will only take damage in a battle if the opposing unit has equal or greater skill. Skill adds a layer of complexity to battles, requiring players to find ways to take down higher skill creatures.

Apprentice of Old takes no damage since he has 4 skill while Angel of Lucra has 2 skill.

Both units have 4 skill, so they deal damage to each other.

 

One method is to use the 3 skill tokens provided each round. These tokens can add a skill to a unit for the turn, which could possibly make a battle worth fighting. Only one skill tokens can be used on a unit per turn, and they are reset to the pool after all battle phases are complete.

 

 

Each unit can have a trait and/or ability. Traits are passive and can alter how a unit works. Abilities may be passive or activated and can usually do more versatile actions.

Walls are a trait that means it must be attacked first. They are a barrier or barricade between the enemies and your units/leader.

Heroes are next after a wall in being attacked before other units or leaders can be attacked. Heroes are usually enticing or extravagant and draw the attention of attackers. Heroes usually have low skill and higher strength

Airborne units can attack over walls but still just attack heroes first before other units.

Assassins can sneak around walls and heroes to attack units or leaders directly. They usually have low strength and higher skill.

Focus is a trait that gives a unit 1 skill when attacking.

Rally Cry gives all your units +1 strength when attacking that battle phase.

Frenzy means that a creature can keep attacking units that battle phase if it is not killed in battle. Hitting a wall or leader stops this effect.

Confusion reduces the skill of a unit by 1 when battled.

 

 

Spells and traps can also be played during the release phase. Spells perform an action during the phase, while traps are stored on the board after being played and are activated by a condition.

 

 

Dark Table is split predominantly into two phases, a release phase and battle phase. At the start of each turn, everyone's knowledge pool is replenished with a starting size of 10. Knowledge is used as the cost to release cards. During the release phase, players can release units, walls, and traps to the board. Any new cards are hidden from the enemies, while anything played in previous turns is shown. This phase happens for all players at the same time. The intent here is for players to be forced to make their own strategy without knowing what others may have played and reacting solely to that.

 

 

The second phase is comprised of the battle phases for everyone in the game. One player will get the battle chip at random in the beginning of the game and be the first to have a battle phase. Then, each player will have a battle phase in a clockwise rotation. At a battle phase, players can use units and spells to attack other units and leaders, if possible. At the completion of the battle phases, the battle chip will move to the next player in a clockwise rotation, leaving them to attack first next turn. This rotation of first attack can be a very unique mechanic that can be used for strategy.

 

 

 

Some of the most fun in multiplayer card games comes from the table politics that ensue. Players often make temporary alliances to change the advantage in the game or dethrone someone in power. Dark Table offers an Alliance mechanic to assist in creating table politics in a digital card game. You may select an opponent to alliance with, and then an opponent you want to fight. If the alliance is accepted it means that the players may be temporarily aligned in a target.  

 

 

The game does not force the alliance to be fulfilled, but those that follow the temporary alliance can earn extra in-game currency. The goal is to use this mechanic to plan attacks if more than one player is required to restore balance.

 

 

 

One of the features that sets Dark Table apart from other digital CCG’s is the ability to play with up to 4 players in a Free-For-All. 

 

 

The game’s alliance system allows players to make a temporary alliance with others in order to stop the largest threat on the table. This acts as a balancing measure when some players have better cards, but can also be a bluffing tactic to get an advantage.

 

 

One annoyance of other digital CCG’s is the reliance on packs, loot boxes, or endless grinding to build the deck you want. Dark Table takes a different approach; all cards can be bought with in-game currency, paid currency, or deck tokens so you can focus on the fun of deck-building. 

 

 

The hope is that deck-building will be similar to real-life CCG’s and less like a gambling experience that makes you sink a ton of money before you can play the cards you want. At any time you can build a deck using a $20 deck token, no matter the value of the individual cards, so you can spend your time theory-crafting and playing decks and not stressing about cost.

 

 

Roles offer a means to gain more in-game currency while ranking up in your favorite play-style and earning special in-game items. At the beginning of each game you can select between The Brute, The Joker, and The Strategist. 

 

 

The Brute will give rewards based on hitting face and dealing more damage, The Joker will incentivize being a troll and upsetting the game balance over winning, and The Strategist will value brooding combos and Knowledge gains. Mastering roles can earn you cards, skins, borders and other items that are specific to the role.

 

 

While other E-sports push 1v1 or team dynamic skills, Dark Table will offer a very new style of E-sport. Players will now have to learn how to survive in a 4-player free-for-all and learn how to use table politics and deception to win. These mechanics will be a shock to some, and a refreshing strategy to master for others. 

 

 

The idea is that Dark Table will mix some mechanics of Poker with that of CCG’s, creating more layers of strategy to the sport than simply knowing the best cards, combos, and what to counter. Where a 1v1 builds a framework for aggressiveness and constant board state dominance to win, a multiplayer format allows for large swings in advantage. This means that players may need to save power plays for the correct opportunity to maximize the outcome, without letting other's know what's coming.

 

 

Each ranked season will have an entry pass for purchase that goes toward the prize pool that season. During the game players will be anonymous so you can’t prioritize targets based on reputation. After each game the players will be revealed. Rank up by winning or eliminating other players. 

 

 

The farther you progress in a season the more rewards and achievements you will earn. Rewards for each season lock after that season, so player can earn unique card borders, backs, and more to be used as swag in future games.

 

 

In Dark Table CCG you will have the ability to create custom games if you want to play with your friends or if you want to organize tournaments yourself. 

 

 

This option will allow 2-4 players which can also aid in testing decks or if you want a more casual experience. Custom games will have settings to allow for longer turns if you don't want to be rushed. This may also be a more familiar setting for some of the physical card game players, or may be used as an alternative when your local game shop is closed.

 

 

Each player will pick a starter deck at account creation to play with until they earn enough to build their own. One leader of each enrage type will be available.

 

 

Dark Table CCG will start with a set list of around 200 cards, 16 of which will be leaders. There will be additional sets of 100 cards at a time that will be phased into the game over time and bring unique mechanics that will add to possible play styles and combos.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Doonamai has amassed a fantastic team of professionals to work on Dark Table CCG. Each has a background in development  and with this team we will create a powerhouse card game for years to come.

 

Kyle is the owner and Lead Game Developer at Doonamai. With industry experience in game development, mechanical engineering, software engineering, and business leadership, Kyle has excelled in his roles at coordinating successful execution of projects. Having a background in mathematics and probability and statistics, he was driven to create a CCG for those that enjoy a more social experience.

Website: www.Doonamai.com

 

Edd is a freelance UI/UX Designer, dedicated to bringing games to life through beautiful and functional UI and artwork. As an active member of the UK games industry, he is a regular speaker at Universities and events such as EGX, a member of the BAFTA Crew Games initiative, and was recently a juror for the BAFTA 'Young Games Designers' Awards.

 

Taylor Payton is a full-time freelance Illustrator living in Minnesota. He enjoys devoting large chunks of time to working and honing his craft. When he's not bending pixels to his will in Photoshop or cementing skills in his sketchbook, he's likely lifting, reading, or traveling.

ArtStation: https://www.artstation.com/taylor-payton

 

Tara Jayne Sands can be heard as over 50 characters on the original Pokemon series, including Bulbasaur, Richie, Jasmine, Oddish, and Tori. Other roles include Biscuit in Hunter x Hunter, Mokuba in Yugioh, and Kari in Digimon Adventure Tri. Tara has also voiced characters in a number of video games including Sonya in Fire Emblem Echoes and Fire Emblem Heroes.

Official Website: www.TaraSands.com

IMDB: www.imdb.com/name/nm0419760/

 

Graham has been composing music for nearly 10 years now, and in that time he's written a large body of work inspired by the work of H.P. Lovecraft. He's also written 2 feature film scores, many short film scores, and has had music used in audio books, games and trailers. Select Lovecraft inspired pieces have also been performed by the Washington Symphony Orchestra.

Website: https://www.grahamplowman.com/

YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/user/Plowking2

 

Howard has been working in audio since 2014, starting out in post production working for the BBC and becoming freelance in 2016. Since then he has worked on a wide variety of projects specializing in sound effects for games and animation including both AAA and indie games. Having recently worked on Death Stranding, he is also proud to have worked on two projects which gained BAFTA nominations for best audio – Marvel’s Spiderman and God of War (winner of best audio and best game BAFTA 2019).

Website: http://www.howardsinden.com/ 

 

We are using Easyship to process our deliveries of rewards and there will be shipping costs added at checkout here on Indiegogo. 

 

 

Disclaimer - These rates are subject to change before campaign end, with Covid-19 limiting warehouse distribution. Shipping would not start until late this year at the earliest, so hopefully there will be no delays. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Risks and challenges

 

Doonamai and its team has experience making games, but any large project such as this has risks. While being a registered Microsoft and PlayStation Developer, we have yet to be approved for Nintendo Switch. The hope is that with the attention of the project we can get Nintendo's approval. We also know that while Xbox and PlayStation will be easier to port to, Switch may take some additional work due to the UI changes that would be required to accommodate the handheld screen.

There is also the risk with building a large scale competitive game and tournaments. Luckily we are working with professional players and those with experience in card game tournaments. Together we will acquire the expertise and knowledge to ensure a proper player experience.

If the alliance is accepted it means that the players may be temporarily aligned in a target.    The game does not force the alliance to be fulfilled, but those that follow the temporary alliance can earn extra in-game currency. The goal is to use this mechanic to plan attacks if more than one player is required to restore balance.   One of the features that sets Dark Table apart from other digital CCG’s is the ability to play with up to 4 players in a Free-For-All.   The game’s alliance system allows players to make a temporary alliance with others in order to stop the largest threat on the table. This acts as a balancing measure when some players have better cards, but can also be a bluffing tactic to get an advantage.  One annoyance of other digital CCG’s is the reliance on packs, loot boxes, or endless grinding to build the deck you want. Dark Table takes a different approach; all cards can be bought with in-game currency, paid currency, or deck tokens so you can focus on the fun of deck-building.   The hope is that deck-building will be similar to real-life CCG’s and less like a gambling experience that makes you sink a ton of money before you can play the cards you want. At any time you can build a deck using a $20 deck token, no matter the value of the individual cards, so you can spend your time theory-crafting and playing decks and not stressing about cost.  Roles offer a means to gain more in-game currency while ranking up in your favorite play-style and earning special in-game items. At the beginning of each game you can select between The Brute, The Joker, and The Strategist.   The Brute will give rewards based on hitting face and dealing more damage, The Joker will incentivize being a troll and upsetting the game balance over winning, and The Strategist will value brooding combos and Knowledge gains. Mastering roles can earn you cards, skins, borders and other items that are specific to the role.  While other E-sports push 1v1 or team dynamic skills, Dark Table will offer a very new style of E-sport. Players will now have to learn how to survive in a 4-player free-for-all and learn how to use table politics and deception to win. These mechanics will be a shock to some, and a refreshing strategy to master for others.   The idea is that Dark Table will mix some mechanics of Poker with that of CCG’s, creating more layers of strategy to the sport than simply knowing the best cards, combos, and what to counter. Where a 1v1 builds a framework for aggressiveness and constant board state dominance to win, a multiplayer format allows for large swings in advantage. This means that players may need to save power plays for the correct opportunity to maximize the outcome, without letting other's know what's coming.  Each ranked season will have an entry pass for purchase that goes toward the prize pool that season. During the game players will be anonymous so you can’t prioritize targets based on reputation. After each game the players will be revealed. Rank up by winning or eliminating other players.   The farther you progress in a season the more rewards and achievements you will earn. Rewards for each season lock after that season, so player can earn unique card borders, backs, and more to be used as swag in future games.  In Dark Table CCG you will have the ability to create custom games if you want to play with your friends or if you want to organize tournaments yourself.   This option will allow 2-4 players which can also aid in testing decks or if you want a more casual experience. Custom games will have settings to allow for longer turns if you don't want to be rushed. This may also be a more familiar setting for some of the physical card game players, or may be used as an alternative when your local game shop is closed.  Each player will pick a starter deck at account creation to play with until they earn enough to build their own. One leader of each enrage type will be available.  Dark Table CCG will start with a set list of around 200 cards, 16 of which will be leaders. There will be additional sets of 100 cards at a time that will be phased into the game over time and bring unique mechanics that will add to possible play styles and combos.         Doonamai has amassed a fantastic team of professionals to work on Dark Table CCG. Each has a background in development  and with this team we will create a powerhouse card game for years to come. Kyle is the owner and Lead Game Developer at Doonamai. With industry experience in game development, mechanical engineering, software engineering, and business leadership, Kyle has excelled in his roles at coordinating successful execution of projects. Having a background in mathematics and probability and statistics, he was driven to create a CCG for those that enjoy a more social experience.Website: www.Doonamai.com Edd is a freelance UI/UX Designer, dedicated to bringing games to life through beautiful and functional UI and artwork. As an active member of the UK games industry, he is a regular speaker at Universities and events such as EGX, a member of the BAFTA Crew Games initiative, and was recently a juror for the BAFTA 'Young Games Designers' Awards. Taylor Payton is a full-time freelance Illustrator living in Minnesota. He enjoys devoting large chunks of time to working and honing his craft. When he's not bending pixels to his will in Photoshop or cementing skills in his sketchbook, he's likely lifting, reading, or traveling.ArtStation: https://www.artstation.com/taylor-payton Tara Jayne Sands can be heard as over 50 characters on the original Pokemon series, including Bulbasaur, Richie, Jasmine, Oddish, and Tori. Other roles include Biscuit in Hunter x Hunter, Mokuba in Yugioh, and Kari in Digimon Adventure Tri. Tara has also voiced characters in a number of video games including Sonya in Fire Emblem Echoes and Fire Emblem Heroes.Official Website: www.TaraSands.comIMDB: www.imdb.com/name/nm0419760/ Graham has been composing music for nearly 10 years now, and in that time he's written a large body of work inspired by the work of H.P. Lovecraft. He's also written 2 feature film scores, many short film scores, and has had music used in audio books, games and trailers. Select Lovecraft inspired pieces have also been performed by the Washington Symphony Orchestra.Website: https://www.grahamplowman.com/YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/user/Plowking2 Howard has been working in audio since 2014, starting out in post production working for the BBC and becoming freelance in 2016. Since then he has worked on a wide variety of projects specializing in sound effects for games and animation including both AAA and indie games. Having recently worked on Death Stranding, he is also proud to have worked on two projects which gained BAFTA nominations for best audio – Marvel’s Spiderman and God of War (winner of best audio and best game BAFTA 2019).Website: http://www.howardsinden.com/  We are using Easyship to process our deliveries of rewards and there will be shipping costs added at checkout here on Indiegogo.   Disclaimer - These rates are subject to change before campaign end, with Covid-19 limiting warehouse distribution. Shipping would not start until late this year at the earliest, so hopefully there will be no delays.          Risks and challenges Doonamai and its team has experience making games, but any large project such as this has risks. While being a registered Microsoft and PlayStation Developer, we have yet to be approved for Nintendo Switch. The hope is that with the attention of the project we can get Nintendo's approval. We also know that while Xbox and PlayStation will be easier to port to, Switch may take some additional work due to the UI changes that would be required to accommodate the handheld screen.There is also the risk with building a large scale competitive game and tournaments. Luckily we are working with professional players and those with experience in card game tournaments. Together we will acquire the expertise and knowledge to ensure a proper player experience.

story:
President or A-hole, which will you be! Challenge your friends to a local or online game of the popular drinking game using cards. But now you don't have to hunt down that missing card deck! Best part, is that there is no alcohol required (unless you want to)!

Start by searching for online or local games that you can join, or create your own. Either a drink or challenge is required as the game continues on! Challenges include comments, pictures of completed challenges, or a homemade challenge.  

The game follows the normal game rules of a player hierarchy, starting with President and moving down through A-Hole. Anyone can tell the A-hole to take a drink or complete a challenge. There are also rules that the president can create from a pre-populated list, or on the fly that the group has to follow. Any breaking of that rule will result in a drink. First one to get rid of their cards wins and becomes President! Last one is the A-hole.  

You can also sneak a pic or video of anyone during the game, while providing updates to Facebook, Twitter, or Google+.  

Get caught breaking a rule or being told to take a drink or to complete a challenge? You can purchase Trumps that cancel out that order and flips it on the person who gave it. Did you lose the last game and are now the A-hole? Purchase a boost and you are now one level higher, pushing that person down to A-hole! Coming Fall 2015!

story:
Prologue

 For long time, the gate between dimensions has been closed. Age of time passed. At several dimensions, beings had absolute power were born. And the gate has started to move. Beginning of Dimension wars... Mighty heroines can use only their soul power in the crack of dimensions. Their souls are crashing!



Platform

First release for window(steam). Next platforms are mac, psn, ios and android.



Dimension - Kedaronia


Characters - Mazda, Sraosha, Akarana, Alatum 

There is a war all the time on Kedaronia except 3 times. First, the great empress unified all kingdoms and fell asleep in secret place. Second, the conqueror came but suddenly disappeared. Last, the one come. And destiny starts to lead her.


Dimension - Pogenin


Characters - Teshba, Shusinak

Once upon a time there was the huge civilization. That time dragons came from the gate of dimensions and destroyed everything. From ash, bloody revenge is coming. 



Dimension - Phan


Characters - Narae, Sakura, Ryn, Lee yang

Phan continent is ruled by 5 martial arts grand masters and 4 assassin rulers. 5 masters have same power source. 4 assassin rulers are fighting in the dark.



Dimension - Vamerna


Characters - Vata, Spenta

Continent of wars, land of many great knights and mercenaries. Some are same side, some are opposite. Survivors are winners in this chaos.



Dimension - Raderia


Characters - Vahishta, Tishtrya

Dragons are Guardians of Raderia. They are keeping peace from ancient world. Also they are watchers for dimensions. One day they found the crack of dimensions and convened the dragon elders assembly.



You have to know this. In the crack of dimensions, you can control only essence of soul. You will do battle only with soul power. 


Soul explosion

You need to control your soul. Dodge from enemy attack and touch your soul explosion.

Your soul power is exploding. Break your enemy's soul


Lethal attack

You can charge your soul power from enemy's soul and use lethal attack.

When you use lethal attack, suddenly you can stand all kind of enemy attacks.


Boss

You can sense enemy's power, before she uses the soul storm.

It can destroy your soul essence. Dodge from storm.


Counter attack

If you have finished to charge your soul power, you can do counter attack.

You can destroy enemy's soul storm and strike her soul.



 This is our first project. From this project, we want to extend the world and story of dimensions. If our game succeeds, we will extend to 3D turn-based strategy multiplay, 2D rpg, comics, novel and animation. If you want to explore dimensions, join us.




All physical rewards are limited editions.





 From $220 perk to $10000, if we can be funded more 300 perks, we will pack our physical rewards in a designed box.





 Team Emiya always seeks a new funny point. From existing genre, we find it and we add it. We pursue to care tiny things during working. A new challenge always has a risk. Unforeseen issues can always hit a project. There is unexpected risk to every game projects in the world. Even if a small modification can bring us a risk, we will do our best for keeping our promise. We will bring best contents and funny game for you.

DONATIONS ARE *GREATLY* APPRECIATED BUT IN EXCHANGE FOR YOUR HELP, I AM HIGHLY SKILLED AT PROOFREADING/RE-WRITING (for all my student and business friends who have papers, proposals, & other business communications), ORGANIZING/RE-ORDERING (rooms, events, lives, etc), DANCING, COOKING, ACTING..IN MY SLAVE LEIA OUTFIT even lol ALSO, I STILL HAVE SOME S/M/L SIGNED SLAVE LEIA POSTERS LEFT ($15/25/35 each).. LET ME KNOW!! & MAY THE FORCE BE WITH YOU <3 

http://goldrushbeauty.wix.com/belle-goldrushbeauty

story:
Vexis-Hosting is a upcoming Game hosting company, which will be providing servers all around the world at blazing fast speeds with no lack of support. With several Mod-Pack installers & total accessibility.

All funds will be invested into purchasing new servers, and any company expenses. We have many donation levels which can provide you with special coupons & events to attend. Keep in mind, this may take a couple months to get everything setup and live.

We thank you all who donate, you're funds go to the future of Game hosting.

- Caleb B.

story:
My objective is to bring fun back too our youth and families with Electronic Entertainment Game.


My name is Kashani Aytch, Resident of New York City, I was formerly a business partner, in a website called (All My Hood Dot Com), I'm presently a Program Developer for The Gospel Party, an Interactive online website on www.harlemlanesradio.com, Every Sunday 7-9pm. I have five years experience, in Leadership Skills.


My purpose, and importance of this campaign is to raise $7,000, which is to (PROTECT) my creative idea & concept for my Invention. Especially when creating an professional sketched prototype. Also, it protects me from Marketing and Licensing Companies, Manufacturers, and Investors.

What I Need

The Contirbutors Achievement and Funding Finance Purpose:

  1. Patent Search $299.
  2. Professional Patent Drawing $399
  3. Trade Mark World Wide $499
  4. Copy Rights $204
  5. Provisional Patent $329, P.P. is only protected for one year.
  6. Marketing & Licensing  Company $200
  7. Utility Patent
  • Step 1  Preliminary Assestment Drawing $699
  • Step 2 Application $2,400
  1. LLC- Limited Liabilty Company  $499
  2. Advertising $1,472 

Total Basic Start Cost $7,000

The Impact

Your Contributions is going to (Flexible Funding Campaign) made through PayPal account instantly. I receive disbursement confirmation from Paypal with each, Contribution. After contribution been sent , My PayPal account will be (charged a 9% Platform fee by Indiegogo). If I meet my Goal of $7,000, Indiegogo  9% platform fee become (reduce) to a 4% platform fee. Example (9%-5%=4%) ONLY, if I meet my goal.  

Indiegogo refund, of  the 5% of the money will be sent directly to PayPal account  within 10 business day after my Campaign (deadline).

 So, this is why your impact so (Critically Important, as a Contributor).

I'm using (reputable) company (Legal Zoom) that I have used before, and was satisfy with their services.

Your's contribution will start a (safe protection) of my Invention which I will be able to achieve with your contributions.

I need your contributions  family, friends, and supporters.

Team Members

This is my first invention project but I have (systems) of a great Team. 

  1.  Willie Aytch- Production Engineer Time Warner / Digital Media/ Video & Audio/DJ/ Editor/ Bronx Community College
  2. Kenneth L. Aytch  Jr. -Web Developer/ Photographer/ Management/ Entrepreneur/BA Mount Saint Mary College 
  3. Pamela J. Bodley- Leadership & Strategic Management/ Team Building/ MS Manhattanville College/ and Business MaryMount College
  4. Vivia van Dale- Legal Assistant/ Humanitarian
  5. Jay Farley- Music Producer/Owner of Recording Studio
  6. Jacqui Graham-Professional Photographer, Graham Image/Entrepreneur/ Consultant/Language Interpreter/ Business Management-Monroe College 
  7. Lashanda A. Hall- Payroll Adminstrator/ MBA/HRM-Business Admin/HR University of Phoenix/ and BA North Carolina Wesleyan  College 
  8. Melody Harris-  NYCDO Educational Assistant/Arts/Entrepreneur/Bronx Community College 
  9. Kiesha Pittman- Prudential Investments/ JP Morgan Chase Manhattan Bank/Marketing- Long Island University
  10. Delon A. Radebaugh- Human Resources/ Entrepreneur/ Business Technical Management-Devry University/ Bachelor of Science-Practical Writing-Criminal Justice/Criminology-Metropolitan State College
  11. Delmarva Smith- Certified Travel Agent/ Business Administration- North Carolina Central University 
  12. Barbara Street- Marketing & Public Relations / Associates- Business & Marketing Lenoir Community College 
  13. Eddie Wilkes- Sketch Artist Veteran

My team members experience, expertise, and leadership skills is what qualifies me to gain your trust, I say please become a contributor to my Funding Campaign.

Risks & Challenges 

I limited my (risk and challenges) because I built professional (systems) around my Invention, which is my team members.  Those are some of the hurdles, and struggles that people face to be successful as business owners. It also cut the cost of my funding down dramatically through their start up (free) services, and being part of my team.

How I will deal with Risk and Challenges, I would look at my business, competition, and reevaluate what works, and doesn't.  calculate my charts, financial statements, balance sheets evaluate quarterly adjustment growth , fix the weaknesses that needs to be made, and capitalize on my strength, with meetings of my (professional systems), which is my business team members. Then, make my final adjustments, of hurdles, and risk factors and challenges that we would face like Customer Acqusition Cost, Profit and Profit Margins.


Other Ways You Can Help

Other ways you could show your support for me, (Kashani Aytch), future inventor is just get the word out. Through social media, word of mouth, and make a buzz about my Funding Campaign on Indiegogo. 

  • Reminder please use Indiegogo Share Tools, God Bless.
  • My contributors so far

1) Giavanni F.  2) Thelma A.  3) Willie A.  4) Kenneth A.  5) James H.  6) Samantha H.

7) Rodney B.  8) Delon Aitch R.  9) Jerry N.  10) Wanetta C. 11) Keisiva W.  

12) Jacqui G.  13) David Fowler H.  14) Yolanda T S.  15) Rich L.  16) Lewis W.

17) Kurt S.  18)  Cha Cha T.  19) Andrea G.  20) Rahsahn T.  21) Lamont T. 

22) Lisa Eddie-R.  23) Scottie W.  24) Ron W. 25) Roland S.  26) Elder Marsha B.

27) Precious H.  28) Aron M.  29) Jewel S.  30) Vivia Van D.  31) Craig H. 

32) Andrea Aitch O.  33) ShaSha S.  34) Lamont J.  

35) Lisa C.  36) Marsha F.   37) Natasha F.   38) Earl J. W.  39) Delecia M. 

40) Mickey A.  41)  Lady Lazelle  42) Richard B.  43) Kareemah Al-Amin

44) Damon L.    45) Babara B.    46) Lisa C.   47) Scottie W. 48) Merri B.

49) Keenan B.  49) Willie A.  50) Donnell W.

story:
Short Summary

Hello

My name is Dave but most of you know me as Coins. I write stories about people who find magical coins that grant wishes. Often these coins will grant the wishes in a way the wisher didn’t expect.

For more than a year now I have been looking for a way to bring my stories to the next level. I finally found a way when I was playing an old text adventure game from the 80s. With some help from a few programming classes I came to the conclusion that I could make these myself.

Now imagine a story where you are the main character. Your choices matter and everything you do can alter the story in unexpected ways.  You find a wishing coin and ask to be treated nicer and suddenly you’re a beautiful woman or a child. Maybe you change one of your classmates into a maid. Everything can happen once you set foot in the coiniverse (Coin universe).


What We Need & What You Get

So why do I need money? Most of the time will be put in writing the stories lines. This is all on me. I will put the time, the effort and my creativity into the story but I do need to be able to distribute the game online. But I know what you really want to know. What do YOU get for your money?

The game will be text only but through dialog options you will be able to choose your own adventure.

Any backer who donates 5 euro’s or more will get access to the game and even early access if available.

Every backer who donates 10 Euro’s will find their name in a special thank you during the games end credits.

For every backer who donates more than 15 euro’s I will make a special thank you video on my YouTube channel.

Every backer who donates over 25 Euro’s will receive the name in the game perk. This will give a random character in the game their name.

Every backer who donates over 50 euro’s will be contacted by me personally and I will make a personalised video just for them.

Now if you have deep enough pockets to donate 100 Euro’s I will give you the side entrance perk. This means that I will contact you and together we make a special chapter in the game just for you where you decided what happened. Only you will have that chapter of the game and the character that we create together in that chapter will be appearing in the main game.


The Impact

If this project becomes a success then it will not be a onetime project. I will launch a website where I will keep making games like this for everyone to enjoy.

The project may seem a bit barebones right now but if it passes the goal then for the stretch goal I will contact artists to draw images for the game and magicians for the background music. Together we can raise this project to reach everyone’s expectations.


Risks & Challenges

Now comes the annoying part. What can go wrong?

I’m a good writer but I’m not that good at programming. There is a chance that I need to hire some additional help to program the game. Luckily I know a few good programmers who can help me. I will keep some of the budget aside to pay for these people if need be.

What if I don’t reach my goal?

Let’s be fair for a moment. Indiegogo is always a gamble. There is a big chance that I won’t reach my goal. If this is the case then I will still make something. I may need to leave out a few options and I won’t be able to start a website. But even if I have to send out a choose your own adventure story instead of a game I will make sure all the backer will get something out of this.

Bottom-line I will make good on my promises!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t afford to donate or if you can’t afford to donate much you can still help me out. Share this project with everyone. Put it on Facebook. Talk about it on twitter. Whatever you can do to help I appreciate it.
