We would like to keep Anointed: Chronicles of Laftu growing an to make sure that the message reaches as many adults and kids as much as possible; so here is what we are planning to do if we manage to exceed our initial goal to aid Laftu on his adventure.

$12,500 – Game will be available on PC (Mac and Windows) + 1 Year free Manna for all backers.
Manna is a daily in-game gift that provides players with Pearls (in-game currency) which are used to purchase boosters.
$18,000 - 30 new levels, New Characters on mobile and PC versions.
$25,000 – Translations to French, Spanish, and any other 2 languages chosen by community.
$42,000 – Distribution of devices, game, posters and t-shirts to 5 local high schools and 5 local orphanages + 100 customized  stickers for every backer's orphanage of choice + goals above.

Risks & Challenges
The risks and challenges to this project are minimal as the game is 65% complete and with your help, we are on target for a September 2018 release date (Stretch goals will be handled in follow up releases) .
We hope everything goes according to plan without any hiccups, but in reality we cannot plan for every contingency. There are certain factors that could get in the way of progress (e.g international shipping issues, device testing). However, our goal is to handle any issues, should they arise in a professional manner by sending out daily messages via the Indiegogo updates thread. We believe in 100% transparency and you guys deserve nothing less. We at Yinola intend to keep every backer, fan and supporter informed by providing updates on a regular and timely manner.

What exactly can i do to help?
Even if this type of game is not your thing, why not contribute to the campaign? You will be aiding the distribution of this gospel project to kids and individuals all over the world.If you cannot or simply do not like games at all, don't worry...we love you anyway. But please help us spread the word and share this project with all your friends on Facebook, Twitter and via email.Thank you for reading until the end!

story:
Hello!
 

My name is Christopher Speciale and I am the lead software engineer at Dimensionscape LLC. Dimensionscape is a small software company with a passion for building video games and tools.

Growing up playing legacy indie games such as first star online and building our own games with the sources of its many iterations was a fundamental part growing up and getting into game development for a few of us at the company. Unfortunately, the game and the available sources are built and maintained with a dead software building platform powered by Shockwave. Shockwave not only remains a dangerous option for creating software due to its numerous and crippling security vulnerabilities, but there are also no legitimate ways to obtain it's primary authoring tool, Adobe Director. On top of all that, developing or editing shockwave content with director is grueling, difficult and most often results in poorly performing applications.

Second Star aims to kill two birds with one stone by not only bringing FSO to a completely new platform, but also improving on customization and performance of the engine in terms of front-end experience without having to delve into scripts and code.

Games will have the option of being published in 32 bit or 64 bit native code and the all new server architecture will allow for the same on windows, linux, or macOS.

Not only will Second Star boast optional 64 bit support and run on C++ at it's core, it will fully utilize the graphics pipeline of your system hardware to give the best possible performance on every machine.

Both client and server will support a robust and powerful scripting language based on the ECMA-262 standard called DimensionScript that allows full access to the internal API's that power each of these two main components of the engine's toolkit.  By design however, creators should feel confident in being able to build highly functional games based on the FSO series with only the user-friendly tools that are planned to be bundled alongside the engine.

The available tools that you'll find with the Second Star engine will enable everything from game customization to server and asset management, updater integration and much more  as support for the project grows.

The Second Star engine will not stop at just allowing the creation and porting of FSO based games, but will go on to enable the development much more, with features and options based on community feedback and results.

The best part of Second Star is the ability to ditch director and shockwave multiuser server and take control of your own games without the hassle and steep learning curves of confusing software. Because it is so intuitive and user-friendly, we hope it will enable more people to elevate their own ideas and designs by bringing them to life with ease and freedom you just couldn't get with Director and the source-code.

In April, Adobe officially ended support for Shockwave on Windows. Since then we have been concerned about what this might mean for FSO on future operating systems and devices. With Second Star, no one will ever have to concern themselves with this again and the engine will be free forever.

Porting FSO to a new technology has been something people familiar with the games have been proposing for many years and now there is finally a team willing to make this ambition a reality with the support of the community pushing behind them.

Every contributor will gain access to beta and experimental versions of the Second Star engine as they're available from the development team. If we don't reach full funding, we will continue on with the project, albeit at a slower and less direct pace, possibly leaving out extra or special features and expanded development as time and resources allow. Simply put, the more funding we get, the better we can make Second Star, and ultimately, the faster we can deliver it into the hands of eager developers.

Our longtime experience with FSO, its sources, graphics and overall properties combined with our expertise in multiplayer game and tool development leaves us well positioned in order to fully deliver on the Second Star concept. In this video, you can just see for yourself a sample of our underlying frameworks in action while testing capabilities of a port to mobile devices for a FSOS game: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9QmJ_xyxkKM
 

Remember everyone, support comes in many ways, so make sure you help us get the word out and let everyone know about the Second Star project on IndieGoGo.


Thanks!

 

Update 6/5/19 ***

As of this morning, our developer portal is live at https://secondstar.online

Update 6/9/19***

Web GL

The first experimental development release is almost ready.
Currently the Engine can build games for the browser and Windows, don't worry mac users, we're working on it! We will send out download links for the development release as soon as some critical bugs are fixed. Until then, you can see progress by checking out :

http://fso1.client.secondstar.online/

http://fso2.client.secondstar.online/ (coming soon)

http://fsos.client.secondstar.online/ (coming soon)
